Name: Bitcoin Inc.
Description:
Bitcoin is an open source peer to peer electronic cash system. Because the code is open source, the idea is public domain and the name, symbol and concept is all considered a public good, it has functioned fully for 14+ years without a centralized entity baby sitting its existence. Bitcoin is not only an open source software project, a new digital asset within its own class, a peer to peer computational system, the largest computer network on earth, but it is also the bedrock of a new government, a new form of society & the foundation for a modern civilization.

Our company was formed to further that mission, that goal and that purpose of Bitcoin, without anyone permission or approval, to use the Bitcoin brand, name and technology, to fulfil the potentiality of Bitcoin. By creating the tools, products & services in the original vision of the Satoshi Client, we provide the essential parts of Bitcoin to the public, to institutions and the world at large.

Bitcoin Wallets
Bitcoin Nodes
Bitcoin Miners

operated & owned by our benevolent dictator Morgan Rockwell @Nodefather

Name: Smart Electric Power Alliance
Description:
The Smart Electric Power Alliance (SEPA) is a nonprofit organization that envisions a carbon-free energy system that is safe, affordable, reliable, resilient and equitable.

Our mission is to accelerate the electric power industry’s transformation to a modern energy future through education, research, standards, and collaboration.

Since 1992, we have led electric stakeholders to solutions and strategies for their unique clean and modern energy challenges. This is why we’ve provided three pathways with the tools and resources you need to move forward: Electrification, Grid Integration, and Regulatory and Business Innovation.

SEPA does not advocate for policy positions or lobby. We facilitate consensus around solutions and serve as a source for unbiased research and education.

Name: NETA - InterNational Electrical Testing Association
Description: The mission of the InterNational Electrical Testing Association is to serve the electrical testing industry by establishing standards, publishing specifications, accrediting independent, third-party testing companies, certifying test technicians, and promoting the professional services of its members. The Association also collects and disseminates information and data of value to the electrical industry and educates the public and end user about the merits of electrical acceptance and maintenance testing.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Doral Renewables LLC
Description:
We are a Philadelphia-based renewable energy developer, owner, and operator of renewable energy assets, operating all over the United States. Our solar and storage development portfolio of over 13 GW, including 400 MW on the verge of operation and over 900 MW under construction. We operate in 18 states and across 10 electricity markets. We currently have over $2.5 billion in long-term wholesale power purchase agreements with U.S. customers. The company has a global management and leadership that includes the Doral Group (TASE: DORL), Migdal Group (TASE: MGDL), Clean Air Generation, with further financial backing from Apollo Global Management (NYSE: APO).

Our development methodology puts our stakeholders, landowners, and partners in the middle of decision-making, focuses on the incorporation of agrivoltaics practices in our project, and facilitates strong relationships with the local community

Name: Net Power
Description:
NET Power Inc. (NYSE: NPWR) is a clean energy technology company with a proprietary process that uses natural gas to generate electricity while capturing all emissions.

NET Power investors and world-class partners are Constellation, Occidental Low Carbon Ventures, 8 Rivers Capital, and Baker Hughes.

Name: Ecogy Energy
Description: Ecogy’s platform provides renewable energy solutions that are distributed, de-carbonized, digitized, and democratized to commercial and industrial customers across historically underserved entities. We specialize in custom renewable energy systems, energy management and efficiency, and energy storage solutions that reduce costs and carbon footprints. Join us in creating a more sustainable and accessible clean energy future.

Name: NARUC
Description: NARUC is a non-profit organization founded in 1889 whose members include the governmental agencies that are engaged in the regulation of utilities and carriers in the fifty States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands. NARUC's member agencies regulate telecommunications, energy, and water utilities. NARUC represents the interests of State public utility commissions before the three branches of the Federal government.

Name: Guzman Energy
Description: Guzman Energy is a wholesale power provider dedicated to communities in search of affordable and reliable energy. We partner with cooperatives, municipalities, companies and tribes across North America to customize energy portfolios that make economic and environmental sense for today and tomorrow. Together, we are lighting the way forward.

Name: Generation Atomic
Description: ENERGIZING AND EMPOWERING TODAY'S GENERATION TO ADVOCATE FOR AN ATOMIC FUTURE

Name: Touchstone Energy Cooperative, Inc.
Description:
By providing the resources of the largest national network to local electric co-ops, Touchstone Energy helps our member systems strengthen their relationships with their member-owners. It is a national network of electric cooperatives across 47 states that provides research, communications resources, and employee training programs to help its member cooperatives better engage and serve their members. As a result, Touchstone Energy cooperatives are positioned to achieve superior member satisfaction and engagement to strengthen the cooperative, the communities it serves, and the electric cooperative community at large. Through access to targeted programs and a unifying national brand, Touchstone Energy cooperatives stand out as a trusted source of power and information to their 30 million member-owners every day. 

There is increased value to being aligned with a trusted national brand providing information for member-consumers to increase energy efficiency and use of new technologies. A network-wide digital communications effort focused on the cooperative difference reinforces the value of being a member and having a voice in your electric utility. Continued customer service training for cooperative employees ties to high member satisfaction with an average score of 85 in the American Customer Satisfaction Index (ACSI).

Our values and our promise: Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Commitment to Community. Touchstone Energy is a brand and network that reflects the gold standard for electric cooperatives.

Name: SparkMeter
Description:
SparkMeter offers comprehensive low-cost metering solutions for everything from rural micro-grids to existing urban central grid utilities. Our products help make access to electricity possible in hard-to-reach places and underserved markets. Our metering system is being widely adopted by utilities serving customers in rural parts of Asia, Sub-Saharan Africa, and Latin America and the Caribbean.

We believe electricity and the services derived from it unlock and create the opportunity for underserved communities to achieve great things. As a main driver of economic growth and human development, we’ve seen time and time again how access to clean, reliable, electricity transforms people’s lives.

Name: Northeast Gas Association
Description:
The Northeast Gas Association (NGA) is a regional trade association that focuses on education and training, technology research and development, operations, planning, and increasing public awareness of natural gas in the Northeast U.S. NGA represents natural gas distribution companies, transmission companies, liquefied natural gas importers, and associate member companies. These companies provide natural gas to more than 13 million customers in nine states (Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island and Vermont).
 
NGA was established on January 1, 2003. Its predecessor organizations were The New England Gas Association (founded in 1926) and the New York Gas Group (founded in 1973).

Its headquarters are in Westborough, Massachusetts; its R&D entity, NYSEARCH, is located in northern New Jersey.

Name: VODA.ai
Description: Manage your pipes effortlessly. VODA.ai is a software-as-a-service company helping utilities create project plans for mains and service lines with daVinci - the industry's most powerful AI engine that ranks pipes by Business Risk Exposure within 12 months and up to 20 years. The award winning solution offers a comprehensive set of tools - LoF, CoF, BRE, RUL, Insights, LeadFinder, LeadZero and Planner for Condition Assessment, Monitoring, Replacements, and Rehabilitation.

Name: ECG
Description:
Electric Cities of Georgia (ECG) is a non-profit organization serving 52 public power members in Georgia. ECG provides strategic and technical services to our members to maximize the performance of their utilities and, to a greater extent, create successful communities with economic prosperity and opportunity.
Our services include Engineering & Energy Services, Training & Safety, Joint Purchasing, Aggregated Services (e.g. bidding on Tree Trimming, Meter Testing, and Pole and Padmount Inspection), Pole Attachment Services, Hosted Solutions (cloud-based software to handle Inventory, Work Order/Fixed Asset Management and Outage Tracking), Analytical Services, Legislative & Regulatory, Economic & Community Development, and AMI Smart Metering project management.

Name: Peninsula Clean Energy
Description:
Peninsula Clean Energy is the official electricity provider to San Mateo County and the City of Los Banos.

Peninsula Clean Energy offers low rates and the added benefit of two electricity options, each with a different percentage of sustainable energy.

We are currently seeking highly qualified and enthusiastic individuals to fill a variety of positions. If you’re passionate about sustainability and the local environment, we want to hear from you! Be sure to check back in with us often as new positions become available.

Name: National Rural Water Association (NRWA)
Description:
The National Rural Water Association, with its affiliated State Rural Water Associations, is the largest water and wastewater utility membership organization in the United States of America. NRWA and its State Associations represent more than 31,000 water and wastewater utility members.
 
The association provides training, technical assistance and source water protection assistance to the rural and small utilities which comprise 94 percent of the nation’s community water supplies. This assistance is supported by the United States Congress and is provided in partnership with the USDA’s Rural Utilities Service, the Farm Service Agency, and the Environmental Protection Agency.
 
The NRWA and State Rural Water Associations also represent rural and small utilities in the regulatory and legislative process.

NRWA provides certification, on-line training and continuing education in live and on-demand formats through its WaterPro Academy (www.nrwa.org/waterproacademy/). The association also hosts the WaterPro Conference (www.waterproconference.org). NRWA members also have access to the largest online community of water professionals through the NRWA Community (www.community.nrwa.org).

Name: Damage Prevention Solutions
Description:
We are an innovative manufacturer of damage prevention and location systems for underground utilities. Our marking and warning tapes feature proprietary technologies and were developed to address the gaps in existing products and methods of locating and protecting buried infrastructure. 

Our products include Signaltape Underground Warning Tape and Tracetape Detectable Marking Tape. Learn more about our product offerings and customization options at damageprevention.com/products

Name: Global Power Supply
Description:
Global Power Supply (GPS) is a full service provider of new and used power systems including used industrial diesel generators, natural gas generators, genset enclosures, UPS backup power systems, automatic transfer switches (ATS), electrical transformers and electrical switchgear.

We are a full-service provider and deliver on fast-track projects. In business for over 18 years, we have differentiated ourselves by designing custom engineered solutions to meet your facility's critical infrastructure power system needs. Through detailed submittals, we streamline contractor execution including removal and decommissioning of assets, coordination of temporary power, custom fabrication of generator enclosures, and logistics of industrial equipment.

We own and sell new and used industrial generators from diverse manufacturers like Caterpillar, Cummins, MTU Onsite Energy, Waukesha, MQ Power, Hipower, Bluestar, Toshiba, Mitsubishi, Eaton and more. Combined with high quality fully tested used, refurbished and surplus equipment, we are a multi-vendor solution provider to commercial and industrial facilities nationwide.

Our power solutions team maintains and supports emergency standby generators and UPS systems for critical facilities like data centers, hospitals, surgical centers, telecom, water treatment, state county and local municipalities, wineries, and industrial farming. Get in-house engineering and design services including alternative energy projects, microgrid, and battery energy storage configurations. Get the answers you need to achieve renewable integration.


(800) 706-0906 Sales
www.globalpwr.com

Name: Kitu Systems, Inc.
Description: Kitu Systems accelerates consumer adoption of solar, battery storage, and electric vehicle charging by enabling a new generation of interconnection and providing communications and coordination capabilities to energy networks.  Kitu Systems software and SaaS solutions embed intelligence and control capabilities into renewable energy devices, aggregate their communication in the cloud, and securely interconnect them with utility and customer management systems.  Kitu Systems’ open and standards-based software platform provides the buildings blocks of new energy networks that are intelligent, resilient, adaptive, efficient and scalable.

Name: DataRaker, Inc.
Description: DataRaker’s mission is to harness all of the new terabytes of data produced by "smart" meters, combine them with legacy systems and other useful data to provide context, and distill it into useful information that can help utility staff and customers control costs from the power plant to the light switch.

Name: Resonant Link
Description:
Resonant Link delivers the fastest and easiest-to-use wireless power for applications big to small, from industrial electric vehicles to tiny implantable medical devices, to help people, businesses, and the planet thrive. Resonant Link is headquartered in South Burlington, Vermont, and has dozens of customers in healthcare, electric vehicles, logistics, and more, including the leading brands and government agencies.

For more about Resonant Link, contact: info@resonant-link.com
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Sharyland Utilities, L.L.C.
Description: Sharyland Utilities, L.L.C. is a Texas-based electric transmission utility that is fully regulated by the Public Utility Commission of Texas. We are committed to providing safe and reliable transmission services, ensuring operational excellence, and investing to support the infrastructure needs of the Electric Reliability Council of Texas grid.

Name: ECE
Description:
ECE is a team of professionals that take pride in what we do and consistently offer advanced and efficient solutions for executing all designs and projects as a client-focused company.  Our engineers and technicians are experienced with the latest software such as AcSELerator, AutoCAD, LightTable, PLS-CADD and WindMil.  We continually strive to exceed expectations with integrity, loyalty and competence. 

ECE has many qualified personnel with licensing as Professional Engineers.  ECE has personnel with PE licensure in the states of Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee and Virginia.

Name: Distributed Power Solutions
Description: Distributed Power Solutions serves a global client base to bring turnkey service to the distributed power needs across all industries. We understand the rigorous demands you face in order to keep your operation up and running – and DPS is ready to support you, anywhere in the world your operations take you. Whether it’s utility base loading, engineered micro-grid, bridge power, or an emergency power generation situation, we have the people and equipment to ensure all your power generation needs are met. Our unmatched product support services include design, engineering, installation, and operation. DPS brings the power of a global network, and the expertise and focus of a specialty rental business, to our global customers in order to solve their temporary power generation needs, safely and efficiently.

Name: American Pipeline Solutions
Description: We are a pipeline services company specializing in cleaning, assessing, coating, and mapping every type of pipeline. We operate across the country and Canada, with international partnerships that allow us to deliver the latest technology solutions to our clients.

Name: Utility Solutions Group
Description:
Utility Solutions Group is a manufacturer of utility equipment based in the Midwest and serves customers worldwide. We are proud to offer high-quality American made products, including natural gas regulators. It's our goal to make utility infrastructure more dependable and safe for utility customers and employees.  

Our talented team are experts on what utilities need to operate smoothly. Our customers can trust that we take the time to ensure all our products are built to be reliable, function properly, and to last for years out in the field. Our dedicated team works diligently to fulfill orders with the shortest lead time possible.

Name: Holland Supply Company
Description: Holland Supply Company sells gas products and solutions to the natural gas industry and has built a strong reputation throughout its 50+ year history. We primarily serve natural gas utilities, as well as commercial and industrial clients with high quality gas measurement and control devices. Our customers rely on us for our technical expertise and immediate availability of long lead-time products. Because we hold such a large inventory of product and the tenure of our staff, we are able to provide not only a better solution, but we can also offer it faster than anyone else.

Name: David Energy
Description:
Electricity that powers what’s next. 

It’s time to bring energy into the 21st century. David Energy is an electricity company built on technology to help homes and businesses run efficiently, at lower cost, and on cleaner power.

Our software integrates with smart devices like batteries, smart thermostats, and electric vehicles – bridging the gap between existing electricity infrastructure and modern technology to use renewable sources to their fullest potential. This makes electricity cheaper, cleaner, and more reliable, while giving you more convenience and control over the power you use every day.

Simply put, we’re here to make electricity better. To give you the confidence to focus on what’s next – not worry about how to power it. For lower bills, peace of mind, and lights that always stay on.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Buzz Solutions
Description: Buzz Solutions provides a platform for teams to manage and analyze data, collaborate, and export inspection results, fostering smart, stable, and resilient infrastructure inspections. We automate the process of infrastructure inspections for faults and anomalies by analyzing millions of visual data points captured by helicopters, drones and linemen in the field. Using our solution, our customers are saving immense time and money as a part of their inspections, while drastically improving the efficiency of their infrastructure inspections.

Name: utiliVisor
Description:
Building owners and Facility directors don’t have time to waste on partial strategies that don’t create energy savings. Systems that don’t consider the whole picture often result in silos of inefficiency.  Energy efficient solutions overcome these silos to generate and retain maximum energy efficiency.

It’s time to invest in actionable solutions. 

utiliVisor leverages real-time data, to provide building owners with comprehensive monitoring and metering solutions.  Our four-step energy management system takes the guesswork out of energy efficiency to give you the specific strategies that reduce costs while optimizing equipment.

At utiliVisor, we know that energy efficient buildings make sense environmentally and economically.

Get your specific solution at utiliVisor.com.

Name: San Diego Community Power
Description:
San Diego Community Power is a not-for-profit public agency bringing you cleaner energy at competitive rates.

We provide reliable, affordable electricity to nearly 1 million customer accounts in the Cities of San Diego, Chula Vista, Encinitas, La Mesa, Imperial Beach and National City, as well as the unincorporated communities of San Diego County.

Name: Archer
Description:
We help our clients develop and implement security and reliability solutions, mature regulatory compliance programs, and develop effective technology blueprints. Through our services, utilities assure compliance with new and ever-changing regulations and improve the security and resiliency of critical infrastructure while increasing operational efficiency.

With decades of combined experience in operational and information technology, we have the knowledge and skills necessary to help your organization tackle the most difficult reliability projects. We specialize in NERC Reliability Standard Compliance solutions (e.g., NERC CIP Standards; Operations and Planning Standards) with former NERC/FERC auditors on staff and several others that have served in senior management and technology roles at energy utilities.

Name: Utilities Technology Council
Description:
The Utilities Technology Council is a global trade association representing electric, water, and natural gas utilities of all kinds in their pursuit of resilient telecommunications networks needed to underpin the delivery of critical utility services.

UTC's almost 400 member utilities represent utilities of all sizes and ownership types, including the largest investor-owned utilities to the smallest rural cooperative and public power utilities throughout the U.S. Our diverse membership all build, maintain, own, and operate private telecommunications networks that enable greater reliability, grid modernization, and the deployment of distributed resources. 

In addition, numerous UTC utility members are deploying broadband connectivity to their communities and beyond. UTC assists its members through advocacy, meetings, education, and much more.

Name: A-Rent Test Equipment
Description:
A-Rent offers a multimillion-dollar fleet of test equipment from top OEMs, including Doble, Omicron, Megger, Fluke and HV Diagnostics, and an advanced cloud-based ERP system to enable smooth rental logistics and asset management. 

A-Rent offers NIST-traceable calibration services for a wide range of electrical test equipment on a 3 day turnaround time. Optional adjustment, repair and firmware upgrade services are also available for many items.

A-Rent prides itself on having the youngest rental fleet in the industry and our equipment is functionally tested on specimen apparatus before each rental. A-Rent is the source for the equipment and expertise you need to support your testing of relays, transformers, cabling, circuit breakers and more.

Name: LAND Energy
Description: The evolution of energy use through humanscale, connected batteries.

Name: PuriChem
Description:
PuriChem is an engineering company specialized in design and implementation of integrated water treatment systems for various applications in the following fields:

-Process water Purification & Filtration units.
-Ion Exchange units and media.
-Desalination systems and accessories.
-Various filtration and purification media.
-Central potable water Purification units.
-Water disinfection systems.
-Water treatment chemicals and control systems.
-Industrial waste water treatment systems.
-Accessories for industrial and laboratories applications.

Systems engineered by PuriChem are designed according to the latest up to-date techniques and represent the world's best manufactures in water treatment industry. We offer our clients: Evaluations for new & existing systems including Design Details & Recommendations. Technical Training, & 24/7 Technical Support.

Name: Wildcat Power Gen
Description:
Leading The Charge To Provide Better Power

Wildcat Power Gen is an American manufacturer of power generation products that is leading the charge by providing better power solutions.

The Wildcat product line is designed for commercial and military applications and engineered for a 10,000+ hour lifecycle.    

We believe that power solutions are an investment, not just an expense.  Wildcat Power Gen, together with our Wildcat Channel Partners, will help you choose the right Wildcat generator and Provide Better Power.

Name: Envirosight
Description:
When cities and contractors need to understand the condition of sewer infrastructure, they turn to technology from Envirosight. Simple to use, yet delivering powerful insight, our inspection solutions pinpoint obstructions, defects and failures in sewer assets. Using this information, cities can plan the cleaning and repair work necessary to maintain regulatory compliance and ratepayer satisfaction.

Focused on innovation and productivity, Envirosight products support remote teams, allowing inspection results to be shared securely on the cloud to enable advanced analytics and system-wide planning. Our full lineup of technologies includes sewer inspection trucks and crawler systems, zoom survey cameras, HD video nozzles, push cameras, automated manhole scanners and enterprise-scale asset management software. Envirosight supports customers through a nationwide network of regional training, support and service locations.

Name: Fern Engineering, Inc.
Description: Since the company's founding in 1967, it has established a worldwide reputation of excellence among users and manufacturers of turbomachinery. Fern Engineering prides itself on being a leading provider of parts & services for GE & Siemens gas turbines.

Name: Godman Power Group Inc.
Description: Godman Power Group Inc. (GPG) is an award-winning power engineering firm, and manufacturer of the Godman GRID portable renewable generators, made in the USA.  Godman supports the US Government, private sector firms, organizations, and governments worldwide. Founded in 2011, the company designs and deploys infrastructure solutions, focused on smart cities technologies.

Name: Silicon Valley Clean Energy
Description:
Motivated by a common interest in taking bold and effective climate action, twelve Santa Clara County communities came together in March 2016 to form Silicon Valley Clean Energy (SVCE), a Community Choice Energy agency.  SVCE  sources clean, competitively-priced electricity on behalf of residents and businesses in the participating jurisdictions of Campbell, Cupertino, Gilroy, Los Altos, Los Altos Hills, Los Gatos, Milpitas, Monte Sereno, Morgan Hill, Mountain View, Saratoga, Sunnyvale and unincorporated Santa Clara County.

SVCE sources carbon-free electricity, at a lower cost – allowing our communities to make large-scale reductions in emissions, while saving residents and businesses money at the same time. In addition, SVCE will advance programs for efficiency, demand management and fuel switching – to clean, carbon-free electricity in the place of fossil fuels used in transportation, buildings and infrastructure.

SVCE maintains a full-time staff, and is governed by a public Board of Directors comprised of an elected official from each member community. Member communities also designate a board alternate.  

By law, the agency is funded through program revenues only, not local government budgets. All revenues are returned to the program and passed on to customers in the form of competitive rates, local clean energy projects and customer programs.

Name: Base Power Company
Description:
Base is the modern power company for the electric era. We are building a reliable and affordable home energy service — powered by distributed batteries. Our technology supports the grid during times of peak need and protects customers during outages — for a fraction of the cost of other solutions.

Our team is made up of engineers and operators from some of the world’s best technology companies. If you are passionate about pushing forward cutting-edge technology and delivering world-class customer experiences — we want you at Base. We are headquartered in Austin, TX and are growing quickly. Visit us at basepowercompany.com/careers to learn more.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Zero-Emission Grid, LLC
Description:
Welcome to Zero-Emission Grid, LLC (ZEG) - Where Expertise Meets Ambition.

At ZEG, we are a powerhouse of electric power grid and markets experts, united by an unyielding commitment to the monumental task of decarbonizing the power grid. Our team is not just a collection of individuals; we are a force that's reshaping the electricity industry as we know it.

Our core ethos revolves around true collaboration, where we forge deep partnerships with industry stakeholders and cater to a clientele that is more sophisticated and discerning than ever before. We are not content with the status quo; we are driven by the conviction that a zero-emission, reliable power grid demands a relentless pursuit of efficiency, agility, creativity, and innovation.

The very essence of ZEG is rooted in the need to break free from the industry's inertia, including its policies and infrastructures, which have often responded sluggishly to emerging changes. We were born out of this necessity for transformation, and we are determined to be the catalyst for change in the power grid landscape.

When we established the Zero-Emission Grid team, we understood that we weren't the pioneers in the engineering advisory sector. However, what sets us apart is our unwavering aspiration to be the most trusted name in the business. We recognize that decarbonizing the power grid requires a wealth of regulatory, technical, and commercial expertise, and our commitment is unwavering—we strive to be the absolute best in delivering our core services and products.

Join us on this extraordinary journey towards a cleaner, more sustainable future. At ZEG, we don't just dream of a greener world; we are engineering it, one grid at a time.

Resource Siting & Risk Assessment
Market Analytics, Congestion and Curtailment Analysis
Grid Integration & Interconnection
Grid reliability & Economic Planning
Electrical Engineering Studies
EPC and EPCM Support
Owner Engineering
NERC/FERC Compliance
ISO/RTO Compliance

Name: SynchroGrid
Description:
SynchroGrid is a consulting firm for electric utilities that specializes in system protection, providing the exceptional level of talent, experience, and innovation necessary to enhance the reliability of the power system.

Our unique and unmatched system protection services can help you redefine your daily operations. Our services include the following:

•	Relay setting development
•	Relay coordination studies
•	Relay setting and drawing standardization
•	Substation design
•	Relay mis-operation analysis
•	NERC compliance
•	Arc flash studies
•	Wide area coordination studies
•	Customized software solutions
•	And more

In addition to our services, we also offer an innovative software, called SARA, that automates relay setting development and provides a complete solution for NERC PRC-027-1 compliance. Using SARA (Settings Automation Relay Assistant), settings engineers can now focus on the essence of relay settings development. 

We are a registered Texas engineering firm and have enjoyed increasing success since the company was established by our founder, Joe Perez, in 2012. Our clients include Bryan Texas Utilities, Oncor Electric, Cross Texas Transmission, NRG, Pattern Energy, Sharyland Utilities, and more.

Enrich LI Company: Tennessee Valley Public Power Association, Inc.
Name: Tennessee Valley Public Power Association, Inc.
Description:
The Tennessee Valley Public Power Association, Inc. (TVPPA) is the nonprofit, regional service organization that represents the interests of consumer-owned electric utilities operating within the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) service area. TVPPA members include both municipal and electric cooperatives, and they serve more than 9 million customers in Alabama, Georgia, Tennessee, Mississippi, Kentucky, North Carolina and Virginia.

TVPPA was organized in 1946 and serves 104 municipal and 49 electric cooperatives. TVPPA membership also includes more than 100 Affiliates and Associates. TVPPA affords its members professional assistance in a variety of fields and many advantages enjoyed by much larger utility operations.

OUR MISSIONS
TVPPA's missions are (1) to serve as an effective advocate of its membership's interests with the public, in the political process and with TVA and (2) to be a successful independent provider of competitive utility business services.

OUR VISION
TVPPA strives to be the leading force in helping shape federal legislative and regulatory policy related to the supply of electricity for the consumers served by its members. We continually strive to be the preferred and continuing source of services that enhance the competitive positions of consumer-owned utilities.

CONSUMER OWNERSHIP
Since the mid-1930s, consumer-owned utilities have been major contributors to the quality of life enjoyed by Tennessee Valley residents. Local electric systems are more than utilities – they are active, necessary parts of the communities they serve. The Valley's consumer-owned power distributors have one common purpose – to provide their ratepayers with the best energy services at the lowest possible cost, consistent with sound business practices.

Through annual in-lieu-of-tax payments to their local communities, TVPPA members make significant contributions to the economic well-being of the Valley's citizens.

Name: Electro Scan Inc.
Description: Electro Scan Inc. is an independent, impartial and innovative partner to utilities, municipal water and sewer agencies, and consulting engineering firms in the  Testing, Inspection and Certification (TIC) market.  The company designs, develops, markets, and provides inspection services to certify repairs, rehabilitation, leak locations, pipe materials, and condition assessment of existing infrastructure. Patented and patent-pending technology locates buried lead pipes, finds & quantifies pipeline leakage, and tests Cured-In-Place Pipe (CIPP) and certifies trenchless rehabilitation as leak-free.

Name: Western Energy Institute
Description:
Briefly stated, Western Energy Institute (WEI) is a regional association that serves the electric and gas industries, both public and private, in the Western U.S. and Canada. We’re based in the lively town of Portland, which is a superb place to live and work. In fact, we are regularly named one of the 100 best nonprofits to work for in Oregon by Oregon Business.  Our company’s membership includes 81 energy companies of all sorts, and more than 200 industry service providers. We offer a member-driven, open learning environment to develop great leaders and innovators in our industry. Every year, we sponsor educational and networking programs that help member companies thrive in today’s competitive energy markets.

Vision
Western Energy is the premier Western association of energy companies that implements strategic, member-driven forums, identifies critical industry issues, facilitates dynamic and timely employee development opportunities, and supports member relationships to help achieve solutions vital to their success.

Mission Statement
Western Energy supports the electric and natural gas industries by providing:
•  Forums for professionals to exchange timely information on critical industry issues
•  A relaxed environment for members to collaborate and network
•  Information about the industry’s best practices
•  Skills training that supports operational excellence at all levels

WE Magazine: WEI’s quarterly publication is distributed to more than 6,500 decision-makers of public and private companies involved in electric generation and transmission, gas and electric distribution, pipeline operations, power marketing and energy-related services. Content is contributed from WEI member companies and industry partners, and offers unique perspectives pertinent to energy executives and managers who face common business challenges spanning across front line operations to back office functions.

Name: TSG Water Resources, Inc.
Description: We Design, Manufacture & Operate Water and Wastewater Treatment Plants.  Our values - integrity, service, innovation, teamwork, passion and flexibility - guide us in all we do.

Name: EnerNex
Description: EnerNex, a CESI company, is an international champion delivering leading-edge engineering and consulting services to shape a better energy future. Rapid changes in power generation, storage and distribution are creating complex challenges in the energy field that require timely, innovative energy solutions. We work with utilities, energy investors and regulatory bodies around the world to provide expert energy services.

Name: GlidePath Power Solutions
Description:
GlidePath is a leading independent developer and owner of advanced energy systems. With over 100MW of commercially operating battery projects, GlidePath is one of the largest energy storage developers and independent power producers in the U.S. 

Headquartered in Elmhurst, Illinois, GlidePath has experience as both an owner-operator and turnkey developer of renewable energy and storage facilities.
Glidepath’s nationwide portfolio includes 424 MW of battery storage and renewable energy projects. 

The company also has a 1 GW+ greenfield development pipeline of battery storage projects across the United States.

GlidePath’s expert team has experience across the energy industry, from project development and finance to engineering, technology and operations. GlidePath employs firsthand knowledge of energy markets to identify opportunities that push the industry forward.

Name: Optimal Facility Management Solutions, LLC
Description:
Optimal Facility Management Solutions, LLC ("OFMS") is a comprehensive energy risk management firm that runs a number of national, independent wholesale energy cooperatives covering the manufacturing and industrial, non-profit, real estate, educational, and healthcare sectors.  OFMS also offers a Private Client program for large energy users.

Independent Wholesale Energy Cooperatives run by OFMS include:

Name: Custer Public Power District
Description:
Custer Public Power District, headquartered in Broken Bow, Nebraska, is geographically the largest rural public power district in Nebraska serving over 8000 square miles of territory.

Custer is divided into six service areas, two areas are served out of the main headquarters in Broken Bow. The other four areas have their own service centers strategically located within their service area. This concept places our service personnel closer to the customer. We maintain Area Service Centers in Sargent, Callaway, Stapleton, and Thedford, Nebraska, providing top-notch service to our customer/owners.

Our mission is to safely deliver electricity to our customer/owners, keep the District in a sound financial position, and exceed expectations in service and reliability.

Name: Rochester District Heating Cooperative
Description:
At Rochester District Heating (RDH) we are committed to the Rochester community, producing and delivering reliable, high quality steam since 1985. We currently provide steam to 8.5 million square feet of Rochester's Center City, which includes buildings owned by Monroe County, the City of Rochester, local businesses, and local churches. We are proud partners with local government and real estate firms, providing affordable thermal energy for Rochester's continuing development.

District energy eliminates the need for buildings to have their own boilers and maintenance staff. Instead, steam is produced at our plant and distributed to our members through a distribution network spanning more than nine miles. Our members are able to use steam in a variety of ways, such as heating, conversion to hot water, food preparation, and electricity production. The RDH plant includes five boilers capable of producing 300,000 pounds of steam per hour (in total) while also boasting an efficiency of greater than 90-percent. The plant is fully operational 24/7, 365 days a year.

If you want to learn more about district energy or RDH's services, please visit www.rdhc.org.

Name: SmartEnergy IP
Description:
SmartEnergy IP is a research and consulting organization within SmartMark Communications that is dedicated to helping utilities communicate the benefits of smart grid to customers.

SmartEnergy IP works as an outsourced marketing and communications department for small to mid-sized utilities with the need to have managed services and support. In this capacity, SmartEnergy IP consultants become a natural extension to a utilities’ customer care or communications department. As utilities roll out smart grid initiatives – from smart meters to dynamic pricing programs—there are ways to ensure that customers are best prepared to make smart energy choices and positively support these rollouts.

SmartMark Communications has over a decade of experience in the energy and utilities customer care domain, helping utilities and suppliers market effectively to customers. For more information, visit www.smartenergy-ip.com.

SmartEnergy IP offerings include:
     -     Industry market research and benchmarking on utility customer care behavior
     -     Review and evaluation of existing customer care communications programs
     -     Primary and secondary research and analysis of a utility’s current messages and brand in the public domain
     -     Development of strategic customer care programs for utilities
     -     SmartMark Communications, LLC resources to provide full service marketing support for utilities
     -     Public Relations and Partner Strategy

Partners:
     -     SmartMark Communications
     -     MusiComms
     -     Breakthrough Music Group

Event:

Name: Smart Grid RoadShow

SGRS events are at the forefront of the transformation of the grid into the smart, self-healing, two-way power and communications superhighway that our future demands. The mandate of the Smart Grid RoadShow concept is to create timely and economical ‘Smart Grid-centric’ events in geographically significant venues across North America. Each SGRS event — one in the Spring and another in the Fall — concentrates on bringing together highly motivated people, fresh ideas and progressive organizations from the user, supplier and consulting communities in an intimate environment that is conducive to knowledge expansion. In doing so, we leave behind the skyrocketing costs and logistical overhead of much larger conferences, allowing participants to focus on communicating and sharing vital information.

Name: Discount Energy Group, LLC
Description:
DEG provides electricity to residential and commercial several markets at a price that will help you reduce what you pay each year for your electricity.   To put it plainly, we help people save money on electricity.

How Our Customers Save Money on Electricity

DEG purchases energy from a large collective of generators at the lowest available wholesale prices. We are then able to pass the savings directly along to our customers in the form of electric rates that are significantly lower than many other providers.

Thanks to electric industry deregulation, homeowners and business owners now have a choice in their electricity provider. DEG is one of many options available and saving money on electricity is as easy as enrolling in our program.

Many of the power suppliers we do business with incorporate renewable, eco-friendly methods of power generation like solar, wind and hydro-power, along with more traditional means; so our customers can feel good knowing that by enrolling with DEG, they’re supporting green energy initiatives, and alternative energy research.

DEG is here to help you save money of electricity. To learn how much you can save, use our online calculator for an instant quote if you’re a residential customer, or if you’re interested in a commercial account, just give us a call today at 800.282.3331. Either way, enrollment is fast, easy and free.

The key to our initial success was through the installation of energy saving controllers (fixed capacitor units) and our patented sizing unit and process, which accurately determined the proper amount of correction required on a live-load in real-time taking in the full dynamics of the facilities electrical system.

Description:
The Coral Springs Improvement District (CSID) is a public, community water agency that provides high-quality tap water to about 40,000 residents living in Coral Springs (between south of Royal Palm Boulevard and the C-14 canal). CSID currently obtains its supply from ground water wells that pump water from the Biscayne Aquifer.

Formed in 1966 by the Florida State legislature as the Coral Springs Drainage District and established as the Coral Springs Improvement District in 1970, the purpose of CSID is to provide drinking water production and distribution, wastewater collection and treatment, flood control and canal maintenance. CSID’s customers, residents and business owners within the 33071 ZIP code. CSID seeks to enhance services and communications with its customers, as well as raise awareness of who we are and what they do within the region. CSID strives to exceed customer’s expectations.

Mission
To be the safest and most effective water and sewer service and flood control agency in Broward County.

Vision
We will provide the highest quality water, sewage and flood control services to our customers by maintaining our facilities in a manner that meets or exceeds regulatory requirements. We will operate the district in a manner that protects the public health, ensures the financial stability of the district, and benefits the community and environment.

Values
F = Fundamental 
O = Outstanding 
C = Community 
U = Unique
S = Synergistic
E = Efficient
D = Determined
Fundamentally providing outstanding services with a sense of community; implementing unique, innovative techniques, and leveraging synergy to be efficient, as well as determined to exceed expectations of our customers and community.

Name: Utilities State Government Organization (USGO)
Description:
The Utilities State Government Organization (USGO) is a leading professional association which represents government affairs professionals from investor-owned gas and electric utilities. In our 35 plus year history, USGO has been operated entirely by utility state government professionals chosen by their peers, and has represented members from a diverse set of leading companies in the U.S. energy sector.

USGO provides our members with a unique communications network that enables them to learn of developing state legislative trends, compare lobbying approaches and techniques, and exchange information and data on legislative issues so that each participant can better communicate their company’s viewpoints to state government officials.

Description:
Pacific Rowing Club is dedicated to providing the finest youth rowing experience possible in an inclusive, supportive, and safe community.  In partnership with our families, we prepare our athletes for life after high school through lessons learned both on and off the water. 

Successful rowers develop a deep practical understanding of the power of teamwork. They learn to build and perform as a team, and they learn to deal with the common obstacles and snags that impede teamwork. Rowers learn a kind of mental discipline that serves them well in any endeavor they may undertake.

Founded in 1980, the Pacific Rowing Club (“PRC”) has offered coaching in a sport in where stardom is impossible and where "teamwork" is crucial to success.  The club’s highly competitive junior rowing program is open to boys and girls in the San Francisco Bay Area from middle school through high school. Representing a true cross-section of our City, PRC generally represents over 25 Bay Area high schools.

Name: Utility Refund Agency
Description:
Utility Refund Agency is one of the largest and most experienced commercial utility review companies in the United States. Our consultants are utility experts with an in-depth understanding of all components of the utility billing process.

We help our clients reduce their utility costs by identifying billing errors and overcharges on electric, and natural and industrial gas bills. Once errors have been identified, we work with our clients to correct them, obtain any possible refunds, and secure future savings.

We are paid for “performance.” If we do not find any savings or refund opportunities, we receive NO compensation. This shared savings approach allows our customers to produce bottom-line savings without any out of pocket expense. It is truly a win-win effort.

Our Approach is Simple:

URA only requires a 10 to 15 minute appointment and copies of our client's most recent bills to perform a detailed utility audit.  After the review, we determine if the client is being overcharged and, if so, what the potential refunds and monthly savings would be.  We implement only those recommendations that are approved by our client.  Utility Refund Agency does NOT: Sell any type of energy management equipment or lighting, recommend energy suppliers, or charge any fees beyond our shared savings.

Name: Maryland Office of People's Counsel
Description:
We work to improve utility performance and to protect Maryland residential utility customers from unfair sales practices and unreasonable rates for services such as electricity and natural gas, in a manner consistent with the State's environmental and greenhouse gas reduction goals.

Vision:
All Maryland residents have safe, reliable, affordable, and environmentally sustainable utility services.

Mission:
The Office of People’s Counsel works on behalf of Maryland’s residential customers to advocate for utility performance at the lowest reasonable cost, consistent with State environmental and economic policies, through effective advocacy, education, and creative problem-solving. Our lawyers and advocates represent you wherever decisions about utility services are made.

Values:
Integrity and Respect -- We maintain the highest ethical standards and endeavor to faithfully apply the facts and adhere to the law, while respecting our colleagues, decision makers, and adversaries.

Excellence and Diligence -- We seek to perform at the highest levels in our oral, written, and other advocacy, working faithfully and diligently to advance the interests of residential customers.

Education and Transparency -- We aim to inform decisionmakers, policymakers, and the public about utility matters and regulatory performance and to foster transparency within our office and in the community.

Effectiveness -- We strive to use our resources effectively and to provide our staff training and development opportunities to enhance their professional skills and further the office’s work.

Fulfilling workplace -- We value a diverse, inclusive, and fun work setting that appropriately challenges staff to learn and grow while recognizing the importance of family, friends, community, and non-work related life interests.

Description:
Plant is a complete solar solution making sustainable energy simple, affordable, and available to everyone under the sun. We founded Plant because we see a great future for the energy industry, and we know it takes a community of empowered homeowners to make our vision a reality. We supply cutting-edge DOW POWERhouse Solar Shingles at no cost when you agree to a low monthly lease rate. And we install, monitor, and maintain the shingles for free, so the performance of your solar system is guaranteed. A Plant solar roof celebrates the new era of energy by transforming your home into a personal power plant, one that works in your favor to lower your utility bills and promote sustainable living. We’re pioneers of the empowered home, and we’re giving homeowners the tools to lead the clean energy revolution, one roof at a time.

Plant is looking for employees who are passionate about their impact and about working with us. As a member of the Plant team, you have a unique opportunity to participate in the transformation of one of the fastest-growing industries in the U.S. Whatever your title and responsibilities are at Plant, your role has value.Our success as a company is not only fueled by our passion for creating sustainable and planet-friendly power; it's built around a dedication to introducing our customers to the new world of energy, pinpointing their savings potential, and getting them on the right path to a greener and more affordable future. Solar energy is a new course of action, so say goodbye to those expensive, unpredictable utility bills. Instead, join us at Plant and welcome in this new era of self-sustaining energy.

Name: Sunrise Water Authority
Description: Sunrise Water is the only water authority in the state operating in a metropolitan area. An authority has certain protections and assurances that water districts do not have. Water districts may lose territory through annexation by a city at any time. A city attempting to annex authority territory must show they can provide water service more effectively or economically than an authority. A water authority’s sole function is providing water service so all revenues collected are dedicated exclusively to water agency operations.

Founded in 1992 as a joint venture with Thomassen International BV, Holland and AMCOT U.S. (American Manufacturing Company of Texas), we’re now an independent company along with our wholly owned subsidiary, Thomassen Amcot Development, LLC.

Name: Blueflux Power
Description:
We are the designers and builders of near-green and true-green Power Generation, Storage and Distribution solutions. Our advanced software control systems enable the inclusion and balancing of Distributed Energy Resources (DERs), such as solar and wind, in stand-alone (microgrid) and grid-connected systems, to deliver capabilities and efficiencies that are unmatched in the world.

We apply our advanced proprietary and patented technologies in two areas:

Power Generation – We produce UPS-quality Prime Power (24/7) to grid-connected or island mode environments. Our near-green hybrid (polyphase/poly frequency) platforms intelligently blend renewable sources with conventional power systems to deliver on-demand power – while reducing emissions and cutting fuel use by 20%+. We apply our emission-free voltage generators in microgrids to deliver 'green' digital power that is resilient and reliable in a safe, and compact footprint.

Power Storage – Our hybrid storage systems employ advanced Battery Management Controls. These proprietary systems apply intelligent management of charge/discharge cycles – extending the life of batteries. Our Automatic Arc Protection System (AAPS) improves thermal stability and reduces the possibility of thermal runaway, lowering the risk of lithium battery fires.

Power Distribution – We intelligently optimize multiple energy input sources to enable the inclusion of green sustainable resources, such as solar and wind, with the predictability and performance found in conventional power systems. Our proprietary predictive A.I. controls enable 100% utilization of renewable sources, and our proprietary cybersecurity techniques provide advanced protections. The result: heterogeneous solutions that deliver on-demand power in a secure, reliable and resilient platform.

Name: Southwest Rural Electric Association, Inc.

Name: American Association of Blacks in Energy - Arkansas Chapter
AUS Consultants
Description:
For five decades, AUS Consultants has been delivering unsurpassed consulting services to the utility industry. Our expert professionals support clients on virtually all federal and state regulatory agency involved in rate proceedings, as well as in court proceedings and special tribunals assessing the value of utility assets. Their combined experience translates into a strong understanding of the key strategic issues faced by today’s utility professionals in both vertically integrated utilities and utilities operating in the restructured industry.

We focus on the traditional consulting services, which are at the foundation of the current regulated and unregulated utilities. Nevertheless, leveraged by our intellectual framework, both emerging and experienced AUS professionals combine their talents to tackle our industry’s new challenges and opportunities.

New smart-metered households soon-to-be intrinsically connected with internet-enabled appliances bring more big-data challenges to our traditional industry. The Internet of Things (IoT) is a reality that will allow our clients to rely on a myriad of new data sources when associated with powerful and meaningful analytics. We are working relentlessly to give this new technical environment the proper methodological rigor customary to AUS ethical and academic standards.

This feed publishes news from AUS Consultants, the premier Utility consulting firm and doesn’t reflect any consultants’ individual opinion.

Name: St. Croix Electric Cooperative
Description:
Located in Hammond, Wisconsin, St. Croix Electric Cooperative (SCEC) has been serving members in rural St. Croix County and surrounding areas for nearly 80 years. SCEC was formed on Nov. 5, 1937, as a result of five farmers determined to bring light to the rural landscape. Nearly two years later – May 24, 1939 – electricity was delivered to the first account near Woodville. Today, the Cooperative operates more than 1,760 miles of distribution lines that serve more than 11,000 member accounts. SCEC strives to help members understand the Cooperative Difference by positively impacting local communities through Commitment to Community grants, scholarships, and offering members rebates and solutions to use energy wisely.
OUR MISSION: To enhance the lives of our members and strengthen the communities where they live by providing superior electric and other valued services.

Name: PowerRunner
Description:
The PowerRunner Energy Platform leverages innovative data virtualization, machine learning predictive analytics and streaming I/O technologies to deliver real-time actionable information to support operational and commercial business requirements across the enterprise. The PowerRunner Energy Platform integrates disparate operational and commercial data to create a trusted enterprise data platform that supports the dynamic real time requirements of the 21st century grid.

Grid Operations – Situational Awareness
PowerRunner solutions enable utilities to maintain and increase grid reliability and security. Our data platform operates on billions of upstream and downstream data measurements across the grid in near real-time to perform historical diagnostics and predictive analytics providing utilities with the grid edge visibility needed to ensure operational fidelity and control operational costs.

System Planning – Locational Resource Planning

By virtualizing operational and commercial data in the PowerRunner Energy Platform, utilities analyze load versus revenue and capacity versus capital for every asset on the distribution system resulting in improved capacity utilization and capital optimization. This locational resource planning approach to system improvement supports emerging regulatory planning paradigms across the world.

Corporate Operations – New Business Models

The adoption of DER and changing consumer habits are putting pressure on the century-old volumetric sales revenue model. Through rate modeling and micro asset forecasting, the PowerRunner Energy Platform supports and informs the evaluation of new revenue and business models that are emerging in the transactive energy model of the 21st century grid.

Name: Onics Energy Solutions
Description:
Onics Energy Solutions decreases energy spend, improves equipment reliability, and contributes to ESG advancements with the Onics OES-11 Passive Neutral and Ground Harmonic Filter. The Onics OES-11 mitigates harmonic distortion in a facility’s electrical distribution system and lowers unnecessary kWh consumption as a result.

Industry experts agree that Onics provides a superior solution when it comes to reducing harmonics in electrical systems. The OES-11 technology is the only 100% passive, inductive ground and neutral harmonic device on the market, meaning there is no additional energy required to power our filters or annual maintenance needed. 

By filtering out harmonic distortion and cleaning the current fed back to ground, Onics Energy Solutions has helped facilities reduce total energy consumption by 20% or more depending on facility profile and load configurations. Industries we serve include:

• Data Centers
• Hospitals
• Manufacturing Facilities
• Stadiums / Arenas
• Colleges / Universities

USST developed the Combination³ Truck to function as a standalone cleaning system powerful and versatile enough to remove accumulated sand, grit and rag material from a variety of submerged conditions. The proprietary capacity restoration services of USST help utilities and companies extend the life of their infrastructure and increase efficiencies, saving both time and money.

In conjunction with providing water and wastewater service, we also develop master planned communities creating value and opportunity for water customers, investors, homeowners, and businesses along the busy I-70 corridor of the Denver metropolitan area.

Name: Good Energy, L.P.
Description:
With Good Energy, households and businesses have saved hundreds of millions of dollars through community-centric energy buying and superior energy demand-reduction solutions. Nearly two decades ago, Good Energy and its founders pioneered aggressive energy procurement strategies, leading to today’s community energy-aggregation initiatives, enabling governments and residents to pool energy buying for lower electric rates overall.

The national leader in structuring and implementing community choice aggregation programs along with government energy-aggregation programs. Through such community choice aggregation programs, Good Energy serves more businesses and residents than any other energy consultant. With more than 200 Community Energy Aggregation programs representing more than 1 million households, Good Energy manages energy procurement for 1 percent of the U.S. population.

Good Energy is on the leading edge of ever-changing technologies and energy-efficient product innovations and solutions, such as community solar. And an expert in retail energy commodity supply, Good Energy specializes in several procurement categories including electricity, natural gas, fuel oil, efficiency projects, demand response and renewable-energy certificates. Good Energy also provides a variety of regional services involving local laws such as Benchmarking, Retro Commissioning, Predominant Use Studies and Municipal Energy Tax assessments.

Find out how Good Energy can help your business or community with a no-obligation, no-upfront-fee, comprehensive cost study to review all energy expenses and identify potential savings.

Name: MARS Transformers, LLC
Description:
MARS Transformers, LLC is a veteran owned and operated company providing innovative high voltage service and equipment solutions to the energy industry worldwide. 

MARS maintains an extensive inventory of Transformers, Lightning Arrestors, Instrument Transformers, Disconnect Switches, Circuit Breakers, and Bushings as well as a fleet of service equipment to provide our customers with rapid services and reliable equipment solutions they can trust. Our office is conveniently located just outside of Houston, TX with a close proximity to both the Port of Houston and BNSF Rail.  With a team of over 35 professionals, experience in over 20 countries, and a fleet of 10+ Vacuum Dehydrator Rigs and Trucks of various sizes, MARS can handle it all and no project is too big or small!

Name: Resource Action Programs
Description:
Resource Action Programs (RAP), a Franklin Energy company, offers a family of Measure Based Education(SM) programs designed to increase residential resource efficiency and community awareness. The proven design generates immediate savings in water and energy use while providing a turnkey, cost-effective solution.

With more than 20 years of experience, RAP has become the leader in cost-effective Measure-Based Education(SM) for K-12, Direct-to-Customer & Small/Medium Business. RAP programs feature interactive client education, self-installed kits, and complete implementation services and reporting.

Resource Action Programs has conducted programs ranging in size from 30 to more than 70,000 participants. These programs involved custom design requirements as well as extensive services ranging from kit production to shipping coordination, order processing, curriculum design, and participant support. Data collection, engaging education, and management are hallmarks of RAP programs.

Industry awards support RAP’s methods and successes. In 2013, RAP was the only Conservation Services Provider (CSP) honored as one of 12 top programs that save both energy and water by the American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy (ACEEE) and the Alliance for Water Efficiency (AWE). Programs selected for these awards were honored for market penetration, innovative design, and the ability to achieve substantial and sustained water and energy savings. This award was earned on behalf of the Southern California LivingWise Program, sponsored by energy, gas, and water utilities.

Consistently earned, RAP clients received these two 2014 awards: American Public Power Association (APPA) Energy Innovator Award for the Lincoln Electric Systems Energy Detective Program and the National Energy and the Utility Affordability Coalition (NEUAC) Corporate Excellence Award for the PPL Electric Utilities e-PowerWise Program.

Are you paying too much for your energy, waste removal or telecom services? A recent study found that public utility companies overbill their customers by almost $20 billion. Errors were discovered in more than 60% of customer bills, and most were paying in favor of the utility company.

You can depend on Cost Control Associates to help your business reduce and better manage its utility costs. For 25 years, Cost Control Associates has provided innovative services and top notch customer service to multi-site businesses in retail, banking, technology, healthcare and other industries. We also work with not-for-profit organizations, governments and agencies, school districts and colleges.

Cost Control Associate operates independently and provides unbiased consultation and advice that has saved millions of dollars for its clients. Our services include cost recovery and reduction, energy and telecom procurement, invoice processing and payment, budgeting and forecasting and more. 

Connect with us on LinkedIn if you'd like to learn more about our services and how they might help your business save money.

To learn more about how we can help you free up manpower and cut costs, visit costcontrolassociates.com or call (518) 798-4437

Established in 1999, Compressor Services started with one truck and some spare compressor parts in a small garage in Third Lake, Illinois.

Fast forward seventeen years, we’ve grown into a fleet of ultra-responsive trained technicians supported by a consummate customer service staff.  Backed by three decades of hands-on experience optimizing compressed air systems and an unwavering reliability, our streamlined solution to air compressor sales, service, repair, and rental is unparalleled.

In 2019 Mike Infelise became a partner in my company!

Name: MICATU, Inc.
Description: MICATU is a leading developer of advanced optical sensing solutions that provide superior accuracy when measuring voltage, current, and temperature. Our proprietary optical sensors offer the highest level of reliability, accuracy, precision, and harmonic measurement available, providing our valued customers with advanced data awareness to significantly improve power quality, management, safety, and grid resiliency, while helping to eliminate millions of metric tons of CO2 emissions.

Name: Southern California Public Power Authority
Description:
The Southern California Public Power Authority is a joint powers authority consisting of eleven municipal utilities and one irrigation district. SCPPA members deliver electricity to approximately 2 million customers over an area of 7,000 square miles, with a total population of 4.8 million. 
The Members include the municipal utilities of the cities of Anaheim, Azusa, Banning, Burbank, Cerritos, Colton, Glendale, Los Angeles, Pasadena, Riverside, Vernon, and the Imperial Irrigation District.

SCPPA was formed in 1980 to finance the acquisition of generation and transmission resources for its members. Currently, SCPPA has five generation projects and three transmission projects, bringing power from Arizona, New Mexico, Utah, and Nevada.
  
SCPPA's role has evolved over the years to include legislative advocacy at the state and national levels, and cooperative efforts to reduce member costs and improve efficiency.

Name: Sedaru
Description:
Sedaru Drives the Automated Utility, delivering value throughout your digital transformation. Sedaru creates the digital enterprise with real-time GIS, CMMS, Field Mobility, Network Monitoring and Modeling, offering today’s only turnkey utility management system.

Our vision is to enable every utility to access data and run their business from an app, instead of paper. Achieve operational excellence by saving time, resources, and rainforests.

Sedaru's mission is to operate the world’s leading utility management software as the singular, exclusive interface for utilities to access the information, automation, and control of the business and assets they run.

Name: K. R. Saline & Associates, PLC
Description:
K. R. Saline & Associates, PLC (KRSA) is an electrical engineering and electric utility consulting firm serving the Southwest. Since 1984, KRSA principals have provided consulting and engineering services to numerous utilities with regard to their long-term and short-term electric operations.

KRSA conducts engineering and economic analyses for its clients and represents those clients in numerous regional and sub-regional groups that are pertinent to the electric utility industry. KRSA also represents its clients before numerous state and federal agencies with regard to strategic planning, program development, siting processes and policy making. In addition, KRSA provides consulting services for municipal and county organizations.

KRSA clients include irrigation and electrical districts, municipal utilities, tribal utility authorities primarily in the Southwest, and private development companies nationwide.

Name: Applied Engineering Concepts
Description:
Our mission is to ensure that electrical power systems are safe, efficient and reliable. Our technicians and engineers are highly qualified and experienced with a wide range of projects that include power plants, solar farms, medical campuses, manufacturing, commercial resident towers, and many more.

We provide professional electrical testing and engineering services that include, acceptance and maintenance testing, power system studies, GFI's, relays, infrared surveys, troubleshooting, and much more.

AEC is a Full Member of the InterNational Electrical Testing Association (NETA) & many Southern California IBEW locals.

Electrical Acceptance & Maintenance Testing, Relay Testing, Engineering Studies, Infrared Surveys

Name: MGN MicroGrid Networks LLC
Description:
MicroGrid Networks, LLC is in the business of developing, constructing and operating resilient clean energy generation and storage systems, facilities and networks in the dense urban environments of New York City. We make utility electricity networks, buildings and local communities more resilient, to protect life and property during extreme weather and tidal events.

We also deliver energy cost savings to our customers, attractive rents to landowners who host our systems, greenhouse gas reductions which help our local utility, City and State meet their environmental goals and make direct investments and create good jobs in the communities where our energy facilities are located.

Name: Transformer Lifecycle Services, LLC
Description:
Transformer Lifecycle Services is an electric utility contractor specializing in Transformer and Substation Equipment installation and maintenance. We provide everything from new construction (turn-key) projects to assistance with existing maintenance requirements. TLS is a leader in servicing high voltage (69KV to 765KV) substation equipment with a reputation for high quality, reliable work and a strong safety record.

We provide a broad range of highly specialized services on most all makes of transformers, breakers and switches, including assembly, oil processing, repair and maintenance (re-gasketing, LTC maintenance, etc.), testing, engineering design reviews and specification analyses.

Our skilled workforce, fleet of highly specialized field equipment, and national footprint position us well to serve most any electric utility company, original equipment manufacturer or industrial customer.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Iowa Association of Municipal Utilities
Description:
Organized in 1947, the Iowa Association of Municipal Utilities today is the largest organization of its kind in the country.  View IAMU brochure.

IAMU represents 755 communities that operate municipal electric, gas, water, stormwater, and/or broadband utilities statewide, and maintains a marketing relationship with a large number of associate member businesses.

Municipal utility activities of the association include:

Representation of municipal utility interests before the Iowa Legislature
Maintenance of disaster assistance and mutual aid programs
Model plans, rules and ordinances to assist in compliance with state and federal requirements
Assistance in formulation of and implementation of energy efficiency programs
A wide range of education classes and workshops held both at IAMU’s Training & Office Complex and in various other locations across Iowa
Liability insurance plan
Member communications via a monthly newsletter, fax service and web site
Co-sponsorship of the Iowa Public Agency Investment Trust (IPAIT)

Name: Monitoring Analytics
Description: Since 1999, the PJM Market Monitoring Unit has been responsible for promoting a robust, competitive and nondiscriminatory electric power market in PJM by implementing the PJM Market Monitoring Plan. Under the PJM Market Monitoring Plan, the PJM Market Monitoring Unit has been responsible for monitoring compliance with the rules, standards, procedures, and practices of PJM markets. We observe and comment on actual and potential design flaws in market rules, standards, and procedures, and identify structural problems in PJM markets that may inhibit robust and competitive markets. We monitor the potential of market participants to exercise undue market power, the behavior of market participants that is consistent with attempts to exercise market power and the market performance that results from the interaction of market structure with participant behavior. We monitor the actions of PJM and the impact of those actions on market outcomes.

Name: Maine Water
Description: The Maine Water Company is dedicated to the customers and communities it serves. We know how important it is to provide our customers with high-quality drinking water and reliable service.

Name: IRONHOUSE
