Burch Energy Services is a building energy services firm providing HVAC & BMS Design, Installation, and Demand Side Management (DSM)for all building types. Our mission as an innovative and agile firm is to contribute to the adoption of environmentally conscious DSM in all industries: commercial, industrial, agricultural, and government. Our vision is to help building owners view facilities as engines for revenue and business resiliency, providing an understanding of their energy consumption and ways to reduce it. Our strategy for executing on our mission is to approach our nation’s building stock from a holistic perspective, ensuring quality design equates to superb installations and translates to optimal operations, and sustainability.

The values of BE Services are based on our beliefs that we can assist businesses and people alike to become stewards of the earth, respecting the finite resources available to us. We aspire to promote that we can be limitless in our efforts to innovate, optimize, and efficiently operate our buildings. We intend to display the ways we can be more productive and impactful, when we know the institutions we work for care about the resources and environment that we are a part of.

The services we provide include Energy Management Consulting, Engineering Services and Construction services.  Each service includes diversified offerings, and are founded upon our customer centric service delivery model. We aim to deliver our services with the highest of quality, by being engaged with our customers, being efficient in our approach and providing effective and custom solutions tailored to our customer needs. 

To be or not to be is no longer up for debate- Just BE with BE Services.

Learn more about us at Burchenergy.com

Name: 1st Electric & Automation
Description: We offer electrical and Instrumentation services in Northern Nevada. Our experience range from mining, power generation, agriculture and commercial industries. Whether you have a new project or need assistance with your maintenance needs, we are ready to help with any project.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: SubGrid Solutions, LLC
Description: SubGrid Solutions, LLC is an engineering consulting firm bringing customer-focused, high quality expertise to the power delivery market.  SubGrid was founded to create an exceptional place to work for industry leaders and to develop the next generation by providing sound engineering solutions with quality being the cornerstone.  Core service offerings include Protection and Control Engineering, Protective Relay Settings, Owner's Engineer, Project and Program Management and Project Development.

Name: J.L. Matthews Co., Inc.
Description: J.L. Matthews Co. is a 4th generation, family-owned and operated distributor of tools and safety equipment for Utility Lineman, Ironworkers, and Arborists since 1946. Providing brands like Hastings, Klein Tools, Bashlin, RudeDog, Madi, Lowell, and more—we are sure to have what you need to get the job done!

Name: Datamatic, Inc.
Description:
For more than 40 years, Datamatic has provided advanced meter reading and field data collection solutions to water, gas and electric utilities. Datamatic has earned a reputation for experience, innovation and reliability and is acknowledged as a leading expert in the industry.

A Pioneer
In 1980 Datamatic installed the first electronic meter reading system at Texas Electric Service Company (now TXU). An entire industry was born out of this first innovative product. Ever since then, Datamatic has been a force in the utility data collection industry. From the development of that first handheld meter reading system to today's state-of-the-art ROCKET AMR technology, Datamatic's focus has been on providing innovative and economical field data collection systems that protect utilities' revenue stream and provide added value to their operations.

Better Ideas
The company that introduced automated meter reading still offers the most robust, flexible and user-friendly products in the industry. Products include the ROCKET Automatic Meter Reading System with ProfilePLUS Usage Profiling - the industry's first radio frequency AMR system to provide robust data logging capabilities, RouteSTAR Route Management software and ROADRUNNER Field Computers. Datamatic's line of meter reading products are scalable and equally suited to utilities with 300 meters or 3 million.

Global Reach
More than 100 utilities in the US and abroad rely daily on Datamatic systems to serve their customers. Datamatic can supply expertise and equipment for any utility regardless of size or location.

Name: Viking Vessel Services, LLC
Description:
Viking Vessel offers advanced ASME welding, tank & vessel fabrication and NBIC repair, process & power piping and plant maintenance to the Power,  and General Process Industrial markets.

Viking Vessel Services has developed and engineered our patent-pending Tuff Tube product line that forever eliminates open-root butt welds in HRSG and boiler tube repairs and welding. Our Tuff Tube Transition (TTT) is a new technology product that provides a far superior tube-to-header connection,  while significantly reducing downtime. Our Tuff Tube Purgeless Sleeve (TTPS) eliminates butt welds, purging and RT in tube-to-tube connections. Check us out!

www.tufftubetransition.com

Name: MC Storm
Description:
MC Storm is an Oklahoma-based company that has an alliance with numerous power line contractors across the country. Our experienced workforce allows us to provide numerous services to your power company, thus creating a turnkey-type experience for our customers. Please feel free to contact us today so our team can go to work for you.   info@midcon.energy

Overhead
Underground
Damage Assessment Teams

Safety Oversight
Transmission

Name: Axpo U.S.
Description:
Axpo U.S. was established in 2016 and is based in New York City. The team is made of employees with extensive experience in the energy markets in the U.S. We focus on delivering a full range of energy risk management solutions to producers, consumers and other market participants. Our operations cover PJM, ERCOT, MISO and NY-ISO and encompass the power and gas markets.

We are part of the Swiss energy group Axpo. Axpo aims to provide the highest level of service in the market. We pursue a philosophy of jointly agreed, transparent solutions by being a local, responsive partner. In pursuing its own objectives, Axpo U.S. adheres to a series of values that define business activities for the entire Axpo Group. Reliability, sustainability and innovation guide our decisions, as they are the basis for our success in the market.

Name: E-Finity Distributed Generation, LLC
Description:
E-Finity Distributed Generation is the exclusive Mid-Atlantic and Southeast distributor for Capstone Turbine and is an active member of the distributed generation and combined heat and power communities.  The company actively promotes onsite energy efficient power solutions with Capstone microturbine technology.  By providing conceptual design, application engineering support, site integration, and startup and ongoing maintenance, E-Finity ensures that your onsite oil and gas, CHP, or CCHP power system will operate at peak performance.  

Capstone turbines are providing customers with green power independence for oil and gas, commercial and industrial, and resource recovery applications.  In transmission, exploration, and midstream operations, the microturbines are providing power to the remote areas of the Utica and Marcellus Shale, ensuring that gas producers have reliable power for the production of natural gas.  In commercial and industrial applications, Capstone microturbines provide hot water, chilled water, and steam to various facilities such as hotels, healthcare and manufacturing facilities, data centers, and office buildings.  

With clean, quiet, and resilient Capstone microturbines, E-Finity is giving your facility the power to be independent.

Name: McLean Engineering Company
Description:
For over 75 years, we have been building expertise in designing all portions of the power grid, focused on serving utility clients who value our long-term approach. Need engineers and consultants you can count on? We’ve been putting clients first for four generations. Come see how we serve.

McLean Engineering Company: Integrity. Reliability. Durability.

Name: HydroPro Solutions
Description:
HydroPro Solutions is an organization dedicated to delivering customer oriented solutions for metering, resource accountability, and utility efficiencies.  We have a combined industry experience of over 90 years, with first-hand knowledge of the day-to-day challenges faced by utilities.  The strength of our organization is reflected by our business partners and customers.

HydroPro Solutions, LLC is a company founded July of 2012.  

Contact us for more information on how we can get you set up with the right solutions today: https://hydroprosolutions.com/contact-us/

About Us:

Chris Phillips (CEO):  Chris holds a BGS & MS in Natural Resources from Texas Tech University.  He brings over 20 years of experience and has worked in sales and management in the AMR/AMI Metering industry while working in wholesale distribution as well as energy efficiency engineering services. 

Maurice de Vries  (COO):  Maurice holds a BS in Business from Louisiana State University.  Maurice brings over 28 years of experience directly in the meter/AMR/AMI manufacturing and distribution industries.  Maurice has worked as both a Factory Representative in the Metering Industry, as well as a Product Specialist in the Distribution Industry. 

Greg Broyles  (Executive Vice President):  Greg Broyles brings over 30 years of direct Waterworks distribution experience to the HydroPro Solutions team.  Greg has worked in sales, management, and operations within Waterworks distribution.

Name: ThinkLabs AI, Inc.
Description: ThinkLabs AI is a specialized AI development and deployment company. Our mission is to empower critical industries and infrastructure with trustworthy AI towards global energy sustainability. Our flagship product, ThinkLabs Copilot, is a digital assistant that understands the real world with proprietary physics-informed AI digital twins that provide a foundation model for engineering systems. For more information on ThinkLabs AI visit thinklabs.ai.

Name: Traverse City Light & Power
Description: Traverse City Light & Power is a community-owned, municipal electric utility providing reliable, affordable energy since 1912. We now offer TCLPfiber, an all-fiber, gigabit internet service for a more connected community.

Name: Vista Energy Marketing
Description:
Vista Energy Marketing combines years of top-flight experience in the wholesale energy commodities market purchasing electricity and natural gas with a passion for people. With over 100,000 residential and commercial customers in nine different states, Vista Energy stands out from a crowded field of retail energy company by delivering competitive energy prices and innovative plans that will solve the energy needs of our customers. 

The goal? To offer people the products they need and the ability to switch away from their local utility company with ease.

Name: Kestrel Power Engineering (ENTRUST Solutions Group)
Description: Kestrel develops innovative solutions for the utility industry focusing on generator control and compliance with the regulatory requirements imposed by NERC, Regional Reliability Organizations and Independent System Operators.

Name: Green Button Alliance
Description:
The Green Button Alliance advances the Industry's Green Button Energy Data Access and Secure Data Sharing Standard. The Green Button standard securely unlocks and standardizes utility data to empower utilities, utility customers and authorized third-party entities with digital access to energy, natural gas, and water usage information in a standardized format - and enables utility customers to securely share their own data with companies of their choice.
 
The Green Button effort was created with the support of the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), the National Institute of Standards & Technology (NIST), the Smart Grid Interoperability Panel (SGIP), the Utility Communications Architecture International Users Group (UCAIug), and the White House.  The North American Energy Standards Board's Energy Services Provider Interface (NAESB ESPI standard) serves as the basis for Green Button technology by providing a model for business practices, use cases, and an XML schema for the standard. 
 
The Green Button Alliance (GBA) is a 501(c)(3) corporation created in 2015 to foster the development, compliance, and widespread adoption of the Green Button standard.  It is the go-to-place for all things related to the Green Button initiative—from certification of implementations to marketing and education.

Name: Franklin Electric Grid Solutions
Description:
Franklin Electric Grid Solutions is a leading developer and manufacturer of intelligent monitoring equipment for power and battery backup systems. Uptime is a requirement in today’s connected world. Industries, such
as power utilities, telecommunications, healthcare, transportation, and data centers rely on uninterrupted power for critical continuity. Franklin Electric Grid Solutions delivers real-time health and performance analytics for data-driven decision making. Our products empower you to monitor your systems, analyze risks, and perform proactive maintenance - all to ensure uptime.

Franklin Electric Grid Solutions is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Franklin Electric. Franklin Electric is a global leader in the manufacturing and distribution of products and systems focused on the movement and
management of water and fuel. We offer pumps, motors, drives, and controls for use in a wide variety of residential, commercial, agricultural, industrial, and municipal applications.

Name: Arco Technologies Inc
Description:
Arco Technologies Inc develops and produces proton exchange membrane (PEM) fuel cell and anion exchange membrane (AEM) electrolyzers. Arco leads the global market in the Low Carbon transition. 

Arco is focused on the de-carbonization of heavy transportation, availability of large volume & low-cost green hydrogen.

Over 20 years of experience and competitive technology applicable in many fields. Deep knowledge in the market and sectors of material handling, heavy duty applications and fuel cell production process chemistry

Our knowhow:  PEM Fuel Cell Development, Hydrogen Fuel Cells, Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells, Fuel Cells, Hydrogen Generation, Hydrogen Production, AEM Electrolyser, AEM Electrolyzer, Green Hydrogen, Lithium Battery Packs, Lithium Batteries, LiFePo and Hybrid Systems.

Markets: Material Handling, Heavy Duty, Automotive, Zero Emissions Mobility, Heavy Duty Mobility, Bus, Truck, Rail, Marine, Power Generation, Hydrogen Generation, Renewable Energy, Energy Transition, Alternative Energy, Clean Energy, Clean Rail, Clean Marine, Decarbonisation.

Name: ION Water
Description: Water is one of our most precious resources. Yet the affordable housing industry wastes over 200B gallons of water a year. There is a smarter way to manage water. Our water optimization platform allows affordable owners and developers to reduce water consumption and costs by as much as 70 percent compared to industry averages. Developers can reinvest savings into properties to improve residents’ quality of life, and lower and more reliable utility costs can dramatically improve net operating income (NOI).

Name: Advanced Testing Systems
Description:
Advanced Testing Systems provides electrical power systems testing services.  We utilize a unique assortment of AC & DC hipots and other equipment to test power cable (rated up to 500kV+), GIS (rated up to 500kV+), transformers, switchgear, circuit breakers, etc.  We also provide cable fault locating services and have the best fault locating team in the industry.

Each member of our team of test engineers originated from a leading supplier of high voltage test equipment and have extensive knowledge in the design and use of the equipment, giving us unparalleled confidence in our execution.  We pride ourselves in arriving fully prepared in order to perform each test as efficiently as possible while maintaining a high standard for safety.

Name: CNIguard
Description:
Increased electricity demand driven by electrification of buildings, vehicles and industry combined with aging infrastructure and climate change are causing dramatic operational, safety and reliability challenges for utilities. In urban areas this challenge is further complicated given the location and environment of underground utility assets.

CNIguard’s SensorCore secure wireless industrial IOT solution provides real-time monitoring of critical infrastructure to detect potential manhole events including combustible gases, hot spots and thermal anomalies, and other environmental conditions. This actionable intelligence allows utility operators to prevent more damaging events including smoke, fire and explosive conditions that impact health and human safety, require unplanned and expensive reactive maintenance and impact grid reliability. 

The Sentir hardware sensing platform is fully ruggedized (IP68) and easily deployed in vaults or manholes. The device has multiple power options and utilizes any IP connection, currently secure cellular, for communications. All environmental and sensor data is visualized on the SensorView SaaS platform. Utilizing an advanced alarm management framework with artificial intelligence and machine learning a utility operator receives alerts and notifications to quickly respond and prevent potentially catastrophic events. 

In addition to environmental monitoring the platform is expandable to integrate additional sensors and use cases. Today the Sentir can also integrate underground fault circuit indicators to not only provide environmental monitoring but also outage notifications for electric faults on underground circuits. 

To find out more about CNIguard’s solution, visit www.cniguard.com

Name: Hogg & Davis, Inc
Description: Hogg & Davis products have been made with rugged dependability that utility providers and government agencies have been relying on for 70 years. Founded in 1947 as a partnership by Fred G. Hogg and Willard W. Davis, the company has been designing and building specialized products for the construction of telephone and power lines for seven decades. Incorporated in 1959, the company is still family owned, with the third generation managing operations.

Name: Schock Manufacturing
Description: Schock Manufacturing brings more than 200 years of experience in the design and manufacturing of auxiliary systems for combustion turbines for power generation and mechanical drive. During our careers we have provided the designs and manufacturing on systems from small aeroderivative to large frame size machines.

Enrich LI Company: (AABE-SJC) American Association of Blacks in Energy - South Jersey Chapter
Name: (AABE-SJC) American Association of Blacks in Energy - South Jersey Chapter
Description:
AABE is a national association of energy professionals founded and dedicated to ensuring African Americans and other minorities have input into the development of energy policy regulations, R&D technologies, and environmental issues. 

As part of its mission, the South Jersey Chapter of the American Association of Blacks in Energy (AABE-SJC) focuses on scholarships, mentoring, educational awareness, community service and networking. AABE-SJ has nearly 40 active members comprised of individuals from local energy companies, including South Jersey Industries, American Water and Atlantic City Electric.

Name: CasaBlanca Doors
Description: Established 2019 by highly experienced team of engineers, Casablanca doors seeks to provide its customers with a variety of high quality products at competitive prices with an exceptional aftersales service.

Name: StruXur Team
Description: StruXur provides outsourced sales service and support for manufacturing partners in the Power Utility and Telecom sector by bringing their customers a synergistic group of product offerings and solutions to drive accelerated sales growth, market penetration, and intelligence.

Name: Retail Power Group
Description: Retail Power Group (RPG) is the exclusive sales and marketing arm for the Outside Small/Medium Business Segment of Reliant Energy in ERCOT (TX).

Name: Utility Service Agency
Description:
The Utility Service Agency, Inc. (USA) is a manufacturers' representative company for the electric utility industry. We specialize in tools and materials for the transmission, substation, distribution and lighting markets. We represent approximately 20 manufacturers for the Carolinas, Virginia, West Virginia, and Southern Maryland.  With the expansion of Duke Energy into Florida and the Midwest, we have become the single point of contact for many of our principles and are actively supporting those regions. 

Since 1978, we have served the investor-owned utilities (IOU's), Cooperatives, and Municipal Electric Systems as well as the Contractors, Engineering Consultants, and Distributors who support them. By working closely with operations, engineering, and purchasing of these organizations, we are better able to understand customers' needs and issues. Additionally, the USA is very involved with in-field teaching and product demonstrations. We own and maintain numerous technical trailers for demonstration and training purposes.  We pride ourselves on being a "hands-on" organization that is willing to do what it takes to solve the customer's problems. 

Our central office is located in Wake Forest, North Carolina, and we maintain satellite offices outside Charlotte, North Carolina, Columbia & Charleston, South Carolina, and Richmond, Virginia.

Name: Maplewell Energy
Description: Maplewell is modernizing energy demand at the grid edge and microgrids in commercial, industrial, and defense sectors. With our predictive, demand management platform, Maplewell is leading the way in demand flexibility to drive energy resiliency, reliability, and efficiency.

Name: Nania Energy Advisors
Description: At Nania Energy Advisors, we get energy so you don’t have to. Our industry experts work with you to build the right plan for your business so you can have the energy to focus on what matters most.

Name: Summit Natural Gas of Maine
Description:
Summit Natural Gas of Maine delivers safe, efficient, clean and affordable natural gas to residential and commercial customers throughout Maine.

We were organized in Maine in 2012, and our parent company, Summit Utilities, Inc., was founded in 1997 by two entrepreneurially-minded executives. They recognized a need to deliver a more cost-effective and environmentally-sustainable fuel option to residences and businesses in rural areas where other utilities could not or would not serve with natural gas. While the company started in Colorado, we have since grown to provide safe, clean and affordable natural gas to businesses and residents in five states through our companies Colorado Natural Gas, Summit Natural Gas of Missouri, Inc., Summit Natural Gas of Maine, Inc. and Arkansas Oklahoma Gas Corporation.

Our mission is to deliver clean, safe, affordable, and reliable energy solutions to our customers every day through exceptional service and a strong commitment to our communities. Overall, Summit entities serve approximately 100,000 customers and operate more than 5,400 miles of pipeline in Arkansas, Colorado, Maine, Missouri and Oklahoma.  

Being part of the Summit team means embracing excellence, diversity and innovation, committing to safety each and every day, and doing all that we can to serve each other, our customers and the communities where we live. We aim to bring warmth and energy to everything we do.

For our latest job openings, please visit: 
https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=02307472-7039-4ed3-bacb-7c30eec440ed&ccId=19000101_000001&type=MP&lang=en_US

Name: Technical Training Professionals (TTP)
Description:
Technical Training Professionals turns complex technical information into dynamic, visually engaging training materials.

From our off-the-shelf computer-based training modules to fully customized on-site instructor-led training, TTP sets a new industry standard for quality and innovation in plant training and operations with our award-winning 3D visuals and integrated training solutions.

No matter how big or small, we can develop the perfect solution for your operations, equipment and employee needs.

Name: Tiger Natural Gas
Description:
Tiger was founded in 1991 as a Minority and Woman Owned Natural Gas Marketing Company and has over 400 years of collective experience in all areas of the natural gas business. This vast, in-depth knowledge allows Tiger to provide the highest level of service and support to our customers and has established our solid reputation through applying the basic principles of integrity, honesty and reliable customer service. 
At Tiger, we excel at supplying natural gas and natural gas management services to commercial, industrial and federal facilities. Tiger is headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma and has field offices in Colorado and Pennsylvania. Our current customer base includes thousands of national retail chains, restaurants, manufacturers, hospitals, hotels, city, state and federal facilities.

•Experienced Professionals with Proven Results
•Cost Savings that go Directly to Your Bottom Line
•Industry Leading Customer Service and Support
•Flexible Pricing Options not Available at Your Utility

Name: Air Stream Air Conditioning Corporation
Description:
Air Stream is a leading commercial HVAC corporation, specializing in the perfection of human environments in organizations of all sizes through expert design, installation, and service. 

We value the employment of experienced and dedicated employees, providing ongoing staff education and training, servicing using leading-edge technology, and investing in cost-saving efficiencies and equipment for our clients.

Name: Junk King Dayton OH
Description:
Junk King is an eco-friendly junk removal company. We focus first and foremost on you, the customer. We understand your time is valuable, so we call you 15-30 minutes ahead of every job to let you know we are coming. We are currently #1 rated nationally for our customer service, and that means a lot to us.

We understand your money is hard earned, so we offer free, no obligation on-site estimates. You can also get an idea of what your job will cost online with our Pricing Estimator, or by texting us a photo. While our national competitors have begun hiding their pricing, we are becoming more transparent with ours. That's because our pricing offers you more value.

We understand all of us share resources to make our communities work more effectively. This is why we are the only national junk removal with sorting facilities in our locations. We sort, reuse, recycle, and donate as much as we possibly can to be a responsible waste removal partner for a better tomorrow.

Name: Construction Survey Technologies, Inc
Description: Construction Survey Technologies, Inc (CSTi) is a Professional Land Surveying, Subsurface Utility Mapping and Facilities/Asset management company with offices in Albuquerque & Las Cruces, New Mexico. CSTi offers a wide range of services utilizing cutting edge technology and workflows to help designers, contractors and owners minimize risk and maximize their return on investment.

Enrich LI Company: Texas Office of Public Utility Counsel
Name: Texas Office of Public Utility Counsel
Description:
Created by the Texas Legislature in 1983, the Office of Public Utility Counsel (OPUC) represents our state’s millions of residential and small commercial consumers in the electric, telecommunications, water, and wastewater utility industries in Texas.  OPUC represents the consumers, as a class, in utility-related regulatory, legal, and policy proceedings before state and federal regulatory agencies and courts and the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT).  OPUC’s Chief Executive and Public Counsel represents the consumers on the ERCOT Board of Directors and Texas Reliability Entity (Texas RE) Board of Directors. 

OPUC is headquartered in the William B. Travis State Office Building at 1701 North Congress in Austin.

Name: Center Phase Energy
Description: Center Phase Energy LLC is a family-owned business headquartered in Oklahoma City, specializing in emergency power restoration, damage assessment, and oversight services for independently owned utilities, co-operatives, municipalities and other industry participants.

Name: Indiana Pump Works LLC.
Description:
Indiana Pump Works LLC is your premier pump partner.  We focus on municipal lift stations and water booster stations.  Wastewater is our game.
We make flow happen.

Name: Power Barge Corporation
Description:
Power Barge is a privately held company providing turnkey engineering, procurement, construction and marine maintenance services, to developers, owners and operators of power barges and barge mounted power plants.  Types of power generation equipment include medium speed engine/gas turbines in simple and combined cycle operation.

Power Barge's project participation supports project development from equipment, fuel and site fuel selection through turnkey fabrication, installation, delivery and commissioning of gas turbine power barges. 

Power Barge recently embarked on a design of a floating LNG storage and regasification vessel with 150 MW to 300 MW of onboard power generation.

Power Barge Solutions offers large scale simple cycle gas turbine power barges for lease in US and EU operations on a mid-term basis.  Power barges are equipped with SCR/CO, substation/switchgear and black start capability.

Name: PACIFIC POWER REPS
Description:
Pacific Power Reps (PPR) is the utility, power, and energy industry’s newest and most innovative and energetic rep company. Our pledge is to serve as the most knowledgeable and informed field reps on behalf of our manufacturing partners. We aim to deliver the best and most thorough service to our customers.

The PPR Advantage is in our ability to build genuine, quality relationships.

 We represent several complementary manufacturers to meet our customers’ needs. 
 We seek out projects or problems where our manufacturers’ products are the right fit. 
 We assess quickly and can immediately offer solutions that match the right product(s) with the opportunities at hand.

 With multiple manufacturers comes synergy.

We believe business doesn't happen between companies – it happens between people. Our ability to build genuine, quality relationships with our customers and manufacturers gives us a bird’s eye view of the industry, so we can offer solutions that solve tomorrow’s power and energy problems today.

Going the Extra Mile
Our championship-winning attitude fuels our mission to serve as the industry’s top reps. We see the big picture and solve even the smallest of needs. We want our customers to call us first for any need, anytime, anywhere. If it’s their problem, it’s ours to fix. We do what it takes to get the job done, done well, and to completion.

Our Difference
PPR has achieved material coding approvals for dozens of new products. We established our business by helping new companies establish theirs. We learned together and we excelled together. Whether it’s transformers, grids, cable, coal, conductors, electricity, voltage, water, insulation, or geothermal energy, cutting teeth with new companies and new products has given PPR solid footing into getting products approved and in the market. We aim to be the best and sell the best. We are more than order takers. We are market makers.

Contact us: sales@ppreps.com

Name: AMP Quality Energy Services
Description: AMP Quality Energy Services performs acceptance and maintenance tests on electrical power apparatus. We verify operation of equipment after installation. Some tests are required by National Fire Protection Associations NFPA 70 National Electric Code, some are written into the specifications by the design engineers following American National Standards Institute, IEEE, and IEC recommendations. We also provide consultation for industrial, commercial and utilities electrical preventive maintenance(EPM) programs.

Name: PowerGEM, LLC
Description:
PowerGEM provides advanced simulation software and services to ensure power grid reliability and market efficiency. 

More than 250 system operators, utilities, energy infrastructure developers and consultants rely on the company’s expertise to help keep the lights on throughout North America. 

In 2025, PowerGEM will celebrate 25 years of bringing agile, purpose-built innovation to the power industry so reliable, renewable and affordable electricity can be generated and transmitted.

Name: Alabama Rural Water Association
Description:
The Alabama Rural Water Association is a non-profit organization representing water and wastewater systems serving rural communities and towns and those commercial firms which support these systems. The purpose of the Association is to assist these systems in complying with State and Federal regulations. To help them with management and operational problems and to provide or stimulate training initiatives which will promote personnel development and efficiency.

The ARWA is governed by a Board of ten Directors elected from the membership. Elections are held each year at an Annual Meeting of the members. An Associate Advisor to the Board is also elected from current Associate Members who represent suppliers of goods and services to the water and wastewater industry in a non-voting capacity.

The ARWA is a member of the National Rural Water Association (NRWA) which has member affiliates in 45 states and maintains legal counsel in Washington D.C. to help represent utility interests with the U.S. Congress and the White House. The ARWA partners with State and Federal Agencies regarding water and wastewater issues. Current partnerships exist with 4 The Waterline Fall 2013 the Alabama Department of Environmental Management, USDA Rural Development, Office of Water Resources, Alabama Department of Economic Community Affairs, Science, Technology, and Energy Division, Emergency Management Agency, Department of Homeland Security and the USDA Farm Service Agency. The ARWA is an active participant with Board and Committee Activities of Partnership organizations as follows: Operator Training Advisory Board, the NRWA Emergency Response Committee, the NRWA Membership Dues Committee, the NRWA Legislative Committee, the Alabama Drought Impact Group, Alabama Emergency Management Agency First Responder, Choctawhatchee, Pea and Yellow Rivers Watershed Management Authority and the Alabama Water Resources Commission.

Name: Amerex Energy Services
Description: Amerex offers consulting services for electricity, natural gas, and renewable energy in deregulated areas. We are recognized for driving innovation in customized product types that enable our clients to capture lower prices.  We welcome you to explore opportunities to better control your energy costs.

Name: iHydrant
Description:
Reduce non-revenue water with iHydrant

iHydrant provides remote pressure and temperature monitoring for wet and dry barrel hydrants. Our robust hosted interface provides detailed records, alerts and mapping of your remote hydrant monitors.

Our feature-rich monitoring tool is designed to save money through grid analysis, problem prevention and rapid-response mitigation. With affordable one-time installation costs and low annual maintenance and support fees. 

iHydrant can pay for itself by preventing or alerting you in real-time of water loss events. Over time, iHydrant will help reduce costs associated with water loss, becoming an integral part of your system. 

Contact us today for more information or to schedule a product demo.   

Learn more at iHydrant.com
_______________________________

Name: Outsource Utility Contractor Corporation
Description:
Outsource Utility Contractor Corporation is a Women’s Business Enterprise (WBE) specializing in power pole replacement, as well as distribution and transmission overhead, and underground power line maintenance and construction in the greater Los Angeles area. Outsource also offers design build and pre-construction services.

Our staff includes skilled veterans from the utility industry, and we pride ourselves on being a company of unique individuals who work in the highly specialized field of energized power lines and equipment.

At Outsource, we know that the company is only as good as the people we hire. That’s why it’s so important to us that we treat our employees like family. By providing employees with all of the benefits and resources they need to be successful, we empower them to work safely and efficiently.

Outsource works exclusively with the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW), and is also a proud member of the National Electrical Contractors Association (NECA). 

With a safety-first mindset, President Heather Morgan is committed to insuring the future growth of the company. Chief Executive Officer, Matt Bates, is an expert in the maintenance and construction of high voltage power lines and is committed to operating a company which aligns with the safety-first way of thinking. Being members of NECA, and a signatory member of IBEW local 47, Outsource has employed a group of highly skilled and trained labor professionals ready to take on any electrical project in California. If you need electrical transmission, distribution, or substation work done efficiently, cost-effectively, and most importantly safely, Outsource is it!

Name: Smart Earth Technologies
Description:
SET is the premiere global provider of environmentally sustainable utility management solutions for electric, gas, and water utilities. We provide meter-neutral, multi-carrier LTE-M public and private cellular based Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) solutions. All with a multi-vendor supported Head End System (HES). SET is leading the way with groundbreaking solutions such as solar powered endpoints, expanded data capacity, secure battery life, and industry leading scalability for software systems. SET is the largest provider of DER data and control services, providing measurement, command and control of varied DER products and vendors with no meter dependency. 

Sustainable Efficiency. Future Ready. 
Ready. SET. Go.

Name: Utility Services
Description:
Utility Services  specializes in aiding and assisting NERC Registered Entities in the new reliability requirements brought on by Congress' Energy Policy of 2005.  Reliability is a mainstay of the electric industry.  Many utilities over the last 40 years have maintained high standards and delivery of electricity to their customers.  However, due to incidents relating to the California and Northeastern US blackouts earlier this decade, Congress mandated a new reliability regime.  As a part of this regime, utilities will be required to document and demonstrate reliable performance.  

Utility Services works with entities to design and implement procedures for the new reliability requirements.  We can do the same for you!  US actively monitors the standards and discusses the impacts with their clients.  We work with you to ensure timely and proactive response to the deadlines.  We have helped our clients reduce the number of functional models that they have to be responsible for.

Name: Whitman Land Group, LLC
Description:
Whitman Land Group, LLC is a real estate and right-of-way firm providing consulting, negotiation, land and land-rights acquisition services to the utility and transportation sectors. Our clients include governmental agencies, municipalities, utility providers, engineers, developers, and property owners throughout the State of Texas.

We specialize in the acquisition of land use permissions including easements, encroachments, right of entry's, license agreements, and other forms of land rights for the placement of utilities on public and private property, and in the fee simple acquisition of land for roadway improvements and utility infrastructure. 

Whitman Land Group, LLC has active working relationships with land surveyors, title companies, independent abstractors, appraisers, environmental specialists and attorney's, all of whom are strategically located throughout the State of Texas to support our consulting activities and allow for turn-key land rights solutions for our clients.

- safety programs, demonstrations and campaigns

- communication resources and services
- youth leadership and advocacy

Name: American DG Energy
Description:
American DG Energy Inc. (NYSE MKT: ADGE) is the leading On-Site Utility offering clean electricity, heat, hot water and cooling to many types of businesses in the United States and Europe. We sell the energy produced on-site as an alternative to the outright sale of energy equipment. We design, install, own, operate, maintain and optimize complete combined heat and power (CHP or cogeneration), chiller cooling systems, boilers and advanced hot water heating systems tailored to a customer's specific site requirements. With the largest installed base of packaged systems, we uniquely combine energy savings that improve the environment with exceptional economics.

Customers pay only for the energy they need and use, at a rate guaranteed to be below their local utility rates. There are no capital costs or operating expenses. As soon as we begin producing energy on-site, customers typically realize enhanced cash flow and increased net income. They also receive direct operational gains because there is no impact on the property’s staffing, overhead or balance sheet.

To learn more about our On-Site Utility energy solution, visit www.americandg.com.

Name: Absolute Testing Services
Description:
Freedom isn’t usually a requirement when searching for a power system testing company. But it should be! Our relationally-focused freedom powers everything we do. As a locally-based, independently owned, third-party testing organization, we answer only to you.

What about trust? Let’s go a step further. What about unbiased honesty? When you think about it, asking a vendor to test or maintain their own equipment is like asking a student to grade their own paper. At Absolute, our team is in a wide variety of brands, without a vested interest in the equipment we test, resulting in trustworthy communication and unbiased results. 

It’s through the mastery of what we do (technical expertise), the 24/7 availability and honest accuracy of how we do it (reliability), and the assurance that we will identify hazards and reduce risks (safety), that allows us to be powerfully independent!
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Power Relaying Solutions, PLLC
Description:
Power Relaying Solutions, PLLC (PRS) is an engineering services company specializing in protection, control and automation solutions for the electric power industry. Our services include power system design, protective relay applications, automation and integration solutions, commissioning, and training.

PRS engineers are experts at applying and setting microprocessor-based protective relays for electric power generation, transmission lines, substations, distribution networks, and industrial power systems. Typical deliverables include relay settings files, coordination studies, logic diagrams, operational descriptions, and settings basis documentation.

PRS offers automation and integration solutions designed specifically to meet the requirements of our customers. PRS can design, program, and commission substation HMIs, automation controllers and gateways, network and serial communications equipment, and solutions for event collection and sychrophasors.

PRS provides detailed protection and control electrical designs for both new and retrofit installations. Typical deliverables include relaying one-lines, front views, bill of material, AC three-line diagrams, DC elementary diagrams, cabinet or enclosure wiring diagrams, and cable schedules.

Name: TN Hydrovac Inc.
Description:
Our non-destructive utility location and hydro-excavation services minimize environmental collateral damage, making Tennessee Hydrovac the best choice for the environment as well as your bottom line.  Don’t risk your employees’ safety or high restoration costs with the safety hazards associated with destructive, mechanical excavation.  Choose Tennessee Hydrovac for all your safe excavation and utility locating needs!
Tennessee Hydrovac Inc provides the most reliable hydro excavation services with 24-hour service available year-round.  Our Hydrovac trucks perform unmatched safe excavation in any condition.  Our hydro excavation equipment is capable of digging up to 85’ deep through all soil types including clay and even frost.  Our Hydrovac truck operators have the experience and expertise to handle even the most difficult tasks. Tennessee Hydrovac performs regular equipment maintenance to keep our numerous trucks in top shape, ensuring quality service you can rely on.
Contact the  Hydrovac professionals at Tennessee Hydrovac Inc for more information on our safe excavation services for your next digging project.

Cities consume 80% of the world's energy output and account for as much of the world's pollution. Electricity production is the no. 1 source of climate change. By 2050, electricity will account for half the world's energy output. 

At Karh, we are on a mission to transform humanity’s relationship with electricity – for good. 

Our vision is to unleash the energy transition to a more democratized, decarbonized world of energy production and consumption.

Our urban power platform for the new electric economy fundamentally changes the core dynamics of the power grid. We have a better way of collecting, managing and distributing energy. Future does not have to wait.

Name: NYSEARCH / NGA
Description:
NYSEARCH manages one of the premier natural gas research, development & demonstration (RD & D) programs in North America. NYSEARCH is a collaborative RD & D organization dedicated to serving its gas utility member companies and project funding partners.

NYSEARCH members voluntarily participate in projects and programs to target RD & D areas that address their unique challenges and opportunities. For more than 20 years, NYSEARCH has worked as a consortium of natural gas Local Distribution Companies (LDCs) who have common interests and needs, such as continually improving the operation, safety, efficiency, maintenance & upgrade of gas delivery systems. Today, as part of the Northeast Gas Association, NYSEARCH manages more than 30 projects in various stages of development.

NYSEARCH has grown steadily in recent years because of its success in delivering high-value RD & D projects. The organization is unique in its ability to help member companies & partners leverage RD & D investments, while targeting  their participation to projects that best meet their individual needs. The core of the NYSEARCH model is joint collaboration and guidance from participating members. These members participate in a wide variety of RD & D projects, organized under the following categories:

* Improved Installation, Maintenance & Repair
* Pipeline Integrity/Direct & Remote Assessment
* Pipe Location & Damage Prevention
* Leak Detection, Real-time Sensing & Inspection for Distribution
* Environment/Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions
* Gas Quality
* Evaluation of New Materials
* Advanced Polyethylene Piping and Joining
* Oracle (emerging technologies from other industries) 

NYSEARCH primarily serves LDCs, but also has members focused on gas transmission, while others operate transmission and distribution pipelines. A significant program within the NYSEARCH portfolio focuses on developing innovative technologies for transmission pipelines owned by LDCs.

Name: Mass Installation, Inc.
Description:
Mass Installation, Inc. (“MII”) is a 39-year old firm, based in Norwood, Massachusetts, which provides installation and consulting services for meters and meter reading technology to water utilities. . Over the past three and a half decades, MII has installed, tested and serviced or provided consulting services  and Project Management for over one and half million water meters and end-points. The company’s competitive profile is based on its expertise in the installation and management of cutting edge meter reading and data management technologies.

From its beginnings, MII has been a leader in the evaluation and introduction of new meter and meter reading technology to the municipal waterworks industry. At every stage of development of automatic meter reading (“AMR”) technology, beginning with hand-held units and telephone inbound systems, MII has been at the forefront. Today, MII is the most experienced project coordinator and installer of current state-of the-art radio frequency fixed-network AMR technology, with over 80% of existing meter reading units to the company’s credit.

A strong commitment to the advancement of meter and AMR technology will always be a centerpiece of the company’s business plan. However, MII has come to recognize that new technology brings with it not only the ability to read meters more accurately and efficiently. The opportunities provided by modern AMR technology for new efficiency in system management, procurement and finance can be just as significant as the availability of more frequent and accurate readings.

Name: Eastern Testing & Inspections, Inc.
Description:
Eastern Testing and Inspection is a company that performs non-destructive examination (NDE) and physical testing. Eastern Testing and Inspection Inc. has been in business for over 50 years and is a leader in the field of non-destructive examination. ETI’s experience and personnel has moved the company to the forefront in both nuclear and non-nuclear testing.



The personnel of ETI are comprised of Level III, Level II examiners, engineers and certified technicians. They have been performing inspection for many tears in such industries as chemical, petrochemical. Power plants, pipelines, machines shops, hospitals and construction. All inspections are performed according to the various government codes and regulations as well as specifications.

 

ETI’s highly qualified personnel are up to date on the latest methods and techniques of non-destructive examination through classes and seminars conducted be the Level III examiners.

The company currently has offices located in New Hyde Park, New York, and Thorofare, New Jersey. ETI is also licensed by the State of New York Department of Labor Division of Safety and Health and U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission.

Name: Energy Industry Fundamentals (EIF)
Description:
Energy Industry Fundamentals (EIF) provides a broad understanding of the electric and natural gas utility industry, including the energy generation, transmission, and distribution infrastructure, commonly called the "largest machine in the world," which forms the backbone for the industry. The course includes business models, regulations, types of energy and their conversion to useable energy such as electric power, how generated power is transmitted and distributed to the point of use, emerging technologies, and the connection to careers in the energy industry. Energy Industry Fundamentals is a credential created by and for the energy industry.

Issued by: Center for Energy Workforce Development (CEWD)

Criteria: To earn the EIF credential, an individual must have completed the full EIF certificate program as offered by a CEWD Approved Course Provider and pass the EIF assessment with a score of 68% or higher.

For information on available jobs in the Energy Industry please go to https://getintoenergy.jobs/ or the https://troopstoenergy.jobs/ sites.

Name: Mastin Septic and Well Service
Description:
Randy’s parents, Burton and Norma Mastin, started pumping septic tanks in the mid-1960s with their company, Bert’s Septic Tanks Service. Throughout the 1970’s, Randy helped his father with the family business while also racing motorcycles professionally at the national and international level. In 1977, Bert passed away due to complications from a work-related injury sustained while at Libbey-Owens-Ford Co., his second job. Norma, Randy’s mother kept the business for a couple of years before selling it to Randy and his wife Shirley.

In 1978, Randy Mastin Septic Tank was incorporated and has since grown and transitioned through the years from merely pumping septic tanks to completing installations and making septic tanks. Randy also started a garbage removal business in the late 1990s, but eventually sold it to a larger national company. In the early 2000s, he added another division to the company, Co-Man Portable Toilets, dedicated to renting restrooms.

Today, Randy Mastin Septic Tank Inc. is owned and operated by Randy and Shirley Mastin, along with their daughter, Mandi, and has two divisions.

Our first division, Mastin Septic and Well Service, provides complete septic services, including pumping, inspecting, repairing, and installing septic systems. It also provides well services, including servicing/repairing well pumps, and inspecting, upgrading, and abandoning water well systems.

Our second division, Co-Man Portable Toilets, provides the rental of portable restroom units for construction sites, special events, festivals, graduation parties, weddings, corporate events, and parks and recreation.

Name: PEAC/ESIC Summit
Description:
Join us for the Power Energy Automation Conference & Energy Systems Innovation Center Summit in Spokane, Washington on March 4-7, 2019.

Titled, “Taking it to the Edge:  System Awareness, Integration, and Optimization,” PEAC 2019 will be the 21st in the series that was formerly known as the Western Power Delivery Automation Conference (WPDAC). 

With a strong industry presence in power and energy automation, PEAC has established itself as a leading forum that attracts practicing engineers, technical staff, R&D personnel, managers, and manufacturers, as well as university faculty and students, to share their experience and ideas. 

This year, the four-day summit will feature prominent Key Note Speakers and sessions that explore case studies and pilot projects in smart grid, power grid automation, intelligent control, security, SCADA, networks and communications, and project management. As well, on the final day of the conference, The Energy Systems Innovation Center (ESIC) at Washington State University will host its 5th annual Energy Summit, titled: "Grid Resiliency: The intersection of the utility business model, regulatory policy, and the research and innovation pipeline." This session will feature prominent speakers from government and industry discussing the importance of continued delivery of reliable and safe electric power to our economy and society as a whole.  

JOIN US to explore this complex landscape and engage with utility leaders, policy experts, and technology visionaries. You will be enlightened, encouraged, engaged, and empowered! 

To learn more about all the PEAC/ESIC Summit has to offer, please visit our website at https://esic.wsu.edu/peac/.

Name: Flomatcher Inc.
Description:
Flomatcher was started in 1957 using a patented Liquid Rheostat for manufacturing variable speed motor control systems. Our proprietary rheostats are used to smoothly and steplessly vary the speed of pump motors to match the constantly changing demand for water flow rates in a wide variety of exacting applications.

Flomatcher now has well over 8,000 installed units controlling motors ranging in size from 4 hp to 4,000 hp from the cold temperatures of Alaska to the high humidity of Hawaii. There is a wide base of installed systems in North and South America. Flomatcher sales, repair and service is provided through a network of sales representatives across the United States and Canada. Some typical applications where liquid rheostats may be found are in water treatment facilities, waste treatment plants, high-rise potable and fire control water systems.
The technology behind the liquid rheostat is simple and low maintenance – there are no moving parts. Maintenance costs are the lowest in the industry because of the principle of operation and simple components. A skilled electronics technician is not required for operation, maintenance, or repair. The liquid rheostat can be repaired in the field by on site personnel with hand tools that are standard equipment in any plant. Many installations have been running their Flomatcher equipment for well over 25 years without any problems. These have proven to be the most reliable systems available today, particularly in areas with poor power quality and limited access to skilled technicians. The voltage spikes, frequent brownouts, power outages, and lightning strikes that wreak havoc on solid state drives are not a problem to the rugged liquid rheostat. An added advantage is that liquid rheostats do not generate the harmonic problems that are such an issue today with solid state drives.

Name: ZEROBANK - Your Local Currency
Description:
Since the boom of Blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies, many pioneers in the crypto market would like to create a new currency to be accepted as a means of payment and use them to trade and transfer cross-border, bypassing any intervention from governments and central banks. So far, although cryptocurrencies have made substantial changes to the global economy, there is very little success for any cryptocurrencies to be widely recognized as “money” per se. It will take more time for cryptocurrencies market to stabilize and figure out how to compete with fiat currencies.


In the meantime, the world economy still functions by 164 official national currencies (fiat currencies), and the problem of sending and exchanging between these currencies still present. Only considering non-commercial transactions, the remittance market and money exchange market extract billions of dollars every year from migrants, international students, international tourists, etc. This happens because this market between these hundreds of different currencies depend almost solely on the centralized banking systems and financial organizations.

Cryptocurrencies may not replace fiat currencies just yet, but the technology behind them – Blockchain – is what can make the difference in this market. By embracing the concept of an open, distributed global ledger, we created ZeroBank platform based on Blockchain and Smart Contract technologies to help customers in the money transfer and exchange markets reduce service costs substantially, and yet enjoy a secure and verifiable way to make transactions.

Name: EGYPTIAN ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION
Description:
EGYPTIAN ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION is located at 1732 Finney Rd, Murphysboro, IL. 800-606-1505.

Egyptian Electric and cooperatives worldwide generally operate using these seven principles:

1. Membership: Open to all without gender, social, racial, political, or religious discrimination.

2. Democratic Member Control: One member, one vote.

3. Member Economic Participation: Members contribute equitably to, and democratically control, the capital of the cooperative. The economic benefits of a cooperative operation are returned to the members, reinvested in the co-op, or used to provide member services.

4. Autonomy and Independence: Cooperatives are autonomous, self-help organizations controlled by their members.

 

5. Education, Training and Information: Cooperatives provide education and training for members so they can contribute effectively to the development of their cooperatives. They inform the general public about the nature and benefits of cooperation.

6. Cooperation among Cooperatives: Cooperatives serve their members most effectively and strengthen the cooperative movement by working together through local, regional, national and international structures.

7. Concern for the Community: While focusing on member needs, cooperatives work for the sustainable development of their communities through policies accepted by their members.

Name: American Directional Boring
Description:
We are a Texas based directional boring contractor who specializes in horizontal directional boring in Texas as well as nationwide commonly known as HDD (Horizontal Directional Drilling), directional boring, or underground boring.

Directional boring services are utilized when “other than open cut trenching” is required. Underground pipe boring contractor services are available for both commercial and residential sectors throughout most of the continental United States primarily in Texas, Oklahoma, Louisiana, Kansas, Colorado, and New Mexico. We have completed all job types and sizes ranging from as little as 10 feet in excess of 3,000 feet comprising of everything from sidewalk bores, driveway bores, road bores, creek and river bores. Trenchless technology such as ours is necessitated particularly when trenching and/or boring under environmentally sensitive areas, such as waterways, is not feasible and utilizes underground pipe placement with sizes ranging from one inch to 30 inches in diameter.

No matter the scope, location, or size of the project, we strive to meet and exceed your expectations while staying on budget and within specific time constraints. With excellent customer service and experienced staff, we are here for all your project needs.

What sets us apart is our dedication to your satisfaction while providing timely underground directional boring at reasonable costs. Our trenchless technology ensures we can install underground utilities, such as gas, water, sewer, fiber optic lines, etc. with minimal civil disturbances.

For questions or concerns regarding directional boring services, please contact us at (888)960.2050, (682)702.5457 or via email.

We look forward to the opportunity of working with you.

Name: Taylorsville-Bennion Improvement District
Description: Taylorsville-Bennion Improvement District provides over 70,000 residents with drinking water distribution and wastewater collection services.  The District maintains over 400 miles of pipe and delivers over 4 billion gallons of water each year to its customers.  It is located in the center of the Salt Lake valley as a part of the Greater Salt Lake City Area. The District was created in 1957 as an independent water and sewer special service district under the laws of Salt Lake County. The need for the District grew out of the necessity to provide life sustaining water and sewer disposal needs of an ever increasing population.  In the beginning, the District sent its wastewater to another sewer district to be treated. In the early 1980’s the federal government required consolidation of all treatment plants into large regional facilities. In 1987 the regional plant opened and the District combined with six sister entities to form the Central Valley Water Reclamation Facility.  The District owns about 10% of the reclamation facility and is heavily involved with the operations and facilities.  Today, the District serves its residents through 12 wells, and contracts with the county wholesaler, Jordan Valley Water Conservancy District, for additional water needs.

A seven-member Board of Trustees governs the District. 


The District currently serves a total population of appoximately 90,000 with two treatment plants: The North Plant is located at 1800 West 1200 North in West Bountiful, and the South Plant located at 2500 West Center Street in North Salt Lake.  The North Plant can treat up to 12 million gallons per day (MGD) of wastewater per day, and the South Plant can treat up to 4 million gallons of wastewater per day. Name: Kishwaukee Water Reclamation District
Description:
Like the School District, the Library District or the Park District, a Sanitary District is a separate administrative and political unit of government from the state, city or town within which it resides.The construction of the first sewer system here was completed in 1908 and enlarged to include septic tanks and stone filter beds in 1914.

A movement to “Kleen the Kish” was led by the Izaak Walton League in 1928. In response to the mandate of local voters, the DeKalb Sanitary District was organized July 12, 1928 as the 23rd District in Illinois to be incorporated under the Sanitary District Act of 1917. At that time, it became a distinct governmental and taxing body. The District was renamed the Kishwaukee Water Reclamation District on May 1, 2017.

The Federal Environmental Protection Agency was formed in 1972 and DeKalb Sanitary District came under its auspices as a “POTW” (a publicly owned treatment works). The District holds NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System) Permit Number #IL0023027.

The Kishwaukee Water Reclamation District is a Class I Wastewater Treatment facility responsible to the United States Environmental Protection Agency under the direction of the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency for treating all wastewaters in its Facilities Planning Area which contains the City of DeKalb and Northern Illinois University.

By agreement with the City of DeKalb, on November 1, 1987, the Sanitary District took over the ownership of the entire “sanitary collection system” (sanitary sewer mains and manholes) for the City of DeKalb. The District now constructs, repairs and maintains that sanitary infrastructure.

Within the Northern Illinois University Campus, much of the infrastructure is private and is maintained by the University. Sewer mains on City streets passing through the University are part of the Kishwaukee Water Reclamation District collection system.

Name: The Leak Doctor
Description:
The Leak Doctor is the premier electronic leak detection specialist in Central Florida providing a time tested proven protocol design to quickly find and mitigate leaks of all kinds. This in turn, reduces the damage to the property and the subsequent average cost of restoration. Our highly trained technicians undergo rigorous performance based training that keeps pace with the latest in technology, equipment and leak detection procedures. The Leak Doctor is widely known as a seasoned professional company with a reputation of providing the utmost in excellent service and customer satisfaction. For more than 20 years, The Leak Doctor has provided services to a myriad of industries including plumbers, property managers, insurance companies, contractors, utility companies, theme parks, hotel chains and commercial office buildings.   

The Leak Doctor holds a Certified Master Plumber License that allows for expert repair protocols aimed at diminishing property damage and determining failure assessment analysis. This capability provides a check and balance protocol designed to control costs over runs and unethical practices in the field.  In addition to providing leak detection in plumbing systems, irrigation, pools/spas and structures, we also provide water audits, remote wireless water monitoring, and comprehensive water management programs. Name: Safe Harbor Water Power Corporation
Description:
Safe Harbor Water Power Corporation was incorporated January 6, 1930 with two stockholders. Pennsylvania Water & Power Company held one-third of the common stock and Consolidated Gas Electric Light and Power Company of Baltimore, the predecessor of the present Baltimore Gas and Electric Company, the other two-thirds. Preliminary construction got under way on November 4, 1929 and actual work in the river started in April 1930. The first power generated and delivered occurred in December 1931, only twenty months after work was started in the river. The last unit placed in service occurred in October 1940. Originally seven generating units were installed with a total capacity of 230 mega watts at a cost of $34 million. In 1985 and 1986, five additional generating units were installed creating a total capacity of 417 mega watts at a total cost of $125 million.

In 2014, Safe Harbor Water Power Corporation was fully acquired by Brookfield Renewable Energy Group.

When you put them all together- you have a perfectly balanced and well-equipped infrastructure to facilitate any service we offer.

We deliver clean, renewable energy to the most remote point of any Native American reservation as well as any pin pointed location around the united states. Name: Galveston County WCID #1
Description:
Galveston County Water Control and Improvement District #1 (WCID #1) provides drinking water, wastewater and contracted solid waste collection services to more than 8,000 households and businesses in the greater Dickinson area. 

The district operates and maintains an extensive water delivery system, including water lines, water storage tanks, pump stations, and monitoring systems. It buys drinking water from the Gulf Coast Water Authority. The district also operates four water wells and a wastewater treatment plant.

AmeriWaste Solutions Inc. is contracted to provide solid waste collection services for the district’s customers. Services include garbage collection, curbside recycling pickup by subscription and brush pickup.

The district has four divisions: Operations, Maintenance, Customer Service and Administration. It is governed by a board of five members elected at large for 4-year terms on even-numbered years. The board meets on the third Monday of each month at 2320 Falco Street in Dickinson.

Established by the Texas legislature in 1938, WCID #1 is the oldest water district in the state.

Name: Electric Plant Board
Description:
The Electric Plant Board of the City of Russellville, Kentucky, was created by City ordinance, dated July 7, 1942, pursuant to authority conferred upon the City by Chapter 119 of the Acts of the General Assembly of Kentucky, 1932, as amended.  The Board was established for the purpose of owning and operating all properties, real, personal, and mixed, tangible or intangible, acquired or used or held for use in connection with the Tennessee Valley Authority as of June 30, 1942.  The Board has the legal power and capacity to perform any act not repugnant to law and shall have the express power and capacity to do any and all acts or things necessary or convenient for the carrying out of the purposes of KRS 96.550 to 96.900.  The Board consists of four appointed members, the term of one member expiring each year.  The fifth member of the Board is a representative from the City’s governing body.


The Russellville Electric Plant Board is a municipal electric power distributor that serves the electrical needs of customers in the vicinity of Russellville, KY with 103.7 miles of line with approximately 39 customers per mile. It began providing wireless Internet service to the greater Russellville area in 2006 and expanded its broadband services to video, telephone and high-speed data service in 2011. It currently serves approximately 4,300 electric customers and more than 2,600 broadband customers.


The REPB purchases its electric energy from the Tennessee Valley Authority under an all-requirements power contract.  The REPB has various contracts with video providers, a private phone wholesaler, and Internet gateways.  The Board, once appointed, is autonomous but makes an annual report to the City’s governing body.  As a municipal utility in Kentucky, the Electric Plant Board is not subject to the state’s Public Service Commission.  The EPB’s electric service is regulated by the TVA according to the terms and conditions of its current Power Contract.

Our mission is to keep our community connected to the world and enhance the quality of life by providing the highest standards of service, reliability, efficiency and courtesy at competitive rates.

Our project managers, engineers, and technicians help clients reduce their consumption, promote the adoption of efficient technology and practices, such as LED lights, non-electric heating and cooling, and other energy-saving devices and approaches.

Giving customers control through user-friendly interfaces is important to Energy4ce, as this adds to your autonomy as energy producers and consumers. We work with our clients to fully understand their energy requirements not only from a current use perspective but also from future projections. By designing turn-key systems in conjunction with your existing building infrastructure we create the most operational and cost-efficient grid-tied and microgrid solutions available.
Energy4ce only utilizes Grade 1, Tier 1, hardware components that have extensive, all-inclusive warranties, with guaranteed performance levels. The PV panels, inverters, and energy storage products used by Energy4ce are from the world’s leading manufacturers. ColumbiaGrid has substantive responsibilities for transmission planning, reliability, and other development services. These tasks are defined and funded through a series of “Functional Agreements” with members and other participants. Development of these agreements is carried out in a public process with broad participation.

Information about ColumbiaGrid activities, membership and various forms of participation and involvement in ColumbiaGrid's  activities is available at www.columbiagrid.org

Our technicians have performed leak detection services at over 3,000 plants in the US and internationally.  Our success lies not only in our leak detection experience, but in our team's experience in the design, construction, and commissioning of power plants. 

We understand that every fraction of a megawatt is important to our clients.  And we know that even the smallest of leaks can cause a unit to burn more fuel and lead to costly maintenance issues and forced outages.  

StrongForce will help you find every megawatt, reduce air inleakage, reduce back pressure, reduce emissions, reduce dissolved oxygen, reduce operating and maintenance cost, and help you keep your plant running at optimal efficiency.

Our Mission: "Every Client, Every Employee, Raving Fans of StrongForce"

StrongForce's leadership has spent their entire careers in the power generation and leak detection industries.  They understand each and every challenge that clients and employees face in this industry, as well as the complaints that they have working with our competitors.  StrongForce was designed to be 100% client and employee focused, ensuring that we exceed your expectations and deliver industry-leading results, every single day.

For our clients, we focus on fair pricing, communication before, during, and after the job, and ensuring that we solve your problem.

For our employees, we focus on enriching your lives, supporting your families, and truly enjoying each and every work day.

Through this mission, We're able to attract, train, and retain the top leak detection technicians, and deliver the absolute highest quality services for our clients.

Description:
The mission of the Maury Service Authority (MSA) is to Sustainably Provide Clean Water for the Public Health, the Safety, and the General Welfare of the communities we service.  

In 1970 in, the MSA was founded as a regional service authority and a political subdivision of the Commonwealth of Virginia formed under the Virginia Water and Waste Authorities Act.  The MSA is governed by a five-member board of directors and comprised of three governing bodies: the County of Rockbridge VA, the City of Lexington VA, and the City of Buena Vista VA.  The MSA whole sales services of water treatment and wastewater treatment.  The MSA only has two wholesale customers: the City of Lexington and the Rockbridge County Public Service Authority (RCPSA). The MSA began the services of water treatment in 1975 and wastewater treatment in 1999.  Today, the MSA owns and operates the Maury Service Authority Water Treatment Plant and the Lexington-Rockbridge Regional Water Quality Control Facility.

Name: Clear Energy Systems
Description:
Clear Energy Systems is developing a small, lightweight, yet high-horsepower, natural gas engine for distributed power generation. The project involves modernizing and industrializing the Curtiss-Wright R1820 radial aircraft engine—a reliable and versatile workhorse of mid-20th century aviation. The task is to apply 21st century engine technology and manufacturing methodology to the original radial platform, creating a robust new power plant for industrial applications. The new engine will be coupled with a 1000kW generator in a compact generator set capable of 1MW standby, 900kw prime, or 750kW continuous power.

Owing to the engine’s unique size and configuration, the resulting 1MW genset is remarkably small and lightweight—roughly one-third the size and weight of conventional offerings. It introduces unprecedented mobility and versatility in its power range. The unit is light enough to tow behind a pickup truck, airlift by helicopter or install on rooftops and platforms with minimal structural support. Other key performance and cost advantages are equally important: fuel agility, the clean emissions of natural gas, long service intervals, reduced maintenance and overhaul cost, lower fuel cost than diesel, and lower capital cost than comparable natural gas units. We anticipate introducing the product at two-thirds the price of competitive units.
