Enrich LI Company: La Puente Valley County Water District
Name: La Puente Valley County Water District
Description:
The La Puente Valley County Water District was formed in August 1924 by popular vote, in accordance with the County Water District Act of 1913. 

In its infancy the District consisted of approximately 1,300 acres and 200 customers. At that time most of the water produced from the District’s Wellfield was delivered to meet agricultural irrigation needs of the valley.

To this day, the District’s Wellfield continues to be the main source of supply to meet the needs of the District’s customers. Today the District is governed by a five-member Board of Directors elected at large from its’ service area and provides potable water to approximately 9,000 consumers through 2,500 service connections in portions of the cities of La Puente and Industry.

Name: John Cipollone, Inc.
Description:
Heating, ventilation, and cooling systems function as the life blood of a building, pumping air throughout and ensuring the comfort of those within it. At John Cipollone Inc., we meet customer comfort demands by installing, repairing, and servicing, air conditioners, heaters, furnaces, boilers, and ductless mini split systems. With several decades of experience in our third-generation family-owned business, we have the institutional knowledge to meet your needs and the technological proficiency to get the job done on-time and on-budget. 

Founded in August 1953 by John Cipollone, Sr., the company started as a fuel oil delivery service, something we continueto do to this day. With the help of his two sons, John and Mike, the company grew to offer service and installation on its way to becoming a full-service HVAC company. 

At John Cipollone, we look at the entire system, including ductwork, building science, and hydronic piping to solve building comfort problems in residential and commercial settings. We also service oil systems. As an added benefit to our customers, we are able to lock in pricing for a year, a benefit that allows our customers to have confidence in their budget.  

In addition to serving the community by meeting its heating and AC needs, we also provide great jobs—ones that people enjoy coming to work to every day. Winning employees create winning customers and winning companies. We value communication, honesty, and work ethic. 

With a commitment to excellent customer service, we meet that goal with flat-rate up-front pricing, diagnostics that assess the system as a whole, and efficient solutions delivered on time. As a family-owned business, we are members of the community we serve and want to serve that community to the best of our ability. 

If you’re looking to reduce your gas and electric bill, upgrade your heating and cooling system, or just have questions about your HVACR systems, we are here to help. Give us a call today.

Description:
The Women's International Network of Utility Professionals is an organization providing a link for developing and recognizing professionals involved with utility business trends, issues, products, and services.

The Women’s International Network of Utility Professionals (WiNUP) was founded in 1923 — known then as the Electrical Women’s Round Table — by women for women. We exist to professionally and personally support our members in the utility business. WiNUP members come from varying utilities (including investor-owned, municipal, natural gas, electric cooperatives and others) and perform all types of jobs within the utility industry.

The Virginia Chapter's Objectives are specifically geared to provide:
· Opportunities for professional development of members
· Network and mentoring among members
· Recognition and visibility for members and business partners
· Providing mentoring opportunities between professional women and local colleges 

WiNUP is a professional organization committed to fostering an inclusive business environment for members and guests. Our mission does not support any particular political or religious view and we refrain from actions that create a non-inclusive environment.

Name: Thome Plumbing Company
Description:
Our story started in 1993 when our founder, Alan Thome, created a business with the goal to provide high-level service at a fair price. And just like in 1993, that goal drives Thome Plumbing Company today.

In 2019, we grew with the purchase of PS Rapp, a locally-owned plumbing company that was run by Cecilia, the “lady plumber.” PS Rapp’s had a reputation of honesty and reliability that was a natural fit for Thome Plumbing, and we added PS Rapp’s plumbers to our team of professionals.

Name: Allied Energy Lighting
Description:
Allied Energy Lighting is part of the Allied Energy Services (AES) Group. AES has been heavily involved in the energy business since 1977 working with electric utilities and a wide range of commercial and industrial customers to help solve their energy problems.
 
We were approached by a client to examine their building energy systems and see what could be done to reduce their operating and maintenance costs while maintaining or improving the quality of their work environment.
 
After conducting extensive research and analysis of their energy systems, our solution was to retrofit their existing interior and exterior lighting systems with new LED lighting systems. This had a number of immediate benefits, including improved light quality and color; reduced connected lighting load; reduced cooling load and reduced peak demand and energy usage. Our study showed the projected energy and maintenance cost savings, along with available rebates from the local energy provider and available tax benefits from the IRS, made this solution a very economically viable one. With paybacks running less than two years and the availability of short term financing, the decision to convert to LED was a no brainer.
 
For those clients that wanted a positive cash flow from the first month, we teamed with up a local financial institution to provide short-term financing for their lighting projects. The monthly payment was usually less than the estimated monthly savings – thereby giving the client a positive cash flow from the beginning.
 
Initially, our clients were financial institutions trying to modernize their facilities and bring more dollars to their bottom line. Seeing how successful we were retrofitting bank buildings and branches, our client base grew to include colleges, city governments, retail, fast food, office buildings, and warehouses.

Name: Utility Reader
Description:
The Utility Reader Android app is now available and comes with a 30 day no cost trial. Contact me to get started. Integrates with Continental Utility Solutions, Inc.

Below are actual performance statistics realized by 5 utility companies already using the app to replace read sheets or Windows CE readers.

1. ~500%+ gain in reading efficiency, took reading time for all routes down from 2 weeks to 3 days. This is based on the route reading time timer. The assumption is that readers feel pressured to complete routes quicker as their reading time is now available.

2. ~500% Decrease in time to get readings from field into billing software. Single cloud based export file can be loaded into billing software the second the last read is entered while the reader is still in the field.

3. ~80% decrease in misreads simply by displaying the low read, high read, and usage calculation in real time on the app for the reader to double check.

4. ~50% decrease in fuel costs due to readers finding most efficient way to complete readings on each route due to timer. Also, we suspect unnecessary personal detours were cut out which is why the unexpected fuel savings occurred.

#utilitymanagement #utility #utilities #naturalgas #water #electric #meters #metering

Name: Mantua Township Municipal Utilities Authority
Description:
Mission

The Authority was created for the purpose of operating, improving and expanding a potable water and sanitary sewer system within the Township of Mantua, New Jersey.  The primary goal of the Authority is to provide a safe potable water and sanitary sewer system for its customers in a cost-effective manner.

General Information

Mantua Township was formed as a township by an Act of the New Jersey Legislature on February 23, 1853, from portions of Greenwich Township. [Consisting of 16 square miles, it is located southeast of Philadelphia with a population of 15, 217 (2010 Census).  The Township is primarily a residential community centrally located in Gloucester County, New Jersey with easy access to most major highways in the area allowing efficient commuting to Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington DC, New York City and the Jersey Shore.

The Mantua Township Municipal Utilities Authority (MTMUA) is an independent authority created in April 10, 1973 by Ordinance of the Township of Mantua under New Jersey State Municipal Utilities Authorities Law.

The Authority has broad powers under the Act including the following: to hold, operate and administer its property; provide for bonds and secure their payment and rights to holders; to charge and collect user fees to ensure the revenues of the Authority will at all times be adequate to pay all operating and maintenance expenses, including reserves, insurance, extensions and replacements, and to pay the principal and interest on any bonds and to make and enforce its rules and regulations.  Connection fees are set in accordance with the appropriate requirements of the State so new users pay their fair share of capital costs previously paid by others.

Name: FuelFree Power Systems
Description:
FuelFree Power Systems has developed a unique and innovative combined cycle power generation system. FuelFree's proprietary power cycle can be utilized in many applications associated with distributed power and water purification and/or desalination.

Unlike a traditional coal or gas fired steam plant, FuelFree replaces the fossil fuel heat source and combustion process with its proprietary non-fossil WalF Heat Chamber, which creates the heat necessary to produce the steam to drive a steam turbine, all with no emissions, combustion, or fossil fuel. It is literally rocket science.

FuelFree systems are scalable, flexible, and adaptable to asymmetric load and water requirements for many community, municipal and industrial application worldwide.

FuelFree systems are 100% renewable, no emissions, negative carbon footprint, no intermittency issues like solar or wind. The system works regardless of the weather.

FuelFree systems provide baseload power available 24/7/365, scalable from individual 5 MWh systems to massive 60 MWh modules. Large FuelFree Modules can be combined to produce power for any size large-scale power plant with any level of redundancy desired. Small systems can be containerized. The system can be designed to desalinate or clean water in concert with power production.
