Name: Center for Energy Workforce Development (CEWD)
Description: The Center for Energy Workforce Development (CEWD) is a non-profit consortium of electric, natural gas, nuclear, and renewable energy companies and their associations—Edison Electric Institute, American Gas Association, American Public Gas Association, Nuclear Energy Institute, National Rural Electric Cooperative Association, and Distribution Contractors Association. CEWD supports the industry's efforts to ensure a skilled, diverse energy workforce.

Name: Clarke Energy - USA
Description:
Clarke Energy USA Inc, a Rehlko company, is a specialist in the engineering, installation and maintenance of combined heat and power (CHP), biogas upgrading for renewable natural gas (RNG), flexible generation for microgrids or  larger grid-connected gas fuelled peaking stations. #hydrogen ready!

Clarke Energy is a Rehlko company, formerly Kohler Energy. Rehlko is a global leader in energy resilience delivering the solutions critical to sustain and improve life. 

Clarke Energy USA can provide individual CHP systems from 35kW-10MW. Clarke Energy is an authorized distributor of INNIO's Jenbacher gas engines providing gas engines between 330-4.5MW. Clarke Energy can also provide smaller CHP units down to 35kW as part of the CoEnergy America product range.

Since 1998 CoEnergy America designed, installed and service over 70 cogeneration units at schools, hotels, apartment buildings, assisted living facilities and other commercial properties totaling nearly 11MW of continuous power throughout the Northeast.

Name: Nova Clean Energy
Description:
The energy transition is accelerating, broadening, and deepening. But bottlenecks remain. High-quality development projects, advanced by management teams with the experience and capital necessary to deliver investable infrastructure at scale remain a scarce resource in many global markets.

Nova Clean Energy and its parent company Bluestar Energy Capital are focused on addressing this scarcity. Through a combination of establishing our own regional development platforms as well as controlling investments in existing platforms, our mission is to be one of the largest investors of project development capital globally.

Owned by a management team with an extensive global track record in wind, solar, and storage, we bring both institutional scale and an owner’s attention to detail to managing project and market risk.


We are patient, creative, and invest at the scale needed to drive the energy transition.

Name: EarthGrid PBC
Description: Revolutionizing our grid through ground-breaking plasma boring technology, creating tunnels for Fiber, Energy, Water, Gas, Vehicles, Pedestrians, and High-Speed Transit.

Name: Tempest Energy, LLC
Description: With over 100 years of combined management experience in the electrical utility industry, Tempest is committed to providing our customers the best storm response and restoration services available. Tempest provides safe, dependable, and highly qualified resources to meet all of your storm response needs. Tempest Energy is your Superior Storm Response partner!

Name: Consortium for Energy Efficiency
Description:
Please visit our careers page, http://www.cee1.org/careers, for positions at CEE and CEE member organizations.

CEE is an award-winning consortium of efficiency program administrators from the United States and Canada that unifies program approaches across jurisdictions to increase impact in fragmented markets. By joining forces at CEE, individual electric and gas efficiency programs are able to partner not only with each other, but also with other industries, trade associations, and government agencies. Working together, administrators leverage the effect of their ratepayer funding, exchange information on successful practices and, by doing so, achieve greater energy efficiency for the public good.

CEE members are efficiency program administrators including both utility and nonutility ratepayer funded organizations. Additional members include the regional market transformation administrators, environmental groups, federal research organizations, and state energy offices in the United States and Canada.

Name: SMT Energy
Description: Renewable energy and battery energy storage development, construction and operation.

Name: Rowan Digital Infrastructure
Description: At Rowan, we’re transforming data center delivery. Whether through powered shells or build-to-suit data center campuses, we’re on a mission to invest responsibly in sustainable data center infrastructure. We collaborate with our hyperscale partners to de-risk and develop data centers quickly, and with the highest standards for excellence in design, construction, and environmental and community stewardship.

Name: Daupler
Description:
Response software for utilities, public works, and other service organizations. Reduce work load while collecting accurate data and insight into response operations. Coordinate and document response efforts to watermain breaks, power outages, gas leaks, sewer stoppages, street obstructions, and other service outages.

We work with organizations of all sizes – from small utility districts to large municipalities. Our tools take the pain out of response processes, provide the operational insight needed, and easily integrate with existing customer service and work order management systems.

Name: Rhythmos.io
Description:
The Rhythmos Cadency EdgeAI platform creates transparency for utilities, fleet managers, electric vehicle manufacturers, and service providers to understand the hidden effects of electric vehicle (EV) load on the distribution grid on a granular level.  CadencyAI was designed using artificial intelligence, power system engineering, and machine learning-driven data analytics to provide distribution system-optimized charging and critical asset management for utilities and EV fleets. The platform allows utilities to more than double the number of EVs charging on their existing distribution system, avoiding costly and time-consuming capacity upgrades. Likewise, the platform allows fleet managers to optimize their charging and defer any need to upgrade utility service levels as they adopt EVs, all while reducing charging energy costs.  Rhythmos facilitates the shift to electric vehicles for drivers, utilities, and automakers by minimizing the required infrastructure investments, thereby maintaining affordable electricity rates and enhancing the driver experience.

Cadency EdgeAI provides utilities and fleets with advanced analytics tools to monitor and optimize electric vehicle charging on their distribution systems. By analyzing EV charging loads, our solution helps utilities and fleets minimize energy costs, protect infrastructure assets, and maximize the use of renewable energy sources. Our efficient and cost-effective approach allows for a smooth transition to electric vehicles without major infrastructure investments.

Name: XCHARGE North America
Description: XCharge North America is a high-power EV charging solutions provider, specializing in DC fast charging and battery-integrated products tailored for the North American electrical grid. Leveraging an experienced R&D team and an emphasis on new product innovation, XCharge North America is dedicated to shaping the future of electric mobility by creating more sustainable charging infrastructure.

Name: Depco Power Systems
Description:
In operation since 1991, Depco Power Systems provides quality new and used generators, generator sets, engines, marine transmissions, power switches and diesel engine parts. We guarantee the quality of our inventory and have over 19 years in outstanding customer satisfaction. 

Depco can help with decommissioning of data centers, pump stations, rigs and other facilities.  

Our proximity to the Houston Ship Channel provides us the ability to ship any size generator to any location. Contact us today to see how we can become your emergency power solution.

Name: RPower
Description: Founded in 2021, RPower is a power generation company spanning prime, merchant, and backup power generation solutions. RPower specializes in providing backup generation to companies with mission critical loads; with a focus on serving energy intensive business including the Data Center and Oil & Gas segments. The RPower team of analysts and engineers has a proven track record in the electric power industry serving large industrial customers and utilities with power generation project development, asset operations, asset optimization, project financing, and retail energy.  RPower is well capitalized and backed by I Squared Capital based in Miami, FL.

Name: Northwest Public Power Association
Description:
Northwest Public Power Association (NWPPA) is a not-for-profit association of more than 150 public/people’s utility districts, electric cooperatives, municipalities, and Crown corporations in the Western U.S. and Canada.

NWPPA also serves the networking needs of approximately 300 Associate Members across the U.S. and Canada who are allied with the electric utility industry.

Name: Generator Services, Inc
Description: For 25 years Generator Services Inc. has been the trusted provider of back-up and standby power systems for municipalities, health care providers, businesses, and individuals across South Carolina and the Southeast.  Our team is with you all the time, all the way, regardless of size or request because in an emergency, seconds save lives.

Name: VEIR
Description: VEIR is developing a new generation of High Temperature Superconductor (HTS)-based transmission lines. VEIR’s evaporative cooling architecture delivers 20 times the cooling power per kilogram of coolant flow compared to conventional approaches. VEIR’s innovations will enable reliable, low loss, cost–effective HTS-based transmission over long distances in narrow rights–of–way, connecting the lowest cost renewable power to where it’s needed, when it’s needed.

Name: Zeus Power Supplies
Description:
Your Strategic Sourcing Partners for all the essential components that keep our electric power industry running. Think transformers, high voltage insulating gloves, pole line hardware, and everything in between.

As the demand for electrical power surges in the United States, driven by factors such as population growth, housing expansion, EV proliferation, and the resurgence of manufacturing, Zeus Power Supplies emerges as a key player in meeting the evolving needs of the industry. Our focus is on enhancing resiliency within existing infrastructure and supply chains, addressing challenges faced by utilities and power and distribution companies.
 
Key Solutions:

- Diversifying Supplier Base: With a commitment to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) objectives, Zeus, a registered minority-owned business, helps utilities and P&D companies diversify their supplier base, aligning with the growing corporate trend.
- Efficient Sourcing and Delivery: Recognizing the urgency in the industry, Zeus leverages established relationships with international manufacturers to provide equipment and hardware faster and cost-effectively, meeting the need for expedited supply chain solutions.
- Market Diversification: Engaging with manufacturing representatives, Zeus aims to offer an enticing package, including diverse products, ESG compliance, and faster than average delivery times. 
-Global Reach: Simultaneously, Zeus is forging distribution agreements with manufacturers in the US as well as international manufacturers from Brazil, China, Ecuador, Indonesia, India, Mexico, Turkey, and the UK. 

Collaborating with industry veterans, we are identifying a comprehensive portfolio of transformers, hardware, and safety gear to meet the evolving needs of the US market.
 
Join Zeus Power Supplies on our journey to redefine electrical distribution, contributing to a more resilient, diverse, and sustainable energy landscape.  #ZeusPower #ElectricalDistribution #ESG #InnovationInEnergy

Name: VAHLE Inc.
Description:
Founded in 1912 by Paul Vahle with his invention of the copperhead conductor bar, VAHLE has grown to be a leading global manufacturer of mobile power, data, positioning and control systems. Still family owned, VAHLE operates in over 52 countries around the world. 

VAHLE Inc. is a wholly owned subsidiary that supports the United States and Mexico markets with headquarters in Houston, Texas, and a satellite office in Detroit, Michigan. VAHLE's most well-known products include conductor bars, festoon systems, cable reels and APOS positioning systems. With over 100 years of experience, VAHLE offers versatile solutions for a wide range of applications across markets. 

https://www.vahle.com/en/imprint

Name: Sonoma Clean Power
Description:
Sonoma Clean Power makes renewable energy accessible to Sonoma and Mendocino County residents and businesses, with competitive rates and big community benefits. SCP first began service in 2014 as California’s second Community Choice Aggregation (CCA). 

 A key part of our work is to ensure that everyone is brought along in the transition toward a clean energy future, and that customers who will benefit most from cost savings, improved air quality, and increased energy efficiency can participate in SCP’s services and programs. 

Renewable energy is a solution which SCP customers can be part of today, not years from now. By taking advantage of our offerings, customers can reduce their utility costs and help clean up California’s electric grid.

Visit our Customer Center in Downtown Santa Rosa to explore energy-efficient technologies, customer programs and incentives, and any billing related questions you may have.

Name: GridSME
Description:
GridSME - Grid Subject Matter Experts - Facilitating Change in Our Industry

The electric industry is undergoing change at an unprecedented rate. The last 15 years has seen more change than the previous 100 and the pace of change will only increase. New technologies, new regulations, new fuels, new players, changing economics, and increased demands have created a difficult operating environment more complex than ever before. Subject Matter Experts with technical, regulatory, staffing, and market insights are needed to guide your organizations to successful outcomes. 

GridSME is a team of talented and experienced utility experts that work collaboratively with our clients to meet the challenges of today's changing power industry. We understand that any initiative has to be supportable, maintainable, administrable, and affordable. At GridSME, we believe that our success depends on your success.

Name: MEA Energy Association (MEA)
Description: MEA Energy Association (MEA) serves the people that deliver electricity and natural gas to homes and business. MEA  was founded as a trade association over 100 years ago by distribution utilities, whose vision was to improve safety and efficiency. Today, utility companies around the globe benefit from MEA's industry learning seminars, operations summits, and other events. Members collaborated to develop EnergyU, the world's premier online training and testing system for gas and electric distribution utilities. EnergyU provides operator qualification (OQ) training and electric.

Name: Jet-Vac Equipment Company, LLC
Description:
Jet-Vac Equipment Company isn't just a name; it's a promise of excellence that began over fifty years ago. With six strategically placed locations across the United States, we've been the go-to destination for those seeking top-tier equipment solutions and services.

So, what sets us apart? Well, we're in the business of making your life easier with our extensive catalog of equipment and second-to-none service team.

We've got everything from combination trucks to nozzles, pipeline inspection equipment to sweepers. And don't forget about our specialty products and cleaning chemicals – because we believe in offering a comprehensive solution to all our customers.

That's why we've partnered with industry giants like Sewer Equipment, Rapidview: IBAK, Global, RC Mowers, and many more. When you shop with us, you're not just getting equipment but investing in quality.

Dive into our selection today and discover firsthand the Jet-Vac difference. Your satisfaction – it's not just our goal; it's our guarantee.

Check out our offerings at jet-vac.com.

Name: South Carolina Power Team
Description: The South Carolina Power Team is a full-service, non-profit economic development agency representing the state's 19 consumer-owned electric cooperatives.  The mission of the SC Power Team is to facilitate the growth of jobs, investment and electric load through the attraction of new industrial and commercial activity, as well as, the expansion and retention of existing businesses and facilities in the service areas of the electric cooperatives throughout South Carolina.  For information or consultation, please call 803.254.9211.

Name: EAE USA

EAEUSA located in Atlanta, Georgia, is the latest subsidiary of EAE Electric which is a global leader in electrical distribution systems. EAE USA focuses on the sales, design, and technical support of our innovative busway products throughout the US and Canada.
We offer a competitive advantage for projects in the data center, construction, healthcare, automotive, oil & gas and textile industries. 

We provide exceptional quality through our robust design team and commitment to R&D. Name: L-Charge
Description:
L-Charge are on a mission to revolutionise the EV charging landscape in support of global net zero and a faster transition to an all-electric future. 

We design, manufacture and operate scalable off-grid ultrafast charging solutions, that use clean fuels as an input, to deliver an ultrafast charging experience that guarantees less dwell time and optimal convenience for electric vehicle drivers, OEM’s and fleet operators. Our solutions are quick to mobilise and are available in several formats, including a mobile truck and containerised version for permanent commercial use and operation across multiple sectors.

We realise simplicity around electric refuelling is a key enabler towards mass adoption of electric vehicles and are fully committed to working with our clients and partners to deliver a network of innovative charging solutions that positions us at the forefront of this evolution.

Name: Amped I LLC
Description:
Amped I is an innovative design and engineering firm specializing in power infrastructure projects ranging from transmission to distribution and fire protection projects for power utility, industry, government and commercial facilities. Our experienced design and engineering team has been instrumental in the successful planning, development and commissioning of power engineering across the U.S. including electrical substations, wind farms, industrial utility interconnects, and smart grid upgrades. Additionally, our hands-on fire protection experts have provided a full array of safety and risk reduction services to safeguard buildings and aid facility operators. We foster collaborative efforts and partner with world-class industry leaders to offer complete solutions to client needs.

Through our design, engineering and fire protection services, AMPED I consistently provides exceptional value, integrity and client satisfaction. We manage utility and building projects in a timely, safety-conscious manner with a commitment to quality assurance, budget efficiency and customer service. Power infrastructure and fire protection are multifaceted and AMPED I’s 40+ years of experience enables us to take a project from initial assessment and design to full compliance and operation. We are recognized for our demonstrated track record of effectively handling projects both large and small including those with unique challenges.

From engineering high voltage transmission lines and state-of-the-art distribution systems to reducing liability and securing life, property and assets, AMPED I’s talented, dependable team offers a responsive, comprehensive approach to power engineering and project completion. We look forward to creating a seamless working relationship with you that will provide dependable solutions for your building infrastructure with an eye toward maximizing your return on investment.

Name: Georgia EMC
Description:
Georgia Electric Membership Corp. is the statewide trade association for Georgia's electric membership cooperatives (EMCs), providing leadership and unity through advocacy, education and communications.

The state of Georgia is home to 41 electric cooperatives. Together with their statewide trade association and generation and transmission partners, EMCs work continuously to provide members with safe, reliable and affordable electricity. Collectively, Georgia's customer-owned EMCs provide electricity and related services to 4.4 million people, nearly half of Georgia's population, across 73 percent of the state's land area.

Our association enables Georgia’s EMCs to pool their resources to gain strength and efficiency on common issues through:

- Legislative representation at the state and national levels
- Community and economic development
- Volunteerism and charitable giving
- Youth and education programs
- Training, education and safety programs
- Consumer advocacy
- Environmental stewardship
- Media relations and communications/member services support
- Monthly publication of Georgia Magazine for EMC consumers

Name: Rove
Description:
At Rove, we are reimagining the electric vehicle (EV) charging experience with full-service EV centers.

Each location will host more than 40 ultra-fast electric vehicles (EV) chargers, an onsite market, a car wash, a 24/7 lounge, and restrooms. For more information, please visit www.RoveCharging.com.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Contain, lift, transport, store and recycle Pole and Pad-Mount Transformers with ease. From the front office to the field, ABG BOB Transformer Bags are your organization's insurance policy for assisting safety protocols and cutting clean-up costs.

Name: Enernet Global
Description:
Enernet provides energy as a service to customers with no access to grid power or with poor quality grid connections worldwide.

OUR VISION
We will put sustainable energy innovation in the hands of companies all over the world.

OUR MISSION
To decarbonise the world's supply chains.

WHAT WE DO
Our solutions integrate multiple generation sources, battery storage and advanced control systems. As a focused, first-mover in building microgrids, Enernet has built a team and developed tools and partnerships that ensure the delivery of high-performing assets. Enernet makes it simple.

OUR SERVICES
Today, the combination of expensive power, an impetus for reliable, clean and affordable electricity and advancements in storage and control technology are driving the opportunity for microgrids.

Enernet delivers the benefits of renewable generation and energy storage with intelligent control and no upfront costs, enabling you to focus on your core business.

Name: Outrider Gas Transports
Description: Outrider Gas Transports specializes in manufacturing gas cascade trailers, allowing utility workers to perform maintenance and repairs on gas infrastructure without interrupting the supply to customers. The company's commitment to listening to its customers and incorporating their feedback into its products is a testament to its dedication to providing practical solutions for energy providers. Its tagline, "Keep energy flowing," reflects its mission to ensure the reliable and uninterrupted delivery of energy to customers.

Name: DC Sustainable Energy Utility (DCSEU)
Description: The District of Columbia Sustainable Energy Utility (DCSEU) helps residents and businesses in DC use less energy, save money, and cut greenhouse gas emissions. Since 2011, the DCSEU has delivered rebates, technical assistance, and information to tens of thousands of District renters, homeowners, and businesses, helping them to save millions of dollars on their energy costs. Through our work, we are creating green jobs for District residents, fostering economic opportunities for District businesses, keeping energy costs down for low-income residents, and building a brighter future for the City.

Name: Black Start, LLC
Description:
Black Start provides multi-discipline services for critical infrastructure projects.

Please visit our website for additional information.

Name: Dynamic EVC
Description:
Dynamic EVC is a comprehensive provider of electric vehicle charging technology, electric infrastructure, business services, and expertise.

We provide charging solutions and answers for electric vehicle owners, businesses, governments, apartments, parking lots, hotels, convenient stores, shopping centers, and others.
Dynamic EVCs compact and robust line of chargers are designed to look great on Main Street and thrive in harsh conditions, through technology engineered to be easy to install, own, and use. Dynamic is focused on continuous innovation in support of our customers.
Dynamic EVC is your complete end-to-end EV charging company.  
From start to finish, our local & qualified in-house crew specializes in making the process, from engineering to Installation and beyond, easy and worry free. Our designers, engineers, & master electricians will create an EV charging solution that works best for your company.

Name: Kindle Energy
Description:
Kindle Energy offers customized approaches to investing in, operating and managing power generation assets in North America.

We focus on providing creative solutions to the complex energy puzzle of today so that customers can focus on advancing their core businesses.

Name: Indiana Electric Cooperatives
Description:
Indiana Electric Cooperatives (IEC) was America’s first electric cooperative service organization. Since we started in 1935, the citizens and employers in the communities we serve have been our owners, and we’ve always put their needs first. Today, we serve more than 1.3 million individuals, families, farms and businesses in 89 Indiana counties. With more than $2.4 billion in system infrastructure, we’re providing Hoosiers with the reliable electric power they need — and we do it with an emphasis on environmentalism, sustainability and efficiency.

America was founded on a cooperative spirit. Working together, helping each other for mutual benefit—this is the American way. And for good reason: cooperative organizations provide economic, social and cultural benefits for their members that they often wouldn’t be able to get otherwise. That’s the way it is with electric power cooperatives.

At IEC, we work hard for our members and the communities we serve. We support our 38 member distribution cooperatives with an array of services that include job and safety training, government relations, regulatory compliance support, professional development training and communication. We also have significant involvement with youth services throughout the state, including a youth tour to Washington D.C., youth energy camp and partnerships with schools, 4-H clubs and FFA groups to bring educational support through vocational and scholarship programs.

Our members have always come first — that’s the cooperative spirit. And it’s a spirit that focuses on today and tomorrow. Because, as the landscape continues to evolve, we want to make sure our members always have access to safe, reliable and affordable electric power.

Name: PolyJoule, Inc.
Description:
PolyJoule is a Boston-based energy storage company pioneering conductive polymer battery technology. PolyJoule is focused on delivering ultra-safe, resilient, long-life batteries for stationary storage applications.

We are driven by a goal to support true sustainable, reliable power and energy for the world. PolyJoule was born out of MIT and innovated from laboratory to commercial deployment in 2021. Poised to scale globally in the surging renewables renaissance, PolyJoule has re-invented what a stationary storage battery should be: ultra-safe, non-toxic, non-flammable, reliable, recyclable, lower cost, and no active climate control required. 

These principles are at the core of what we do:

Everyone in the world deserves access to clean, renewable electricity; sustainable energy storage makes that a reality.

Safety is paramount: energy storage must evolve from risk mitigation to risk free.

Reliable and efficient storage comes from intelligent and superior battery chemistry.

Energy storage needs to be affordable both today and tomorrow.

Name: ART Engineering
Description: We engineer the power grid

Name: AVT (Advanced Valve Technologies)
Description:
Advanced Valve Technologies (AVT) manufacturers comprehensive solutions for the safe and sustainable repair and rehabilitation of critical water infrastructure. 
The company is best known for the EZ Valve, an award-winning inline insertion valve designed for quick and easy installation for planned and emergency water line repair and pipeline maintenance, requiring no disruption in service. The EZ Valve is available from 1.5” to 24”. AVT is part of Critica Infrastructure.
Critica Infrastructure is the high-performance critical infrastructure solutions company providing innovative, tested, safe, and environmentally-conscious asset integrity solutions for construction, maintenance, and rehabilitation of critical infrastructure. Critica Infrastructure performance products, and associated engineering support and training services, are used by trained third-party professionals to construct, maintain, and rehabilitate pipelines, natural gas distribution lines, high-consequence industrial pipework, water and wastewater pipelines, and civil structures.

Name: Conduit Power
Description:
Conduit deploys on-site power generation by providing turnkey construction, complete operations, and commercial power optimization enabling customers to improve reliability, lower costs, and reduce carbon emissions.

The addition of wind and solar generation, combined with large-scale generation located hundreds of miles from the power consumer, is creating significant strain on the grid. This strain creates transmission congestion resulting in substantial reduction in power quality and wild volatility in prices.

Utility companies are slow to adapt to the changing market, and transmission and distribution network upgrades take years to materialize. A more immediate solution is needed to provide customers higher power quality and efficient prices.
Conduit is the solution. We believe that power should be reliable, price predictable, and scalable to meet consumer needs.

We design, build, and operate on-site power generation. Combined with our analytics and intelligence platform, this enables our customers to improve the reliability of delivered power while lowering costs, reducing carbon emissions, and maximizing power price optionality through grid interconnection.

Enrich LI Company: Virginia, Maryland & Delaware Association of Electric Cooperatives
Name: Virginia, Maryland & Delaware Association of Electric Cooperatives
Description:
The Virginia, Maryland & Delaware Association of Electric Cooperatives (VMDAEC) exists to serve the 16 member-owned electric cooperatives in the three-state area. Thirteen co-ops in Virginia, two in Maryland and one in Delaware are members of the Association.

Association member cooperatives serve more than 2 million people in the three states through more than 700,000 meters in Virginia, nearly 225,000 meters in Maryland and more than 100,000 meters in Delaware.

The purpose of the Association is to provide services that can best be performed as a group effort on a state or regional basis. Activities generally fall into one of four work groups: the Communications and Public Relations Department; the Governmental Affairs Department; the Safety and Training Services Department and the Educational Services Department.

Name: PayGo
Description: PayGo is a utility-focused software and payments technology company. Our platform delivers flexible billing and payment solutions that enable America's largest investor-owned and public power utilities to enable higher customer engagement and improve revenue assurance. Utility customers experience greater control in how they manage and pay for their energy and water spend, along with ways to reduce consumption.

Name: Transformer Protector Corp.
Description:
Transformer Protector Corp (TPC) is the only Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) of the TRANSFORMER PROTECTOR (TP) in North, Central and South America. The TP was designed and improved during 15 years of extensive research and testing. The TP is the only tested and proven solution to prevent Transformer Explosions and Fire.

The TRANSFORMER PROTECTOR is a transformer explosion and fire prevention system suitable for any type of oil-immersed transformer and including surrounding equipment such as the On Load Tap Changer (OLTC), Oil Cable Box, and Oil Bushing Turrets.

The TRANSFORMER PROTECTOR:

     •   Eliminates Costly Plant Outages
     •   Prevents Fire Damange to the Tranformer and Surrounding Equipment
     •   Prevents Environmental Pollution by Containing the Oil
     •   Eliminates Risk to Human Life
     •   Saves Company Reputation

Contact Us Today for a FREE Product presentation: 281-964-4155

Name: Swiftmile
Description:
We built and are now deploying the worlds first micro-mobility charging platform.
This can accommodate ebikes, escooters, drones and whatever else the micro-mobility revolution comes up with.

Name: Quantum America
Description:
Quantum is an international consulting firm specialized in the area of Public Services, with a strong presence in the Latin American market and expanding to the rest of the world.

At Quantum we know the importance of public services in people's lives. Having a quality and accessible service is essential for a modern life.

Since 1997, our team made up of engineers, economists, lawyers, accountants and administrators, investigates the optimal forms of regulation; actively intervenes in the structural conception and design of incentive regulation mechanisms and creates models and methodologies to respond to the needs of its clients, from small companies to large institutions, as well as regulatory and control agencies.

Name: AVIVV
Description: AVIVV is a certified diverse firm servicing the gas & electrical distribution and transmission industry. AVIVV’s mission is to provide enhanced client value and cost effective solutions to both government and commercial customers by bringing technical knowledge, experience, innovation and sustainable practices to the delivery of all of our services.  Our core competencies are Program Management, Construction Management, Material Management, EPC, and General Contracting. Our innovative solutions are performed by a diverse, ethical and knowledgeable team of professionals delivering an unparalleled commitment and value to clients.

Name: Hydra-Stop LLC
Description:
Hydra-Stop is on a mission to provide solutions for control that make the world safer, healthier, and more productive. As the largest insertion valve and line stop manufacturer globally, Hydra-Stop has provided water control solutions to municipalities, private water utilities, and contractors worldwide since 1981. Our solutions offer a safe, dependable, and productive method to repair and maintain potable, waste, and industrial water systems without the costs and risks associated with shutdowns.

Gain control right where it is needed with our full range of solutions, including the industry-leading insertion valve—Insta-Valve. Our solutions are designed to reduce costs, mitigate risks, and maintain service to critical customers during planned, routine, or emergency maintenance — keeping your project on time and on budget.

Every single part we manufacture is made with ultimate precision and out of the best materials. Products made by Hydrodex meet all the corresponding international quality codes and standards.

“Hydrodex Mission”
Our mission is building reliable, high quality future-proof filtration products that last a lifetime at a minimal cost of ownership. We want everyone everywhere to be able to use our filters and take advantage of our technologies.

“Hydrodex Vision”
Our vision is providing clean water to people in need and contribute in ending water pollution globally. By developing and providing the best filtration products and technologies, Hydrodex is working hard every day on technological innovations and advancements that would allow people around the world to have better water quality at an affordable price.

Name: Energy New England
Description:
Energy New England (ENE) was founded in 1998 to enhance the competitive position of public power entities in response to deregulation and to attain operating efficiencies in energy risk management and retail account management.  We are a municipal light plant cooperative established under Chapter 164, Section 47C of the Massachusetts General Laws.  Our ownership is made up of light departments in Braintree, Taunton, Concord, Hingham, and Wellesley, Massachusetts.

ENE is the largest wholesale risk management and energy trading organization serving the needs of municipal utilities in the northeast.  We currently manage the power supplies of over twenty municipal electric systems serving more than 1100 MW of electric load and more than 550 MW of generation in all six New England states.  We advise on and/or conduct more than one billion kilowatt hours in wholesale power transactions and 100-150 million kilowatt hours in retail transactions annually.  We also manage up to 250,000 therms of natural gas per day within our customers’ portfolios, as well as up to 5,000 barrels per day of fuel oil.

Name: PowerWright Technologies
Description: PowerWright Technologies, Inc. is a minority-owned, full-service,  Engineering and Project Management firm that provides value-added design solutions for electric utilities and other industries.

Name: ChlorTainer - Total Containment System
Description:
ChlorTainer is a high-pressure containment vessel into which a 1-ton or a 150-lb chemical cylinder is processed. If the cylinder should leak, all of the chemical is contained within the vessel and processed at a normal rate. All of the liquid or gas is used, and no hazardous waste is generated.  

ChlorTainer is the safest and most reliable technology available for processing and preventing a chemical release.

Keeping Operators Safe. Protecting Our Communities.

Watch our Introduction to ChlorTainer video.
https://vimeo.com/432612724
https://youtu.be/LEIF2eLn6co

chlorine gas safety, chlorine gas containment, chlorine gas containment vessel, chemical safety, plant safety, secondary containment

Alex Goldstein and Mark Friedgan started Eligo Energy LLC, an alternative energy retailer based in Chicago, in April 2012. Since then, Eligo Energy has emerged as one of the most innovative, fastest growing retail energy suppliers in the industry.

Name: BluBox MBR LLC
Description:
The treatment of municipal and industrial wastewater has continuously evolved over the last several decades. Membrane bioreactor (MBR) solutions emerged in the early 2000’s using primarily polymeric membranes. At first, MBR systems were relegated to niche applications requiring small footprint and high-quality effluent. Continuous evolution and reﬁnement of MBR related technologies have progressed to the point where it is now the technology of choice for a wide array of applications. BluBox is a rapidly deployable, fully integrated MBR system.

BluBox was conceived of by a team of technology experts with a long history of delivering MBR solutions. The designers, engineers, fabricators, programmers, drafters, and technicians behind the product have been delivering MBR systems for nearly two decades. The average MBR related experience of the core design team is over 15 years.

Although membrane non-specific the standard BluBox unit is equipped with BIO-CEL Membrane Modules by Microdyn Nadir. There are over fifty BIO-CEL system installations in the U.S. and over 500 worldwide.

BluBox represents the next generation of MBR technology with a long history of success. BluBox is manufactured in Texas. It is delivered and supported by the most experienced MBR team in the industry.

Our focus at BluBox is to be the clear market leader in providing turn-key temporary, leased or site built MBR wastewater treatment and water reuse system solutions for ﬂow rates ranging from 50,000 to 500,000 gallons per day.

Enrich LI Company: SOPEC — Sustainable Ohio Public Energy Council

As a regional council of governments under Chapter 167 of the Ohio Revised Code, SOPEC communities purchase electricity as a group within Ohio’s deregulated electricity market. SOPEC is governed by a General Assembly and Board of Directors made up of elected officials and representatives from its members. SOPEC provides pooled administrative, financial, and legal services required for high-value public energy programs and projects that support sustainable communities.

Consumers have more access to detailed information about their energy consumption and greater control over the amount, frequency and methods of payment. This increases customer choice, improves customer satisfaction and significantly lowers financial risk for utilities. For more information about the MyUsage, visit www.exceleron.com.

Why CF POWER?

Our extensive experience with transmission systems, our low overhead, and our automation tools allow us to provide high-quality services at a very competitive price.

The association empowers cooperatives to improve everyday life for their consumer-owners through the reliable delivery of safe and affordable energy and the advancement of Tennessee’s rural and suburban communities.

Description:
The Minnesota Rural Electric Association (MREA) is a service organization and statewide voice for Minnesota's electric utility cooperatives. MREA's 15 employees provide their expertise in service and leadership including: public awareness communications, safety training, legislative research and lobbying, and industry education programs. A member board representing electric co-ops across the state governs MREA. 

MREA's members, forty-four electric distribution cooperatives and six generation and transmission (G&T) co-ops in Minnesota, serve 780,000 customer meters or about 1.8 million Minnesotans, covering 85 percent of the geographic area of the state. These cooperatives are locally-owned and operated by boards of directors, who are elected by the consumer-members they serve and operate according to the seven cooperative principles. The cooperatives seek to provide electric energy to rural consumers at the lowest possible cost consistent with sound management. They also promote and fund economic development initiatives to create jobs and maintain a high standard of living for rural and suburban Minnesota residents.

Name: InfoSense, Inc.
Description:
InfoSense, Inc. is the manufacturer of the Sewer Line Rapid Assessment Tool, or SL-RAT, an award-winning acoustic inspection technology used to screen for blockages in small diameter gravity sewers.

Save time.  Save water.  Save money.  Stop cleaning clean pipe and focus collections maintenance resources with the SL-RAT (Sewer Line Rapid Assessment Tool). Over 230 utilities around the world are already using our award-winning acoustic technology to screen 6”-18” gravity-fed sewers for blockages. 

Results from over 90 million feet of screening show that 65-80% of pipes in the average utility do not need to be cleaned. This allows SL-RAT users to prioritize cleaning resources to areas that need it the most. Thus reducing overflows and improving cleaning effectiveness. With the capability to assess approximately 2 to 4 miles per day at 1/10th-1/20th the cost of cleaning or CCTV, acoustic inspection can be a great preliminary screening tool that generates substantial cost savings. The highly-portable SL-RAT requires no flow contact and is GPS enabled. 

Data can be downloaded, analyzed, visualized and exported using the accompanying cloud-based Sewer Line Data OrGanizer or SL-DOG software.  A standard practice for using acoustic technology can be found in the ASTM Guide (F3220-17, Standard Practice for Prioritizing Sewer Pipe Cleaning Operations by Using Transmissive Acoustic Inspection).

Armada’s technology was created to enable an addressable market of more than 50 million tanked electric water heaters as grid interactive devices, meeting growing electric grid demand for peak load management, dynamic tariff optimization, economic load shaping and renewables firming. 

As a U.S. invented and grown technology company, we’ve earned market validating assignments and scaled device populations with some of the largest utilities and multifamily property owners in the United States and Canada, positioning us to launch into our next commercial phase. Name: C-N-I Locates, LTD
Description: CNI Locates Ltd. is Oregon and Washington State’s leader in subsurface damage prevention. Our expert team specializes in an array of services including Metallic Line Detection, Non-Metallic Line Detection, Leak Detection, Ground Penetrating Radar, Structural & Concrete Imaging, Electrical Fault Detection, Video Push Camera Inspections, Sewer Crawler Inspections, Design Survey Locating, Magnetic Detection, Utility Mapping, Aerial Drone Imagery, Plastic Water Pipe Detection, Public and Private Utility Locates, and more. When requesting public locates, be aware that privately owned utilities account for more than 50 percent of the utilities on most commercial and residential properties; these private utilities are not field marked by the public locating services. In the United States there is a utility strike every 1-2 minutes caused when underground utilities are not marked before digging, that’s why it is important to call 811 and CNI Locates before performing subsurface work. Communication is vital between our technicians and clients on projects (big or small) and plays an essential role in Damage Prevention. CNI Locates has maintained a 99.99% success rate performing accurate locates without causing any subsurface damages. Please don’t hesitate to contact us for scheduling and rate information.

Name: Garden Road Distributors
Description: Welcome to Garden Road Distributor, your go-to destination for quality disposable essentials! From gloves that keep you protected to plates that make cleanup a breeze, we've got your convenience covered.

Name: StarAlt Solar
Description:
StarAlt Solar delivers full-service, turnkey solar solutions for private and public sector clients nationwide. Headquartered in Texas, we leverage our regional expertise while supporting projects across the U.S., partnering with solar companies and developers to deliver seamless, large-scale installations that achieve meaningful energy goals.

Our approach combines attention to detail, quality craftsmanship, and a skilled team to ensure a smooth process at every stage—from design to installation and commissioning. With extensive experience, a fully licensed team, and reliable operational systems, StarAlt Solar’s customer-first approach and commitment to excellence make us an ideal partner both in Texas and nationwide.

In addition to technical expertise, we bring robust financial support capabilities to our projects. Our experience in securing funding, including tax equity partnerships, allows us to help clients develop strong financial models that maximize their return on investment. We work closely with funding partners to facilitate optimal financing, ensuring that each project’s financial framework is as strong as its technical foundation.

Our portfolio spans a wide range of distributed generation (DG) solar systems, from 50 kW rooftop projects to 20 MW ground-mounted installations. With deep knowledge of the Texas utility landscape and strong relationships in the solar community, we streamline project execution for clients across Texas and beyond.

Name: Hydro Dyne Inc.
Description:
HYDO DYNE engineers, designs and manufactures heat transfer equipment for the power generation, chemical, paper, marine and various process industries worldwide. 

We are a National Board certified ASME Code manufacturer holding "U", "R" and "S" stamps.Our wide range of product capabilities include, but are not limited to boiler feedwater heaters, evaporators, reboilers, condensers, coolers, pressure vessels, custom heat exchangers and distilling plants. 

HYDRO DYNE combines all capabilities into a single facility allowing for synergy between the customer and our engineering, quality assurance and manufacturing departments. 

HYDRO DYNE is located in a 120,000 square foot facility. With a wide range of equipment, heavy lifting and 26 foot main floor to hook capacity, our fabrication capabilities are virtually limitless. 

HYDRO DYNE provides shop and field services including retubing, repair, failure analysis, equipment installation and turnkey packages. HYDRO DYNE is responsive to meeting the technical as well as commercial requirements for you, our customer. We understand the urgency and critical nature of meeting your deliveries. 

HYDRO DYNE is an active member of the Closed Feedwater Heater Section of the Heat Exchange Institute (HEI).

Name: Preferred Sources
Description:
Preferred Sources, Inc is a family owned business that specializes in the Water and Wastewater Treatment industry. We are Manufactures Reps for pumps, sewer systems, water system accessories, water conditioning equipment and related accessories. The company was formed in February 1990 by John Amon. After working in the industry for 20 years, John decided that it was a perfect opportunity to branch out on his own. After working out of his house, he found a building for lease in Stallings, NC where he started stocking pumps.. After having relative success and experiencing rapid growth, John was able to purchase the building @ 930 Culp Road, in 2005 and is this is where they continue to operate out of today.

Joshua Amon (President of the company), J.W. Amon (V.P. / Operations Manager) and Joseph Amon (V.P. of Business Development) are responsible for day to day operations, and have expanded the business in the past year (even in this economic downturn) by providing excellent service, and maintaining inventory levels that none of the competitors do in this market. Today the company is thriving and growing into a leader in the Water and Wastewater Industry.

The owners and operators of FXD have extensive experience with FEMA, government agencies, and  utilities in storm response situations. 

The FXD Emergency Response and Restoration Team eases the stress that comes with utility outages. FXD can mobilize within hours to various sites providing storm personnel, assets, and ground or aerial support. OneSpan Powerline Services, also a DaVinciSKY Group Company, has the resume to support all types of disaster response that needs aerial support. Having access to a fleet of helicopters to assist in post-storm patrols or assistance to re-establish the grid, our team has the tools.
- 24/7 Response
- Deployment within hours
- Technology assisted communications and mapping
- Specialized groups in Transmission and Distribution
- Storm Contracts
- Project Management
- Turn Key Portfolios

FXD will provide full crews, all tooling necessary, and a full fleet of utility equipment. We work closely with the utility to provide a seamless project on time, no matter the size.

Our experienced crew can perform the following tasks:
- Overhead and underground
- New construction
- Maintenance and repair
- Re-conductoring
- Cut overs
- Installation and replacement of wood, concrete and metal poles
- Street lighting
- 24/7 response
- Installation of smart grid and automation systems

Features of the system include real-time two-way communications end-to-end, remote valve control, and security functions. For more information, please visit www.kpelectronics.com

Name: Rayker Mechanical Services, LLC.
Description:
Rayker provides turn-key services for the overall management and execution of the inspection and repair of steam turbines and generators and their associated auxiliary systems. We will complete the recommended repairs on-site or send components off-site to Rayker-approved vendors according to your cost and time constraints. We can also procure and /or reverse engineer parts as needed. We fully guarantee all of the work performed by Rayker or our contracted vendors.

Rayker can assist you with the design, procurement and installation of upgrades. We can perform a detailed engineering analysis of your steam turbine components to re-rate or modify your steam path or associated systems. We can then design, fabricate and install the required modifications. We can also design, procure and install system upgrades for control systems, vibration monitoring equipment, or predictive maintenance systems for the online analysis of generator health.

Safety, Efficiency and Reliability is our Purpose! We pursue this purpose to achieve complete customer satisfaction, which is the key to building a strong, mutually beneficial relationship with each of our customers. We accomplish this through the Rayker Method of:
• Continuous COMMUNICATION Before, During and After the outage
• Detailed plans to achieve the SAFETY of our personnel, our on-site vendors and all others working in our general vicinity.
• Team EFFICIENCY with a work process that gets you back online as expeditiously as possible.
• The RELIABILITY of quality workmanship achieved through detailed data gathering processes and formal data sheets.

Name: Deiter Brothers
Description:
In 1929 Deiter Brothers began its history of service in the Lehigh Valley. We started with one truck and three family members who delivered block ice to homes in Bethlehem. Reliable service was an early hallmark of the Deiter name.

By 1931 our family had diversified into heating oil and coal delivery. A new generation of Deiter family members was now growing up with the business and through the next four decades Deiter Brothers won the trust of more and more Lehigh Valley homeowners and businesses. By 1970 Deiter Brothers was one of the largest heating fuel companies in the Lehigh Valley.

The early 1980's saw the third generation of Deiters enter the family business. Building on the traditional values of customer service and mutual trust, we expanded again by adding Walters Oil and Deiter Brothers Commercial Fuels Division.

Gasoline and diesel fuel sales grew stronger and in the early 1990's we joined the national Pacific Pride network of 24-hour card-controlled automated fueling sites.

In 2010 we launched our propane division by offering propane installation, delivery, and maintenance from the #1 ranked heating / cooling / energy team in the Lehigh Valley.

While our company has grown in size, we have maintained a sharp focus on the primary reason for this growth: customer service on a one-on-one basis. As a customer, if you ever have a question or concern, you will always get a fast, effective response from a Deiter family member. Satisfied customers have always been the basis of our business...and always will be.

Name: US-Most
Description:
US-MOST is a leading services and engineering company that provides turnkey solutions for traditional and renewable energy service providers in California. We started as an engineering company embedded within an independently-owned Southern California utility with the task of creating process management solutions, installing SCADA systems, California ISO (CAISO) Meters and Remote Intelligent Gateway (RIG). US-MOST has leveraged its opportunities and grown to become a respected provider of CAISO solutions and services to all levels of energy service providers.

Our point-to-point services and team of highly qualified engineers help take the complexity out of interacting with CAISO. Certified ISO meter and RIG engineers are responsible for the installation, testing and certification of multiple types of ISO recognized equipment, while US-MOST’s smart data solutions provide cost-effective, ECN-compliant data management and communications platforms. US-MOST is one of only a handful of recognized companies certified to install Metering and RIG platforms for the accurate measuring and reporting of energy production to CAISO.

While working within the complaint energy markets, the majority of our clients are independently-owned utilities, EPC's, and NYSE, NASDAQ listed companies. US-MOST is fully qualified to handle projects in both the traditional and renewable energy sector including photovoltaic solar, wind, biogas, fuel cell, peaker-plants and substations.

Whether dealing with traditional or renewable energy clients, US-MOST prides itself on offering a complete array of solutions that covers every stage of becoming CAISO-compliant and certified. We act as the single point of contact when working on your behalf with CAISO, SCE, PG&E, SDG&E, AT&T, and Verizon. This allows us to offer efficiency and cost-effectiveness to our FAQs and helps you avoid the long and arduous process in creating the right contacts.

Name: Subsurface Construction
Description: Subsurface Construction is a privately owned company that has over 40 years of combined experience in Horizontal Directional Drilling (HDD). HDD is a state of the art, trenchless installation process allowing product to be installed beneath all types of surfaces and difficult terrain while minimizing the environmental impact on the area and reducing restoration cost and time. We pride ourselves in having the experience and technical expertise to complete unique and challenging projects. This includes the most experienced Geothermal Horizontal Loop Field crew in the region. Our services are proudly offered in the upper Midwest, with recent projects completed in Minnesota, North and South Dakota, Wisconsin, Nebraska and Iowa. We have the capability, equipment and experience to perform directional drilling work in congested and urban environments as well as more suburban locations. Our many customers include major contractors, medium sized contractors, municipalities, utility companies, television and media cable companies, utility companies, private companies, geothermal drilling services to HVAC contractors, and even residential homeowners with their own individual drilling needs.

Name: Niagara County Water District

Name: Pond's Plumbing, Heating & AC
Description:
We aren’t your ordinary Utah plumbing company. Here at Pond’s Plumbing, we do everything involved with plumbing, heating, and air conditioning for homes and commercial properties. Though our services span over a broad spectrum, all of our employees are specifically trained in their field so they can do the best job for you.

Pond’s Plumbing has been serving Utah for more than 50 years, and experience doesn’t lie. We have the testimonials and reviews to prove that we are one of Utah’s best plumbing, heating, and air conditioning companies, especially when it comes to service, value, and efficiency.
Utah Plumbing, Heating and A/C Services

Air conditioning systems
Furnaces

Name: Win-Sam, Inc.
Description:
At Win-Sam, we operate and maintain our clients’ energy conversion facilities to produce steam, chilled water, and electricity. And we tend to work with clients that are doing significant things. Educating young minds, saving lives, performing cutting-edge research - those sorts of things. The last thing they need to be worrying about is how smoothly and efficiently the equipment is performing in their plants. We take all of that off of their plates so that they can focus their energy on their world-changing endeavors.

Our methods are not proprietary. We just ensure that everything is done to the highest possible standards based on decades of experience and constantly evolving best practices. We make sure that the job is done right. Every job, every day. We are on-site 24/7/365, constantly monitoring and servicing the equipment to maintain peak efficiency and the longest possible service life. Nothing is insignificant. We routinely extend the life of our equipment to more than twice the manufacturers’ expectations.

The most important thing that we bring to every project is a change of culture. The Win-Sam culture is based on discipline, care, honesty, relationships, and having no excuses. With integrity, care, and discipline we own the challenges and the results, whether good or bad. And we always stand up and protect the client, no matter the situation. You could say that we’re in the plant operating business, but we’re really in the relationship business. Relationships with our people and with our clients. We pride ourselves on having strong relationships with our clients that allow them to trust what we’re doing so that they can focus on what makes them great.

At Win-Sam, we've got expertise, we've got passion, we've got purpose, we've got integrity, we've got a legacy, and we've got a need to serve. In short, we've got it.

Name: Roussey Ltd
Description:
Since 1985 Roussey Companies has served the utility industry with consulting services and software development. Clients nationwide turn to us for underground residential utility design, overhead electric design, fiber optic routing design, construction management and engineering software solutions.

Through state-of-the-art technology, Roussey Companies executes projects for utilities that would otherwise remain in-house.  We have even created our own software module (ADDS) that’s unmatched in its flexibility and accuracy.  The result is world-class designs – in less time – that save money and increase productivity.  ADDS is offered to electrical utility companies and is proven to save up to $250 per meter in new URD developments.  And there’s another advantage.  Our highly skilled and experienced team possesses a unique knowledge about the utility industry and software engineering.  So no matter what you need, we can help.

Description: Our mission is to provide the highest quality, most reliable, and affordable drinking water possible.  With our highly trained and professional staff, and through diligent monitoring and management, we have been able to preserve and improve on our mission for over a century.

Name: Solar Broker Pros
Description:
Solar Broker Pros is dedicated to building a greener utility option, allowing everyone an opportunity to go solar!

Established in 2020, SBP partnered with Empire Solar Group to provide residential and corporate solar across the country.

Name: MAPPCOR
Description:
MAPPCOR employs professional staff to serve the electric power industry with transmission planning and operations. Our employees have extensive experience in transmission operations, generation reserve sharing pool operations, Reliability Coordination, energy scheduling/tagging, open-access transmission tariff administration, OASIS operations, transmission planning, powerflow/stability analysis, and technical project management for transmission study initiatives. MAPPCOR has extensive experience in NERC and Regional Entity reliability standards and compliance. We represent the Mid-Continent Area Power Pool (MAPP) organization as the NERC-registered Regional Planning Authority for the MAPP Region as well as other inter-regional coordination venues. 

MAPPCOR administers the MAPP Restated Agreement, a contract that governs MAPP. Incorporated in June 1990, MAPPCOR, a not-for-profit cooperative organization, to provide transmission and reliability services to MAPP members and industry participants. Prior to incorporation, MAPP was staffed with a MAPP Member, dating back to the 1960’s.

MAPPCOR staff recognizes and are required to adhere to open access regulatory requirements and FERC Standards of Conduct. MAPPCOR employees annually sign a MAPPCOR Standards of Conduct and Conflict of Interest Policy. 

Services:
•	Transmission expansion planning
•	Reliability Assessments
•	Economic planning studies
•	Reliability Standards Compliance
•	Generation Reserve Sharing Pool Operations (Planning and Operating Reserves) 
•	Open Access Tariff Administration.
•	Expertise in Power System Analysis.
•	Expertise in Tariff Administration.

Name: Eco Advantage Termite and Pest Solutions
Description:
Eco Advantage Termite and Pest Solutions has been providing pest control services to Fayetteville, NC and the surrounding areas since 1983. We are dedicated to making sure that your home or office is bug and rodent free. In addition to pest control services, we gladly offer home inspections for termites, termite control, fire ant control and moisture control services.

We are also qualified to handle all of your moisture control needs. Excess moisture is a problem for many reasons. On one hand, it invites mold and mildew which in turn can result in health problems for your family. On the other hand, moist environments make a perfect breeding ground for pests. Our pest control professionals can not only get rid of your infestation, but eliminate the moisture that caused it in the first place, ensuring that the pests stay away for good.

Taking preventative measures will help you minimize the amount of pests in your home. Moisture prevention is important to eliminate favorable conditions for pests. Checking the perimeter of your home and closely assessing the exterior of your home can expose different ways pests can enter your home. Small openings into your home can make it easy for pests to infest your home.

Trustworthy, professional pest control!

Our employees are all subject to criminal background checks and are certified by the state of North Carolina to provide pest control services. You can be confident that you will receive high quality pest control services. Eco Advantage Termite and Pest Solutions is an active member of the North Carolina Pest Control Association as well as the National Pest Control Association.

Allowing anyone into your home is an important decision and we believe you should completely trust that company, or person. Give us a call and let us show you why we should be your first choice when considering a pest control company in the Fayetteville, NC area!

For experienced, effective pest control, contact us today!

Name: Waverly Light and Power
Description:
In 1904, the City of Waverly, Iowa invested $13,500 to establish Waverly Light and Power, a municipally owned electric utility that now serves approximately 4,600 customers in and around Waverly. Managed by a board of trustees, Waverly Light and Power offers customers local control and decision making, responsive service and exceptional reliability.

Waverly Light and Power was the first public power system in the Midwest to own and operate wind generation, positioning the utility as a national leader in renewable energy. Waverly Light and Power owns and operates three wind turbines that offset carbon dioxide, a leading greenhouse gas associated with climate change.

The utility exemplifies community involvement, from “Trees Forever” tree-planting initiatives and school outreach programs to energy efficiency and volunteer programs.  In terms of energy efficiency, Waverly Light and Power has had great success with multiple rebate programs.  In the last two years, utility customers have helped save over $2 million Kilowatt hours (kWh).  The energy saved is enough to power 240 average homes in the Waverly community for an entire year.  

Waverly Light and Power is the recipient of numerous state and national awards, including the Reliable Public Power Award, the Iowa Energy Leadership Award and multiple Energy Innovator Awards.

For more information about Waverly Light and Power, please visit our website at waverlylp.com or Facebook page at facebook.com/WaverlyLP.

Name: Kennebunk, Kennebunkport & Wells Water District
Description:
The KK&W Water District is a quasi-municipal water utility that was established in 1921 by an act of the Maine State Legislature. Our service area, one of the longest in Maine, extends 25 miles along the York County coastline and includes the Towns of Kennebunk, Kennebunkport, Wells, Ogunquit, Arundel and portions of Biddeford and York. Within these communities, we provide quality water service to a population that varies seasonally from about 28,000 to over 75,000. 

The Water District is directed by a four-member Board of Trustees, each elected from the towns of Kennebunk, Kennebunkport, Wells and Ogunquit. The Trustees typically meet at 3:00 pm at the District office on the fourth Wednesday of the month during January to October and the third Wednesday during November and December. These monthly meetings are open to the public.

Our 40 employees are dedicated to our mission, which is to provide the highest quality of water and customer service at the lowest reasonable cost. They are a highly motivated and skilled group of professionals who believe in customer service, teamwork and technology. 

Tour our web site and learn more about us, our services and our commitment to our customers.

Name: J & J Boring, Inc.
Description:
J&J Boring, Inc. is a family-owned company dedicated to providing quality horizontal boring and tunneling services. Since 1983 we have successfully and safely completed over 1000 trenchless tunneling projects and we have never failed to successfully complete a project.  Our owners and field personnel have over 150 years of combined experience in the field of tunneling, boring and pipe jacking. We bring our passion about quality, safety and teamwork to all projects we do.

While we typically work as a subcontractor, providing tunneling services to other contractors, we also do turnkey boring and tunneling projects. Much of our work is done for water lines, sanitary sewers, storm sewers and other utilities, but we can handle any project requiring trenchless tunneling or boring.

We do all types of trenchless tunneling projects, from pipe jacking to microtunneling. We are equipped to handle casing diameters ranging from 8 inches to 12 feet.

We have the specialized equipment necessary for boring through hard rock formations. Our licensed blasters have over 50 years of combined experience and can handle any blasting necessary for a tunneling project.  We also handle boring and tunneling projects in difficult soil conditions, such as ground containing gravel, cobbles or excessive ground water.

At J & J Boring, Inc. we enforce rigorous safety and drug policies and are committed to the safety and well being of our employees. Over 90% of our field personnel are OSHA 30 certified.

J & J Boring, Inc. strives to exceed your expectations with our professionalism, timeliness, and responsiveness to your needs. We take pride in our quality, flexibility and innovative approach to projects.

We are ready to assist you with any type of boring or tunneling project. Call us today at 636-566-6766 for a quote on your project.

Name: Applied Energy Partners
Description:
Applied Energy Partners was acquired by SJI in August of 2019 and now operates as EnerConnex. 

EnerConnex is an energy advisory company that combines extensive industry expertise and tech-enabled, processes to help companies manage their power, natural gas, energy risk, and carbon management objectives.
Features of EnerConnex Procurement Services: The ECX Marketplace is the latest online platform developed by the pioneers of the reverse auction technology, with the capability to manage complex energy products and pricing structures. 

Demand Management: Instead of producing more energy, local end-users who voluntarily participate in the program are asked to reduce their energy consumption for a brief period. By reducing the demand instead of increasing supply, the grid saves a substantial amount of money annually, which is then distributed to the program participants.
	EnerConnex partners with you to learn about your energy goals. Next, we’ll utilize our best-in- class ECX Marketplace platform to find the best Demand Management option to fit your needs.
	You earn a recurring revenue stream by infrequently acting as an insurance policy for the grid.
	Each year you can change your contribution up or down.
	No penalties or fees. If you are not able to meet the full commitment you will still be paid on what you have curtailed.
Renewable Energy Expertise: EnerConnex offers turnkey renewable solutions for the entire project life and beyond including:
	Business case development and cash flow analysis
	Design and Engineering
	Financing arrangements
	Secure Rebates and incentives (local & federal)
	Installation

Name: Downers Grove Sanitary District
Description:
The Downers Grove Sanitary District is responsible for providing sanitary sewer service for much of the Village of Downers Grove, the portion of the Village of Westmont west of Cass Avenue, and portions of Woodridge, Lisle, Oak Brook, and Darien, Illinois. We are a separate unit of local government, independent of the municipalities where we provide service. We are not part of the Village of Downers Grove.

We collect sanitary wastewater through over 250 miles of sanitary sewers that we operate and maintain. We also operate and maintain nine wastewater pumping stations located throughout our service area. Sanitary wastewater is collected and treated at our Wastewater Treatment Center, located at 5003 Walnut Avenue in Downers Grove. Our treated wastewater (effluent) is discharged to the East Branch of the DuPage River or St. Joseph’s Creek, as permitted by the State of Illinois with authority from the United States Environmental Protection Agency.

We provide service to 20,000 customers, including wastewater generated by more than 60,000 people, and a number of commercial, industrial, and institutional customers. We have the capacity to treat an average of 11 million gallons per day of sanitary wastewater.

Name: The Glarus Group
Description:
The electric and gas utility industry today holds the keys to solving many global issues.  Increasingly, the industry provides potential solutions for economic growth, environmental stewardship, energy independence, low emission transportation, and energy consumer empowerment.  
Yet, the core infrastructure is aging, both facilities and personnel, causing a trend which cannot be underestimated.  New technologies, primarily information technology, are rapidly entering this arena, often with overblown expectations.  The industry must balance reality with a strong measure of urgency.  Today’s strategic investments must fulfill the promise without short term disruptions.
Transformation, to be successful, requires strategic direction.  Leveraging advanced technology adoption and thoughtful analytics, the industry’s evolution will center on optimizing choice, control, cost, convenience, and collaboration for energy consumers and their environment, both physical and economic.
Along with the promises come the challenges – technology, economics, regulation, environment, and others.

Name: Heber Light & Power
Description:
A Proud History of Service Since 1909

Heber Light & Power is a community owned Utah Energy Services Inter local providing service to more than 11,000 customers in the beautiful Heber Valley. Formed in 1909 by the communities of Heber City, Midway City, and Charleston Town, the company continues to operate the transmission and distribution system spanning 100 square miles in Wasatch County. The utility's service area spans east to the top of Timber Lakes, west to Swiss Mountain Estates and Oak Haven in Midway City, south to Daniel's Canyon, and north to Coyote Lane.

Our Power Portfolio

Heber Light & Power owns and operates three hydroelectric generators and three natural gas power plants with an overall generating capacity of 18 megawatts. In addition to the company owned generation, a power purchase agreement with the Central Utah Water Conservancy District provides HL&P's system with the Jordanelle Dam's hydroelectric capacity of up to 12 megawatts. Over 40 percent of the company's resources are renewable in 2017, beating even the most stringent energy standards across the country.

Looking to the Future

As the Heber Valley population continues to trend upward, the need for increased transmission capacity and new energy resources along with the necessity of replacing and repairing aging infrastructure challenges the company as it strives to provide reliable and affordable service. Transmission, distribution, and generation projects continue to move forward to meet these challenges. The company's commitment to the environment is supported by our net metering customers who continue to invest in distributed solar energy across Heber Light & Power's system. The company looks forward to introducing the Clear Peaks Renewable Energy Program in 2018 to further support our environmentally conscious customers. There is much to look forward to as the company grows with the community it serves.

Name: A-1 McDuffie Sanitation
Description:
THE ROOTS OF MCDUFFIE SANITATION
In 1998, my grandparents founded this company. They named it A-1 McDuffie Sanitation so that it would be listed first in the phone book. I joined their venture in 2009. Over the past 20 years our company has evolved, but our core values have not changed:
 
Honor God with all that we do.
Healthy things grow.
We’re not a sanitation company. We’re a people company that offers a sanitation service.

In 2014, we ordered our first shipment of 96-gallon pink carts. Five dollars from each pink cart go to the American Breast Cancer Society.
Next, we decided we wanted to give our customers another option that could make a difference. In December of 2014, we ordered our first shipment of 96-gallon black carts with a red lid. This is our mission cart and five dollars from each of these carts go toward a local non-profit.

We’ve been dependable and reliable for the past 21 years, and we plan to do that for many more. We have exceptional residential service and we are starting to grow and take on more commercial clients as well. We thank each and every person who’s helped make all of this happen. If it weren’t for our hardworking employees and our fantastic customer base none of this would be possible, so thank you.

Kenneth Havens, CEO
