Name: Cross Canyon Engineering
Description:
Cross Canyon Engineering, LLC was established to provide electrical engineering services to its clients with a quality and value that is second to none. Our focus is on the planning, delivery, and utilization of electric power and ensuring its reliability for clients’ operations. With more than 75 years combined experience, Cross Canyon Engineering can provide the right solution for the right cost.

Protective Relaying and Control
Our engineering team has extensive experience in the design of new and upgrades to all types of protective relaying and control systems. We can provide the full package of design, material specification, integration, relay setting calculations, relay and equipment testing and commissioning.

Substations
We provide complete substation designs including physical layout, conduit and cable design, grounding and lighting protection design, relay protection and control, SCADA design, and material specification.

Planning and Studies
We provide planning and system modeling for distribution and transmission systems, construction work plans, long-range plans, capital cost estimates, and environmental reports. System analysis studies include coordination, complete utility system sectionalizing, load flow, short circuit, voltage drop, motor starting, arc flash hazards, and mitigation and grounding. 

Distribution and Transmission
We provide design, staking, right-of-way and permitting, plan and profile drawings, grounding and lightning protection of distribution and transmission lines.

Generation Interconnection
We have experience with renewable interconnections as well as hydroelectric and gas powerplants. 

Industrial
Switchgear specifications, upgrades, coordination, arc flash assessments and mitigation.

Testing and Commissioning
Full-service testing and commissioning services for protective relay systems, transformers, switchgear, circuit breakers, cables and rotating machinery.

Name: Grid Assurance
Description:
Grid Assurance is the industry’s most certain, secure and cost-effective solution to expedite the restoration of critical, long lead time transmission equipment following significant grid outages.

We provide a fully operational, warranted and maintained reserve of long lead time equipment that is incremental to members’ current operational spares. Our pre-approved logistics and delivery plans help transmission companies restore power faster and more cost-effectively following catastrophic events than other equipment replacement methods and practices.

Name: The Underground Detective
Description:
The Underground Detective provides quality private underground utility locating, utility mapping, ground penetrating radar, concrete scanning, pipe inspections, and vacuum excavation to countless commercial and industrial companies throughout the Midwest for over 20 years. We have experience in electromagnetic locators, sondes, and ground penetrating radar (GPR), including manufactures such as Radiodetection, Subsite, Vivax-Metrotech, Prototek, Goldak, Ridgid, and Mala Geoscience. 
The Underground Detective employees carry a multitude of industry specific certifications, including OSHA 10 Hr., OSHA 40 Hr. Hazwoper, Smith Defensive Driving certification, and customer specific such as BP, Marathon, and Shell to name a few. The Underground Detective has been involved in some amazing projects, including: The Banks Project, University of Tennessee, NASA in Cleveland, working with some of the largest nationwide leaders in the construction and environmental industry, including Kokosing Construction, Pangean-CMD Associates, Messer Construction, Cardno-ATC, URS, Arcadis, CH2M Hill, and Parsons.

Name: Rushmore Electric Power Cooperative
Description:

Rushmore Electric buys the bulk of its power from Basin Electric Power Cooperative who operates coal-fired plants, natural gas plants, renewable energy facilities, and a nuclear plant in Wyoming, Iowa, Montana, South Dakota, and North Dakota.

Rushmore Electric offers the followings services/divisions:
- Rushmore Engineering: A reliable transmission and distribution network are essential for delivering power from generating facilities to the homes and businesses of electric co-op members. Rushmore Engineering’s staff provides Engineering, Planning, and Technical Assistance to the members on a as needed basis. Rushmore Engineering is an integral part of the process of delivering reliable and affordable electric service to our cooperative members.

- Rushmore Communications: The company’s communications subsidiary operates a number of electronic control systems, wireless communications networks and computer systems. Rushmore Communications provides radio communications services to public safety organizations in the Black Hills and surrounding area and to member co-ops in its service region.

- Rushmore Federal Credit Union: Rushmore Electric Federal Credit Union was formed to assist employees and directors of rural electric cooperatives with their financial needs and planning in September 1964.

We are proud to be part of the Touchstone Energy Cooperative Family.

Our clients rely on us for our breadth of knowledge and experience as well as our availability at all times. We are a veteran owned business dedicated to serving our clients and the communities in which we live and work.

Name: Sigora International Inc.
Description:
Sigora International is a speciality provider of utility-management systems engineered for frontier markets. For both established urban grid utilities and rural micro-grid developers, Sigora’s platform transforms energy access  into bankable business.

Leveraging specialized hardware, web-managed software, and simple payment solutions, the Sigora platform streamlines bill collection, reduces revenue losses, deters energy theft, and increases operational efficiency for energy providers operating in emerging markets. It’s easy to oversimplify the capabilities of a simple electric meter, but in reality Sigora’s meter is offering the “operating system” for financeable micro-utility business models.

To see if our solutions are a good fit for your project, visit us at www.sigora.co and reach out via our contact page.

Name: MARS Company
Description:
For over 35 years, MARS Company has proven itself in the waterworks
industry as the leader in custom-designed and fabricated Water
Meter Testing Systems. With over a century of combined experience,
MARS Company takes pride in its commitment to offering new
and innovative advancements that allow utilities to improve their
operation through more accurate, more repeatable, and more
efficient water meter testing processes and better ways to use test
data.

The MARS Water Meter Test Bench System provides the utility of the
ability to test more meters at a time, reduce the time to run each test,
recycle instead of waste the water used to run the test, and generate
highly accurate results. Once testing is completed, there is no need
to manually rekey the test results adding further efficiency and
elimination of errors. The MARS M3 software then provides virtually
unlimited ways to analyze test data to better protect revenue and
allow utilities to make data-driven decisions.

Our experience in correlation and filtering techniques were gained whilst working in a technical role for one of the leading manufacturers of leak detection equipment.  
These techniques have since been applied on a day to day basis when Water Leak Location Services was formed in 2013.

Name: BOLD Transmission
Description:
BOLD Transmission was formed to market and refine BOLD, an innovative line design featuring a compact conductor configuration suspended under a crescent-shaped crossarm, arrayed on a low-profile tubular steel structure. The technology behind BOLD goes far beyond good looks, boosting both capacity and efficiency while eliminating the need for series capacitors.

BOLD lines achieve higher capacity, less impedance and line loss, and improved reliability in a compact form factor. Using an arched crossarm and lower overall height compared to a traditional extra-high voltage line, help BOLD to fit more aesthetically with the environment.

BOLD represents the next-generation transmission line. Efficiency never looked so good.

Our responsive and dynamic business model enables us to mobilize quickly, providing high-quality services performed by guaranteed specialists that optimize plant capacity, and minimize the risk of critical failure or costly rework.

Ramanujan Inc, Inspired by and in honor of the great Ramanujan! 

We firmly believe that "Fundamental to improving quality of life is the Availability, Affordability & Sustainability of power for every Community”


So, Our Vision is to be ...
The preferred choice in Energy Data Management and Analysis by Utilities and the communities they serve. 

Ramanujan Inc is started by team of serial and seasoned entrepreneurs and professionals bound by a conviction that electricity is essential for human progress. As such, this precious energy source should be made available to all communities near and far, when needed, most importantly affordably and sustainably. To achieve this mission, the utility has to continuously monitor the changing needs of its consumers and the ability of the network to deliver the power that they need.  To this end, we pool our expertise and experience in the power utility sector, IT and communications as well as business to bring state-of-the-art products and services to the utility sector and their customers.  

Our Solutions, Services and Products

- Connects Pre-Paid systems
- Connects DLMS and proprietary protocols 

Energy Services on subscription model : Billing, Pre-paid, outage, asset management, energy audits, power quality etc. 


Products

Name: Kansas Municipal Energy Agency (KMEA)
Description:
The Kansas Municipal Energy Agency (KMEA) is a quasi-municipal corporation formed in 1980 under Kansas law as a nonprofit joint action agency.  KMEA is a member-owned, service-driven organization dedicated to providing the expertise and stewardship necessary to secure power in a financially responsible manner for the gas and electric member cities it serves.

KMEA remains steadfast in its ongoing commitment of adding value and helping member cities navigate the rapidly evolving and complex industry.  The Agency is actively engaged and responsive to its members’ short-term, intermediate, and long-term energy needs with innovative solutions.  KMEA is at the forefront of emerging industry developments that could adversely or positively impact its members, whether market driven, regulatory, or technological.  KMEA is agile, as member needs and market trends dictate.  KMEA maintains a member-centric approach; one of continuous improvement, in order to remain the energy solution provider of choice.

Servicing hospitals, malls, hotels, residential condominiums, churches, prisons, airports, pharmaceutical and companies alike.

Whether you’re a municipality, a cooperative or a rural community, you’re probably seeking better solutions to your metering challenges, from cost savings and better customer service to increasing your overall productivity. Extensive parts inventory.

Name: Utility Revenue Services
Description:
Founded in 2007, URS started as a third-party utility audit company and has grown to become a national leader in seamless utility management for real estate owners, developers, and management companies. As an independent energy management and procurement company, we support development teams by handling all utilities from set up to billing and everything in between, before ground is broken until the property is turned over to operations.

URS maximizes net operating income and streamlines all utility operations by optimizing the intersection of development, construction, and utilities. Our services include utility auditing, developer assistance, sustainability services, expert guidance in gas and electric procurement, and compliance.

We specialize in revenue optimization for multifamily and commercial real estate owners and operators by using various auditing measures to increase utility net operating income (NOI) and implement energy management initiatives to decrease utility costs. We are committed to providing our clients with trusted solutions that work within their management structure while growing their bottom line.

Name: North Central Electric, Inc.
Description:
Since 1988 North Central Electric, Inc. has been helping our customers install and maintain a reliable electric power system.  NCE offers a full-spectrum of electrical contractor capabilities including design and engineering, construction, testing and commissioning, and project management.  We are constantly growing our capabilities in order to meet our customer demands.  NCE is an affiliated company of NECA, NETA, and the IBEW.
North Central Electric, Inc. is a leader in technical services.  We pride ourselves on our ability to help you avoid unplanned outages from ever occurring.  NCE utilizes state of the art equipment and practices to meet your electrical needs.  We work closely with the manufacturers to insure that the equipment being installed and tested is safe for operation.  NCE makes sure that all of its procedures and practices fall under the standards provided by OSHA, ANSI/NETA, NFRA 70E, IEEE, and the National Electric Code.  
In an ever growing and evolving electric utility and power generation industry, NCE has proven to grow and evolve with it.  We owe this to our highly trained and qualified technicians.  Their expertise, knowledge, and experience has enabled NCE to continually succeed and meet project demands on time.  As a company, we value the continuing education of our employees to make sure they are well trained in the most up to date regulations of equipment operation, testing procedures, and most importantly employee safety. 
North Central Electric, Inc. is committed to providing our customers with the highest quality of workmanship and professionalism.  We work closely with our clients to regularly schedule maintenance and testing programs.  NCE delivers clear and concise reports on the present condition of your equipment, recommended corrective action, and documentation for your safety, insurance, and management reports.

At National Water Service, we set the standard for home water treatment, filtration & purification, as well as a complete line of well pumps, boosters & more for over 45 years. Our new Plumbing Division offers everything from rough-ins, water heaters, gas work, sump pumps & so much more. If you need it, we have it! In addition to offering outstanding service and workmanship, our staff is friendly and eager to answer any of your questions.

In dealing with Residential areas, one of the important things a homeowner needs to consider is water quality. Before any decision should be made, a well informed homeowner should have his/her water evaluated. It is important to note that whether on City Water or a Well System, water quality can vary quite a bit from neighborhood to neighborhood.

National Water Service is happy to do a basic analysis at no charge. And if extensive testing is deemed necessary, we have water testing services available for virtually any contaminant at a reasonable rate.

Name: American PowerNet
Description:
American PowerNet is dedicated to providing industry-leading energy management expertise to commercial, industrial, and governmental entities.  American PowerNet is not affiliated with any utility or marketer.  American PowerNet's services focus on retail and wholesale energy procurement and, providing our clients a full array of money-saving, supply-side energy procurement management services.

American PowerNet began buying power for clients in 1997.  Since then, we have facilitated power purchases for over 5,000 accounts across America, in nearly every deregulated market.  American PowerNet introduced the wholesale procurement model almost 20 years ago.  Subsequently, American PowerNet has received international achievement awards for implementing our wholesale electric procurement structure at two Fortune 500 companies.  

Now American PowerNet is innovating again incorporating blockchain technology into the electric procurement infrastructure making the electric grid and the procurement system more efficient than ever.  In this evolving, volatile energy environment, American PowerNet can help you “manage the energy evolution.”

Emergency Service When You Need It: We're here for you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

You will find no other Westchester or Fairfield County HVAC contractor better set up to handle your emergency and urgent needs. Name: Revenue Source Group, Inc.
Description:
Revenue Source Group is a 30 year old firm specializing in reducing monthly utility costs.

RSG's team of experts examines utility invoices then makes recommendations that will reduce monthly expenditures and, in many cases, produce refunds. The client is under no obligation to accept the recommendations and there are no up front fees for our services. RSG is only compensated when our clients save money.

If our clients are being overbilled, RSG will find the money.

Name: Utility Structural Systems - USS
Description:
For more than 40 years, Utility Structural Systems, its backfill foam technicians in Houston, TX, and its parent companies have been dedicated to helping the electric utility industry make the “wires” portion of their companies become more reliable. In today’s deregulated environment, system reliability has become vitally important for each utility.

With Poleset, we brought you the first polyurethane foam for setting and straightening utility poles of all types. Poleset was initially a standard backfill foam, but with the combined efforts of Utility Structural Systems and utility field personnel, we realized something more was needed. We, again, revolutionized the industry by bringing the industry’s only water-insensitive polyurethane backfill to the market. Poleset had taken an enormous step forward in research. Never before had the industry been exposed to such a product. In 1989, Utility Structural Systems took another giant step forward by developing the first CFC-Free polyurethane backfill system for the utility market. With these major improvements, we’ve changed the name of the product from Poleset, to POLY-SET.

We are now proud to bring you POLY-GROUND. We have, again, led the industry in supplying the first electrically conductive polyurethane backfill for setting poles and ground rods. It took almost four years to make, and it is now ready for you to use to enhance your system grounding and reliability.

Name: Exeter Associates
Description:
Exeter Associates, Inc. is an independent consulting firm located in Columbia, Maryland. Established in 1981, Exeter provides energy and economics consulting services in the areas of public utility regulation and antitrust economics. The firm maintains the highest standards in the application of economic and financial analysis to both quantitative and policy issues in the electric, natural gas, and other industries.

The company has its office in Albany, New York and supports clients all over North America and Internationally. GRID20/20, Inc. offers a World-Class OptaNODE(TM) Distribution Transformer Monitoring solution for the electricity utility space.  The company’s turnkey approach involves patented, versatile hardware and two separate analytics suite options. GRID20/20 assists utilities throughout the globe to identify technical/non-technical losses, reduce distribution inefficiencies, and maximize reliability.

GRID20/20 enables electric utilities to optimize their distribution management practices, and provides an accelerated ROI path.  

Key Specialties include:
  - OptaNODE Distribution Transformer Monitors (DTMs)
  - OptaNODE INSIGHT Advanced Analytics
  - OptaNODE HESS Basic Analytics
  - Technical/Non-Technical Loss Identification
  - Asset Loading Information
  - Predictive Maintenance Awareness
  - Electric Vehicle and Distributed Generation Impacts
  - Capacity Contribution Identification/Targeted Demand Response
  - Conservation Voltage Reduction (CVR)
  - Communications Flexibility
  - Patented Sensing Solution

For more information, visit www.grid2020.com, email us at info@grid2020.com, or contact us at +1-804-918-1982.

Name: Safe Site Utility Services, LLC
Description:
Unrivaled Utility Locating Experts

Safe Site Utility Services is a full service subsurface utility locating firm (level D, Level C, Level B, Level A). Safe Site has a wide range of equipment and unparalleled experience - 35+ years - which allows us to be more effective than others in the industry. Our technicians are proficient in the operation and interpretation of all types of underground utility locating equipment. 

Our proficiency, and meticulous attention to detail is what separates Safe Site from others in the industry and allows us to provide unrivaled SUE/SUI services. Safe Site performs a complete Subsurface Utility Investigation (SUI) utilizing various applicable geophysical means including electromagnetic locating, ferromagnetic locating, acoustic locating, and ground penetrating radar (GPR / C-GPR). Our goal on every project is to identify any and all potential utility conflicts so there are no surprises during construction.

Licensed, Bonded & Insured. Serving Arizona, Southern California, Nevada and surrounding states.

We offer a combination of domain expertise and technology to deliver the optimum drive and motor solution for a wide range of applications in all industrial segments. Through our global presence we are always close to serve our customers. Building on over 140 years of cumulative experience in electric powertrains, we learn and improve every day. ABB is a technology leader in electrification and automation, enabling a more sustainable and resource-efficient future. The company’s solutions connect engineering know-how and software to optimize how things are manufactured, moved, powered, and operated. Name: Schreiber
Description:
Since the 1930s, when Dr. August Schreiber’s biological purification plants dotted the German countryside, Schreiber has developed innovative products for advanced biological wastewater treatment. Extensive, ongoing research and development led Schreiber to its Counter Current Aeration technology and the first activated sludge plant in the 1960s. The company introduced its Model GR aeration technology in 1979 in its first US installation.
   In 1980, Schreiber developed the single reactor-basin approach for advanced biological wastewater treatment —a technology that would lead to the development of Schreiber Flex Controls and the Continuously Sequencing Reactor. In 1995, Schreiber introduced the Fuzzy Filter, a compressible media filter system. Schreiber’s FlexControls monitoring and control systems, patented in 2008, give facilities state-of-the-art tools to maximize efficiency.
   Today Schreiber offers individual wastewater components, complete systems, and a wide range of energy-efficient and innovative wastewater treatment solutions, from influent to final discharge. With the highest quality fit and finish, Schreiber’s durable systems help achieve low operating costs while consistently meeting or exceeding our customers’ expectations. Schreiber now also provides solutions-based approaches to the food processing, pulp and paper, power, mining, oil and gas, and chemicals markets.

Purpose
“To Improve water, and to have a positive influence on all who come in contact with Schreiber.”

Mission
“The go-to solutions based company in water resource recovery offering proprietary equipment solutions to customers who value a consultative/comprehensive approach.”

Name: Small Water Systems Services, LLC
Description: Small Water Systems Services, LLC (SWSS) is an utilities company located at 80 Taylor Street, Littleton, MA, United States. We currently operate over 180 water and wastewater utility systems across Massachusetts and Southern New Hampshire, which combined, serve well over 100,000 people. SWSS was founded in 1995 by Deborah Trumbull and her husband Bruce Trumbull when the DEP began to pressure non-municipal, privately owned water systems to hire licensed water operators to operate and maintain their facilities, or to become licensed themselves.  One of the owners, Deborah Trumbull, was working full-time for the Littleton Water Department back then and was approached at that time to operate a small water system in the neighboring town. She saw an opportunity, said "yes" and started the company on a part-time basis. Over the next few years, the list of contracted water - and wastewater - systems grew and the company began to take shape and prosper, becoming Small Water Systems Services, LLC., or SWSS.  From a simple after-work, part-time, "side-job", SWSS has grown into a stable, successful company with over 25 employees, a 10,000 sq. ft. office building and a growing fleet of trucks. With a fully-staffed, experienced Administrative team, along with complete Water, Wastewater and Maintenance Divisions comprised of very competent, highly skilled and qualified teams of licensed operators and tradesmen, SWSS offers complete and comprehensive service to both the water and wastewater industries.  With dedication and commitment, as well as our cooperation and respect for each other, for the water and wastewater industries we serve, for the local and state regulatory agencies we answer to, and ultimately for the important services we provide to our clients, SWSS has become a strong company with a great reputation. This, in turn has enabled us to grow, be successful and become a regional leader in both water and wastewater utility system services.

Name: Rosedale-Rio Bravo Water Storage District

The Rosedale-Rio Bravo Water Storage District was formed in 1959 to replenish the groundwater pumped by its overlying users. This important task is accomplished by importing and recharging surface water into the groundwater aquifer. Rosedale uses a series of canals, wells, pipelines, and ponds to recharge groundwater to provide sustainable groundwater access for its landowners.

OUR PURPOSE
To be responsible stewards of water, a valued resource.

OUR MISSION
Building a sustainable water supply to help our community thrive.

Sustainability

We have also focused on improving and maintaining high quality standards relating to the work we perform for our customers, implementing checklists to be reviewed and completed in the field by our Field Supervisors along with an internal inspection program. AARC Consultants serves businesses and governmental entities by conducting third party Risk and Resilience assessments, identifying Cyber Security vulnerabilities, developing plans of action to manage those risks and vulnerabilities, designing sustainable infrastructures, providing expert advice on Homeland Security matters, and offering turn-key Environmental, Health, Safety and Security (EHSS) compliance services.

In 2012, AARC Consultants emerged from its parent company, AARC Environmental, an EHSS consulting firm which has specialized in regulatory compliance for the last 25 years and continues to have loyal, satisfied clients.
With its offices from coast to coast, AARC Consultants has been able to assemble a team of experts who are known to be among the best in their field. Municipalities of all sizes, Fortune 500 businesses, and small entrepreneurs partner with AARC Consultants, which allows them to provide a reliable and sustainable future for their customers and shareholders.

Name: CrescoNet

Enrich LI Company: California Statewide Gas Emerging Technologies Program (GET)
Name: California Statewide Gas Emerging Technologies Program (GET)
Description:
The Statewide Gas Emerging Technologies Program(GET), is a collaboration between California’s investor owned utilities to advance promising energy-efficient technologies. The program aims to identify and evaluate currently commercially available technologies, and further market readiness of promising concepts that may be ready in three to five years. These proposals will be evaluated as potential measures for future energy-efficient programs.

Working with cross functional stakeholders, the GET program will source and screen technologies, gather necessary technical and savings potential data, identify key market barriers to adoption, and develop strategies to overcome these barriers.

Contact us at: get@caenergyprograms.com

Name: The "PWRMFG" Group of Companies
Description:
The "PWRMFG" GROUP OF COMPANIES consists of three separate divisions that manufactures and distributes stainless steel and bronze corrosion resistant Overhead Transmission & Distribution products for the Power Utility, Telecommunications, and Cable Television Sectors. These products are mean't for highly corrosive environments that are typical in island coastal regions, as well as areas where salt, fog and industrial pollutants prevail.

The group also provides a full range Certification, Cyclic & Destructive Testing for Wire Rope, Wire Rope Slings, Synthetic Rope, Synthetic Slings, Spreader Bars, and Metal Fabrication Products as well as generating full Certified Test Reports. 

The Group’s Divisions are:
(1) Performance Wire Rope Manufacturing, LLC
(2) Power Manufacturing, LLC
(3) Power Reeling Products

www.pwrmfg.com

www.powerreeling.com

Name: MeterSYS
Description:
MeterSYS specializes in the selection, analysis, and implementation of advanced metering solutions and smart city applications for public utilities and agencies. Our investments in technology research, along with collaborative industry partnerships, provides our clients with a diverse team of dedicated operational and technical professionals for "end to end" implementation of devices, networks, and device data management systems (DDMS). The MeterSYS signature Metering as a Service program is a leader in full, turn-key design and implementation of AMI and IoT networks and is unparalleled in the industry.

Name: FacilityConneX
Description:
Smart Facility Monitoring… Anytime, Anywhere 

Cloud-based continuous monitoring, predictive equipment analytics, and Energy optimization solutions that save you money!

Get Connected with FacilityConneX

Smart monitoring just got “Smarter” with FacilityConneX, a new enterprise cloud monitoring solution that delivers advanced asset monitoring, predictive intelligence, continuous energy management, and equipment optimization – anytime, anywhere via browser or smartphone.

Powered by GE Proficy Software

FacilityConneX is a Smart Monitoring solution engineered to improve facility and equipment performance and costs. It connects machines, data, insights, and people – providing an anytime, anywhere “Smart View” of infrastructure problems and performance.

Who uses FacilityConneX? 

Our solution is designed for any professional directly responsible for managing performance and costs of various facility systems and equipment. Our customers also include engineering and contract consultants involved in retro-commissioning and other services that help clients optimize building performance and reduce energy costs.

Get Connected in Hours!

FacilityConneX is pre-configured to connect with over 200 system and equipment protocols and drivers – located anywhere throughout your facility and remote locations. The solution is comprised of three software modules, Anytime, Anywhere (a mobile dashboard for Smart Monitoring from any device), Notify Now (problem detection and notification), and Detect & Know (predictive analytics).

Name: NUCA of Colorado

Name: EnergyMark, LLC
Description:
At EnergyMark, we serve more than 15,000 customers throughout the United States.

We help customers navigate energy challenges ranging from volatile supply costs, utility bill audits and budget management to achieving sustainability goals while saving money with programs like Demand Response and Community Solar.

The world is changing and so is the energy landscape. Managing energy, what kind you use, and when and how you use it, is becoming increasingly important. These changes have implications on bottom line, resilience, and operational efficiency. Partnering with EnergyMark can help your business navigate these challenges seamlessly.

Because of our deep experience in the industry, we're uniquely positioned to help with your business's energy procurement and management at any scale, holistically, from start to finish.

Name: The Wasmer Company
Description:
The Wasmer Company is a full service energy efficiency consulting firm, comprised of a team of certified Energy Efficiency Consultants and Professional Engineers who are trained to develop and implement fully integrated energy efficient systems.  

We work with business owners around the world, educating them on how they can dramatically cut costs and increase both productivity and profitability, while reducing the negative effects energy consumption has on air quality and water supply.

We know that education is the key to future growth so we focus on teaching how to take advantage of energy savings. Our focus is not on “selling”.

Our mission is to help maximize our client's success, while making a positive impact on our mutual employees, our communities and the planet. We empower business owners to achieve greater profitability by helping them save time and money through energy efficient sustainability practices. 

The Wasmer Company will:

-Work to make the process painless for you, offering support and guidance every step of the way.
-Offer complete energy audit of your facility helping you determine how many kWh you want to reduce and how to make it happen.
-Uncovering hidden energy waste
-Helping you take advantage of potential tax advantages
-Complete your capital request for you as well as provide financing options.

Name: US Jetting
Description:
Located in the North Atlanta suburbs of Alpharetta, Georgia, US Jetting is an industry-leading manufacturer of high-pressure water jetting equipment specially designed for cleaning sewer, drain and pipe lines plus culverts and special applications. The company was established in 1991 by Nick Woodhead who introduced high-pressure low water volume water jetting to the US Market several years earlier.
Now with over 2,000 water jetting units currently in use within the United States and around the world, we take pride in offering our customers outstanding products, support and customer service. The markets we serve includes plumbing, sewer, drain contractors plus government organizations such as municipalities, cities, counties, schools, airports, military installations and federal facilities.

Name: Integral Analytics
Description:
Since 2006, Integral Analytics has developed and delivered the electric industry’s highest-performing data-science software that allows utilities and grid-edge participants to plan, forecast, value, invest and execute change on the distribution system. Our applications form the analytics core for decision making that supports the evolution of the electric utility while preserving reliability and lowest cost to operate. 

Greentech Media awarded Integral Analytics its 2016 Grid Edge and 2015 Fierce Innovation awards, citing "real-time and decades-ahead scope of distributed energy resource (DER) integration."

In July 2017, Integral Analytics was acquired by Willdan, helping to better serve its utility clients.

Our customers include electric power transmission & distribution companies, industrial & commercial energy users, and government and research organizations. We develop and support the PQView software system, which is the industry standard for power quality database management, data analysis, and automatic fault location.

Our internal “PCC” core value system in serving you as a customer is simple but designed to ensure complete and on time delivery, where: 

1. “P”erformance is a team equation;

Each and every project we undertake is guided by our PCC curriculum. We are accountable for our work so that our team and our output is held to, and against, the highest operational standard.

Name: Reiner Pump Systems Inc
Description:
Reiner Pump Systems
NJ, NY, PA, ID, OR, WA Water & Wastewater Pump Company

We offer submersible and dry-pit wastewater pumps, packaged pump stations, split-case, vertical turbine pumps, mixers, turbo compressors, pressure sewer systems, end-suction pumps, and booster systems. ReinerPump.com

Description:
At ESTA International, we recognize that the electric energy sector is undergoing fundamental change. Our mission is to empower our clients to adapt and thrive in this evolving landscape. Our commitment to leveraging business intelligence, industry expertise, and collaborative partnerships ensures that we deliver innovative solutions tailored to the unique challenges of today’s evolving energy landscape.

Name: CBS Nuclear Services Inc.
Description:
Our Charlotte facility offers certified service of nuclear safety related circuit breakers but also provides power system services to industrial and commercial facilities in the Southeastern region. We stock replacement power circuit breakers for all manufactures and vintages after WWII. 

First and foremost we are a service company and Solution Provider. We are capable of repairing, building, and testing electrical power systems at one of our many service shops. We specialize in electrical equipment with voltages between 480V and 38kV. 

• We supply new or remanufactured custom built switchgear to match your existing lineup or for new installations.
 • We stock over 5 million circuit breakers and parts for all metal clad switchgear built since World War II.
 • We custom build or supply remanufactured low and medium voltage motor controllers.
 • We supply new and remanufactured dry type transformers from 1000kVA to 5000kVA.
 • On site field service and repair of all power distribution equipment and support systems 
• Remote breaker and racking NFPA 70E arc flash mitigation solutions.
 • Non-destructive corona, and PD testing.
 • On site testing and maintenance of breakers, transformers, relays, grounding systems, and auxiliary equipment per ANSI/NETA testing specifications

Name: Aquam Pipe Diagnostics
Description:
Aquam Pipe Diagnostics is a specialized technology provider focused on Pipeline Assessments and Inspection solutions. What is a pipe inspection? Aquam Pipe Diagnostics has pioneered non-disruptive pressurized water main CCTV and NDT condition assessment technologies. The Investigator, LDS 1000, and PipeScan+ are the trifecta suite of technologies Aquam Pipe Diagnostics offers industrial, municipal, institutional and utility companies worldwide. Aquam Pipe Diagnostics also offers these technologies to licensees.

Why are pipeline inspections important? In the US alone 2 trillion gallons of water is lost each year and 34% of the water pumped globally ends up as non-revenue water due to water leaks and main breaks. Aquam Pipe Diagnostics technology can assess weak points in a pipeline, preventing costly leaks and main breaks. Pipeline inspections save money and water. Aquam Pipe Diagnostics provides condition assessments, inspections, and pinpoint leak detection solutions for pressurized water, gas and industrial pipeline infrastructure.  

For more information: 
info@aquamcorp.com
http://aquampd.com

Name: Unipipe Solutions
Description:
Unipipe is a modular aluminum piping system available in a broad range of sizes, pressures and fittings. Our standard walled pipe is rated for 232 PSI while our heavy-wall pipe is rated for 1015 PSI. Best of all, no special tools or training are required for assembly or installation. We offer 5 different types of pipe in 13 different sizes for compressed air, nitrogen, vacuum, high pressure and oils & fluids.

The Unipipe design produces a fitting with exceptionally secure joints that is superior to every other aluminum pipe system on the market. The brilliant engineered design of the fittings, and the double-bite ring, offers a system in which the pipe will fail before the fitting fails. This means safety for your team and piece of mind for you. Check out how our product performs compared to our competitors in this pipe burst demonstration video.

Not only does Unipipe install over 3 times faster than iron or copper pipe, the smooth laminar flow of the interior of the pipe ensures steady and consistent air flow in your system. Since aluminum doesn’t rust, moisture in the lines of your system will not cause the pipe to rust and clog. Unipipe connects together quickly and easily, only basic standard tools are required to create a complex piping system. No Grooving. No Crimping. No Special Tools. No Special Training.

Unipipe isn’t just for compressed air. We offer a range of different piping for nitrogen, vacuum, high pressure and oils & fluids. Our high pressure piping boasts two times the wall thickness of our standard pipe and is the only aluminum piping system on the market rated to 1015 psi. If you’re serious about high pressures and process fluids, you need Unipipe.

To back it all up, we offer an industry-leading 20 Year Warranty on our systems with the guarantee to not leak or fail. With that type of assurance, why wouldn’t you consider Unipipe for your next process piping project? 
 
Request your demo kit today!

Name: Hive Power Engineering LLC
Description: Hive Power Engineering LLC (HIVE) provides engineering design and consulting services primarily in Transmission and Distribution sector for power utilities (or private renewable energy sector). Our small size enables us to be quick in decision making process to promptly tend to our clients’ urgent needs with innovative and efficient solutions, impressing our clients every time.

Name: Tahoe City Public Utility District
Description:
The Tahoe City Public Utility District was founded in 1938 to provide some of the governmental needs of the residents of Tahoe City. It is the oldest local government in the Tahoe Basin and was formed initially to provide public water service to the local community. Established under the State of California's Public Utility District Act, the founders of the District chose a form of government that could provide multiple types of services.

The mission of the Tahoe City Public Utility District is to serve the people in our community, as well as the environment. It is our responsibility to provide safe and reliable water service, sewer service for the protection of public health, and parks and recreation services to enhance quality of life. We are committed to achieving these and other tasks within the scope of the Public Utility District Act in a sound fiscal manner.

Name: American Efficiency Services, LLC
Description:
Contact Information:
877-816-9081
info@americanefficiency.com

AES is your source for safe, superior, guaranteed Leak Detection, Tube Cleaning, and Industrial Inspections. Our services include large and small heat exchanger tube cleaning, and vacuum/pressure inspections on:

•Turbine / Condensers for Air Inleakage
•Condenser Tube Leakage
•Small Heat Exchanger Tube Leakage
•Electrical Generator Hydrogen Leakage
•Vacuum Tower Inleakage
•Tube Cleaning (Small/Large Heat Exchangers)
•Expansion Joint Replacement (Rubber)
•Eddy Current Testing
•Above Ground Pipe Line Leaks

Any vacuum or pressure system has the potential to be inspected on and/or off line with AES techniques. AES has provided these services to a wide variety of industries including electrical generating, petrochemical, food processing, pharmaceutical, and ethanol producing facilities.

Traveling from office locations in Maryland (our headquarters), Florida, Missouri, and Texas, AES is ready and able to quickly and cost-effectively mobilize anywhere in the world. We have provided services to customers across the United States and in Mexico, Canada, the Philippines, India, Qatar, Chile, Argentina, the Dominican Republic, the Bahamas and Puerto Rico.

AES is the industry leader in
Leak detection and tube cleaning services – GUARANTEED!

Name: Aquify - an Exelon Company
Description:
Aquify is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Exelon Corporation, the nation’s largest power and gas utility operator and leading competitive energy provider. Our utilities led the Smart Grid revolution—installing sensors and meters and deploying advanced analytics and automation resulting in unprecedented reliability, resilience and responsiveness. Aquify is leveraging Exelon’s vast knowledge, experience, people and assets to help water utilities operate more proactively and efficiently. 

Aquify is your complete water distribution network intelligence solution. We use advanced sensor technology, machine learning-enabled analytics software, and our 24/7 engineering and operations center to deliver continuous system insight, so you always know what’s happening in your water network.

We help you identify leaks before they surface, avoid costly main-breaks and extend asset life. Reduce non-revenue water, get recurring operational benefits and increase customer satisfaction.

Aquify’s Network Operations Control (NOC) analysts operate as an ‘extension of your staff’. We support your existing workforce with a 24/7 utility monitoring staff and analytics experts.

Aquify levels the playing field and makes it easy for municipalities of all sizes to realize the benefits of internal and external datasets and advanced analytics through a unique shared service model.

Name: HydroDigital, LLC
Description:
HydroDigital is a digital water company that helps utilities adopt digital technologies to manage water. Our core team has worked together for nearly two decades implementing advanced digital solutions. Our team can help your utility reduce implementation risks, facilitate change management process, and increase the overall return of investment.

Our team specializes in the use of Real-Time Decision Support Systems (RT-DSS) that help utilities optimize the operation of their water infrastructure. RT-DSS expand the scope of traditional Real-Time Controls (RTC) by leveraging sensors, digital twins, and algorithms to optimize the operations.

HydroDigital founders Luis Montestruque and Timothy Ruggaber have worked exclusively in the design, implementation, and commissioning of RT-DSS since 2004 for more than 40 utilities in the United States and abroad.

We practice a glass-box approach that ensures clarity and transparency. Our collaborative co-design process is at the center of every utility's development for sustainable and accessible RT-DSS.

Name: International Directional Drilling (IDD)
Description:
We provide Horizontal directional drilling (HDD), commonly called directional boring, which is a steerable trenchless method of installing underground pipes, conduits and cables in a shallow arc along a prescribed bore path by using a surface-launched drilling rig with minimal impact on the surrounding area. Directional boring is used when trenching or excavating is not practical. It is suitable for a variety of soil conditions and jobs including road, landscape and river crossings

Our Services

IDD provides a quality and environmentally friendly service whether your project is big or small we can provide an affordable and proven solution for your project! Installing utilities is our specialty and by utilizing directional boring methods we have proven to save our customers time and money while preventing unnecessary disruption. 

•	fiber-optic cabling for homes, businesses, government & telecommunications
•	overhead utility undergrouding construction services
•	pulling to termination, power cables, fiber-optic cables and other utility services
•	pull back HDPE, rigid conduit, water lines, cables, phone and fiber-optics.
•	canal boring, road and highway, driveways, forced utility relocation and irrigation

Enrich LI Company: Cloud 9 Services, a Wind River Environmental Company
Name: Cloud 9 Services, a Wind River Environmental Company
Description:
Cloud 9 Services, LLC is the underground plumbing and utility company that commercial, industrial, and municipal HOAs and property managers all over Central Florida consistently turn to. As a licensed and certified company that specializes in mechanical, plumbing, and underground utility and excavation, we stand out against our competitors. One reason why we have become the leading utility company in Orlando is because we never close. Our customers can get in touch with us during an emergency at any time of the day or night. However, being able to get in contact with us at any time is just one of the benefits of working with Cloud 9 Services, LLC.

No other business in the Orlando area performs mechanical, plumbing, and underground utility work with as much precision and skill as we do. Sometimes, finding the root of an underground plumbing issue can be difficult because these issues arise in an area that cannot be seen easily. At Cloud 9 Services, LLC, we are able to find the root of any problem and solve any type of issue with ease and efficiency.

Not only are we able to solve any sort of underground plumbing issue, but the services we offer our customers are comprehensive and varied. No longer will have you have to jump from one company to other when you work with Cloud 9 Services, LLC. because we do it all. We perform pipe repair, hydro-excavation, drain cleaning, sanitary sewer line repair & cleaning, Jet-Vac inspections, lift station maintenance & repair, video pipe inspection, and much more. Whatever underground utility, plumbing, or construction job in the greater Orlando Florida area, you bring to us, we guarantee that we can do it right!

Name: Fox River Water Reclamation District
Description: The Fox River Water Reclamation District (FRWRD) owns and operates three water reclamation facilities (WRFs): the Albin D. Pagorski WRF (ADP WRF), the North WRF, and the West WRF; and 12 remote pump stations in the collection system.  The WRFs provide wastewater treatment services to over 200,000 people within the communities of Elgin, South Elgin, West Dundee, portions of Sleepy Hollow, Streamwood, Hoffman Estates, unincorporated St. Charles Township, and surrounding areas in Kane and Cook Counties.

Name: JB's High Voltage
Description:
We are a high voltage contractor in Northern California specializing in transmission and  distribution construction and maintenance. We are committed to providing superior solutions to all our clients’ electrical needs in a safe, efficient, reliable and professional manner.

JB’s High Voltage provides highly trained and qualified staff to support our client’s transmission, distribution, and substation needs. 

*Power line construction
*Overhead/Underground construction and maintenance
*Reliability Inspection of Overhead/Underground
*24/7 Emergency and storm response
*Construction and Project Management

Our crew of certified journey-level linemen understand the importance of maintaining the highest standard of professionalism in the industry, and we are committed to protecting and promoting our clients’ reputation and public image with the same devotion and determination with which we maintain our own.  We don’t just work for our clients, we partner with them in their power delivery challenges and needs!  JB’s professional work crews maintain a clean and safe work environment, professional appearances and behavior, and are each held accountable to uphold our company’s mission and core values in providing the highest level of professionalism, craftsmanship, work ethic and customer service at all times.

Name: Pioneer Community Energy
Description:
Pioneer Community Energy is the locally owned, not-for-profit electric energy provider for Grass Valley, Nevada City, Placer and El Dorado counties, Auburn, Colfax, Lincoln, Placerville, Rocklin, and the town of Loomis. The Pioneer Governing Board is comprised of representatives from each of its member agencies.

Pioneer Community Energy is committed to helping customers save money, supporting local economic development, and offering our exclusive 100% renewable energy option for customers who choose it. Between 2018 and 2023, Pioneer has saved customers nearly $85 million.

Pioneer procures the electric supply and related products, while PG&E transmits and delivers the electric power over PG&E’s poles and wires.

Pioneer currently provides retail electric generation service to approximately 160,000+ accounts in its service territory, including 40,000+ NEM solar customers.


Pioneer procures the electric supply and related products, while PG&E transmits and delivers the electric power over PG&E’s poles and wires. 
Pioneer sets the rates for electricity that it procures and provides to its customers. 

Participating retail generation customers receive one bill from PG&E, which reflects both Pioneer generation and PG&E delivery charges. Pioneer currently provides retail electric generation service to approximately 92,000 accounts within its service footprint with its customers consuming approximately 1,200 gigawatt hours of electric energy annually. Approximately 18% of Pioneer’s customers are NEM solar customers.

Name: HALO WATER SYSTEMS, LLC

Name: Hampton Tedder Technical Services
Description: We have over 4 decades of testing experience in NETA certified field testing, emergency repair, engineering studies, and maintenance troubleshooting.

Name: STAR Turbine, Inc.
Description:
Since 1988, STAR has relentlessly pursued client excellence. STAR Turbine understands and addresses turbine distortion. STAR is not just in the business of making turbine seals, we are creating turbine efficiency. We willl do whatever it takes to get a turbine up and running to top performance levels.

The STAR team is passionate about the company's MISSION TO MASTER DISTORTION. The team understands how important their role is in upgrading turbine efficiencies. Every part is micro-customized to compensate for turbine distortion. We aim to exceed customer expectations by giving them 110% effort through the design, manufacturing, and installation of our custom seals.

STAR FIELD FIT mobilizes to be on site assessing distortion and returning with equipment to accurately install STAR's custom designed seals to ensure maximum turbine performance. The STAR FIELD FIT team is highly trained on the geometry of packing, the packing holder, and their impact on turbine performance. Neck lengths, packing height and width, back travel, restrictions, and radial and axial shifts are all considerations that effect performance.

The future is bright as we take the STAR Turbine experience further into the Gas, Coal generation, Nuclear, Biomass, Waste to Energy, Geothermal, and Solar markets.

Name: Source Technologies, LLC

Clients partner with us to manage their risk when it comes to energy costs, but more importantly, they partner with us because we listen.

Name: NRECA Essence
Description:
Properly monitoring power grids requires a full understanding of allowable payload structure and content in order to identify malicious or anomalous behaviors. Essence leverages multi-domain situational awareness based on years of dedicated research to flag in real-time any deviations from normal grid and network communications behavior.

The Essence platform detects a diverse set of vulnerabilities both at the grid and communications levels, and works directly with utilities, their vendors and their grid equipment OEMs to patch cyber vulnerabilities present across their OT asset networks.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Romtec Utilities

Romtec Utilities engineers and supplies all structural, mechanical, electrical, and communications components for its systems. Romtec Utilities is located at 18240 North Bank Rd. in Roseburg, Oregon. Reach us at 541-496-9678, or visit at www.romtecutilities.com.

Through a combination of technical expertise, industry alliances and prodigious management, we precisely navigate the often complex and intimidating world of energy legislation, taxation, regulation and technology. We have a unique vision, geared towards the long-term goals and sustainability of our clients. Municipal utilities operate on a not-for-profit basis overseen by a local governing board composed of local citizens and elected officials.

Your Source for Pumps & Control Systems!!

Name: Strategic Power Systems, Inc.
Description:
Strategic Power Systems, Inc. (SPS) is a global energy and information technology company.  We are experts in the field of data collection, validation, analysis, and benchmarking of power plant performance across the various technologies.  Central to all of our products & services is the ORAP database, a comprehensive resource for current and historical RAM performance data.  ORAP represents a significant cross section of turbine related equipment (both thermal, wind, and Solar PV) from a variety of OEMs, operating in various duty cycles and applications.  

SPS can be counted on to be a third-party, unbiased source of information providing key performance metrics or (KPIs), following industry standards, to power plant owners, operators, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and other industry stakeholders.  In addition to our traditional benchmarking and analytics service, we can provide customers with automated data collection applications, detailed critical parts life tracking, as well as Reliability Engineering expertise when analyzing ORAP data for custom studies and reports.  ORAP Data Fusion, our newest service offering, provides game-changing machine learning techniques (developed with the support of a DOE National Laboratory, that allow power plant Asset Managers the ability to PREDICT and PREPARE for the adverse behavior of physical systems, components, materials, and designs, while providing sufficient time and guidance for cost effective corrective action.

Name: Utility Systems, Inc.
Description:
Utility Systems Inc. has long been a leader in the design and manufacturing of disturbance fault recording devices. Today, USI  is proud to offer is customers the industry's most advance, secure, and innovative Disturbance Monitoring Equipment (DMEs) that exceeds every PRC-002-2 requirement.

Our DME Products include Digital Fault Recorders (DFR), Sequence of Events Recorders (SER), Dynamic Disturbance Recorders (DDR),  Continuous Trend Recording and Oscillography (CR), Fault Location (FL), Lightning Strike Correlation (LGT), Power Quality Meters (PQ), and Phasor Measurment Unit (PMU) all in one unit with distributive architectural capabilities. Each USI DME System have proven time and time against to being that is the most secure and customizable recording devices on the market to meet the end user's unique requirements, specifications, and compliance needs. 

USI's company's heritage spans over thirty years with a commitment to accuracy, reliability, and service. We pride ourselves in not only our state-of-the-art product line but also our world class customer service. 

USI primarily serves electric utilities, industrial companies, and government agencies but are more than willing to a meet with any company with an interest in our product line to see if USI might be able to provide them with a solution and meet their specific needs. If you have any questions about our product or would like to discuss a generation, transmission, distribution, industrial, or compliance solution or application you might think that USI could help you and your company achieve and meet a common goal, please feel free to contact us at any time. One of our highly trained representatives will be ready and able to provide you with personable and professional assistance.

Thank you for your interest in Utility Systems, Inc. We look forward to earning your business!

We offer low-risk solutions for high-risk energized tower maintenance.

We are experienced in preparing and applying a variety of suitable protective coating and paint systems, which are approved for painting power pylons and transmission towers.

We look after our staff and they look after each other. Our work practices and methodologies incorporate safety at every level. This applies in the office and on the road as much as it applies up a tower.

We’re qualified in Live Line Painting.

From distribution to transmission, grillage to sky-wire peak – we are fully trained and have the minimum man hours to meet your energized tower painting requirements.

Our tower painters have over 2,000 hours working in the energized zone. Some have over 10,000 hours. All staff have extensive training and are certified in tower rescue, painting at heights and high-risk work environments.

Name: MAD Energy
Description:
MAD Energy (MAD) is an energy infrastructure developer and operator building the cleanest and most practical energy solutions available today, while enabling energy technologies of the future. Our mission is to generate clean, abundant, and affordable energy for the world. Founded in February of 2020 by world-class energy experts, considerable investment has since been made into operational scale, project development, and asset deployment.

THESIS

Global capital is re-organizing to drive the transition to less pollutive energy systems. Meanwhile, market participants need more energy than ever with no end to demand growth in sight. Large scale, low cost, clean energy solutions are required to address the supply shortfalls of today, while next generation energy systems will be required to fuel the growth of tomorrow.

EXECUTION

MAD is building an energy ecosystem strategically designed to satisfy these emerging market needs:

Phase 1 - Capital is being deployed into large scale clean energy projects with low technical risk. These projects, international in scope and opportunity set, are utilizing technology and infrastructure that has minimal operational and functional risk due to decades of iteration and refinement. These large-scale capital deployments will be secured by long-term offtake contracts with world class credit.

Phase 2 - Commercialization of innovative clean energy technologies from internal research and development. These technologies stand to significantly alter dynamics related to environmental impact, pricing, and access throughout the global energy value chain.

Ready to join the movement? Go to https://madenergy.com and join us as we take you to the future!

Don't forget to subscribe to our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/MADevolutionV

Name: FiberLink, LLC

Name: Arizona 811
Description:
Arizona 811 (formerly Arizona Blue Stake, Inc.) was established in 1974, following passage of Arizona's Underground Utility Protection Act, so buried facilities can be located before any type of digging begins.  A nonprofit agency, our Mission is to perform excavation notification services and stakeholder education that promotes the safety and welfare of the community by protecting underground facilities from damage. Our services are free and available statewide.

We’re open Monday-Friday, 6 a.m. - 5 p.m., except state holidays.

To have utilities located before digging, call 811 or create a ticket online using EXACTIX: http://www.arizona811.com/exactix/

Other contact info:
Main Phone: (602) 659-7500
E-mail: Customer.Support@arizona811.com
To schedule an Arizona 811 presentation: Education.Awareness@Arizona811.com
For EXACTIX training or assistance: Support.Specialists@Arizona811.com
News media inquires: news@arizona811.com
Fax: (602) 659-7520
Web site: www.arizona811.com

Name: 4Change Energy
Description:
4Change Energy, headquartered in Texas, offers retail electricity in Texas at very competitive rates by having a simplified business model with primarily online services. Our mission is to be known for our low prices, enrollment without hassle, easy service you can trust and helping Texans in great need. We are set out to make a difference in the communities we serve by contributing 4% of annual profits to the local chapters of established non-profits that fight hunger, find a 'cure', provide disaster relief or help children who face serious illness. 

The charities that 4Change has  partnered with are:

Texas Food Bank Network - Fight Hunger
American Cancer Society - Find a Cure

Licensed by the Public Utility Commission of Texas (PUCT) - Certificate No. 10041.

Name: McAdams Energy Ventures Inc.
Description: Industry experts with more than 5 decades of combined experience working for one of the largest gas and electric utilities in the United States as well as one of the nation’s largest EPC electrical contractors.  Experience includes Leadership in Safety, Compliance, Work-Methods, Training, Transmission, Distribution, Sub-Station and complex civil projects.  Our team has a proven history of increasing efficiency, safety and advancing organizational effectiveness and value.

Name: Kansas Municipal Utilities (KMU)
Description:
Kansas Municipal Utilities (KMU) is the statewide association of municipally-owned and -operated electric, gas, water, wastewater, stormwater, and telecommunications utilities across the State of Kansas. As a non-profit association established by its member utilities in 1928, KMU is dedicated to serving the needs and interests of these publicly owned utilities.

Membership in KMU is open to any Kansas municipality that owns and operates its own utility system and is interested in working together with other municipal systems for the advancement and protection of their utilities and the citizens, businesses and industries that they serve. Other membership opportunities are also available for companies and organizations that support municipal utilities through their products and services. By working together, municipally-owned utilities can leverage their resources through KMU for the benefit of their communities and the owner-consumers that they serve.

Name: 3T Power
Description:
3T Power - Providing affordable, bespoke energy solutions to businesses across Northern Ireland.
The promoters have been active as developers in the wind and renewable energy sector since 2007.
With the ever changing landscape in the Irish energy markets and an increased demand for renewable supply contracts the timing is perfect for 3T Power to extend their bespoke energy offering to energy users in the form of a supply contract.
Awarded their supply licence in August 2017, 3T Power will provide a welcome alternative to the large utility offerings. 
A small, bespoke, renewable energy company who will offer value added and excellent one to one service.

Enrich LI Company: NJBPU SDDC Supplier Diversity Development Council
Name: NJBPU SDDC Supplier Diversity Development Council
Description:
The Supplier Diversity Development Council (SDDC) is dedicated to forging effective working relationships amongst minority, women and service disabled veteran owned businesses (M/W/SDVBEs) and New Jersey public utilities and the Board of Public Utilities (NJBPU) on matters relating to methods of reporting, measuring, and assessing the development of these relationships.

The SDDC serves as a resource to identify “best practices” and to promote related support activities and seminars for both companies and M/W/SDVBEs. In order to enhance the advancement of mutual goals, the SDDC promotes the adoption of “best practices” and processes that provide equal access for M/W/SDVBEs to companies. The SDDC’s commitment to its mission will enhance supplier diversity amongst New Jersey companies, resulting in the development of a strong economy and a productive environment for the growth of business throughout the state.

Name: Avon Lake Regional Water
Description: Avon Lake Regional Water provides direct water and wastewater services to the City of Avon Lake, Ohio and wholesale services to ~200,000 other residents in a seven-county area in Northeast Ohio. We are governed by an independently elected Board that has a strong business focus. Our mission is to provide the region with quality water services, and our vision is to be a trusted and treasured community asset that enhances the quality of life.

Name: UtilityEngineering, LLC
Description:
Launched in late 2020, UtilityEngineering, LLC, brings together a wealth of talent and experience in the electric utility industry. With decades of consulting and utility service, our team brings together real-world utility experience and industry-leading innovation to deliver consulting and management solutions to our clients. 

Specializing in municipal and cooperative utilities, UtilityEngineering offers our services in the following areas: Substation and Relaying Design, Procurement, and Construction Administration; System Planning; Technical Studies and Arc Flash Analyses; Grid Modernization; Regulatory and Utility Rate-Making; Transmission and Distribution Design, Procurement, and Construction Administration; Pole Attachment Audits and Agreements; Field Services (Work Order Inspections, Relay & Equipment Testing and Commissioning, Staking); Distributed Generation, Hydroelectric, Solar, and Wind Generation Impact Studies and Interconnection Design.

Name: IEEE PES/IAS Florida West Coast (FWCS)
Description:
The Florida West Coast Section’s joint chapter of the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE) Power & Energy Society (PES) and Industry Applications Society (IAS) hosts technical webinars/seminars and tours along Florida's West Coast, including the Tampa Bay area, to provide industry engineers with the resources needed to stay apprised of the advances and reforms within power and energy industry. 

Monthly IEEE PES/IAS FWCS Planning meetings are held on the last Thursday of each month at 6:30 AM. Meetings are virtual, with one in-person meeting per quarter. 

For more information on the monthly meetings and future events please visit our website listed below. 

Member participation is welcomed and encouraged!

Name: Markex Ltd

We are equipped with a full -fleet of construction equipment and vehicles ready to serve a wide range of installation projects and electrical needs.

Greenstone’s construction crews are trained in OSHA safety, given daily job hazard analysis briefings, as well as practical training in health and safety, excavation and trenching, CPR/first aid, blood borne pathogens, hazard communications, emergency action, traffic control, fall protection, crane and ladder safety, lock/tagout, personal protective equipment, and fire safety.  We are a Drug-Free Workplace, requiring pre-employment drug testing, post accident and random testing.

All of our crews possess years of on-the-job experience. Not only that, they’re also industry certified and committed to keeping up with the latest advances in the field.

Name: SplitEV
Description: At SplitEv, our mission is to disrupt the way we charge electric vehicles. We believe that shared mobility services will have a significant impact on major cities, allowing people to adopt more sustainable lifestyles. We’re taking this trend and pushing it even further at SplitEV, giving you access to electricity anytime you need it — so you can live a greener lifestyle by sharing energy with others.

Our mission is to deliver clean, safe, affordable, and reliable energy solutions to our customers every day through exceptional service and a strong commitment to our communities. Overall, Summit entities serve approximately 100,000 customers and operate more than 5,400 miles of pipeline in Arkansas, Colorado, Maine, Missouri and Oklahoma.  

Being part of the Summit team means embracing excellence, diversity and innovation, committing to safety each and every day, and doing all that we can to serve each other, our customers and the communities where we live.  We aim to bring warmth and energy to everything we do.

Our employees have detailed working knowledge of potable and recycled water systems, water and wastewater treatment plants, pipelines, pump stations, reservoirs and flow control facilities. Southwest Valve & Equipment’s knowledge base provides engineering firms and end users design support for their projects with the correct products for the application.
SVE understands the difference between the “correct” product for the application and a product that will “just work” for the application. A correct product incorporates longevity of service; takes into account the environment of installation, system continuity, minimizing MRO, and where applicable, modifications to standard product offerings to customize the operation for the required service.

Southwest Valve & Equipment uses published industry text, guidelines, standards, research and publications combined with our hands-on knowledge and experience of applications and installations. Our team offers the most up-to-date, sustainable custom manufacturing solutions. We only source materials from tried and trusted suppliers that meet our exacting standards of quality control.

Description:
Carina Technology is an information technology firm that provides Energy Intelligence (EI) Solutions primarily to the U.S. utility and energy industries.  Carina enables energy providers to manage operations more efficiently and create new revenue streams through real-time hardware and software 
applications such as interactive GIS, Energy Data Management, prepaid energy, remote meter reading, demand response, and power quality management.  

EI is centralized and designed to fully collect, store, and interpret energy data to provide interactive visibility for grid management.  To maximize interoperability, EI utilizes open standards, integration into multiple utility operating systems over a variety of communications infrastructures, and database-driven architecture.  Carina also specializes in building and integrating custom software interfaces to existing CIS, GIS, and OMS systems.  Learn more about Carina at www.carinatek.com .
Today, Carina Technology differentiates itself by providing its customers with energy management solutions that operate in real time. Demand response capabilities, analytics, monitoring, and measurement and verification services are available on demand to meet utility needs whenever they arise. Carina's modular hardware design allows utilities at all stages of technological development to benefit from rapidly changing communication technologies while staying inherently protected from becoming obsolete or incurring stranded costs. Carina's firmware and software ensure that utilities have real time two-way communication to adjust to changing grid conditions with Carina's professional support team helping at any level needed by the utilities. Carina, with its demand flexibility and CarinaPoint control software, can help utilities navigate through the new Future Grid. Carina is the first company to offer the Carina intelligence in a new Vaughn grid enabled water heater as well as retrofitting almost any water heater.

Daily, J. R. Henderson, O. E. Kinnaman, Ernest Rosener, W. F. Tormohlen, G. E. Trewet, N. C. Wagers and George T. White. The first official meeting of the Board of Directors was held on March 6, 1937 at the courthouse in Fort Morgan. Engineers needed 2 months to draw up the first plans and blueprints for the first 200 miles of line. On May 11, 1938 the first 175 miles of line was energized.

Name: DNP3 Technical Committee
Description:
It is the charter of the DNP3 Technical Committee to maintain the DNP3 protocol in a manner consistent with protecting the investment of the general membership in DNP3 technology while continuing to encourage innovation, growth, and inter-operability.
The Technical Committee shall manage changes within the DNP3 protocol by balancing the need for stability with the need for change. When change is necessary every attempt must be made to insure backward compatibility with existing certified equipment. When this is not possible, sufficient warning of non-backward-compatible changes shall be given. The Technical Committee shall always strive to guarantee inter-operability between certified DNP3 equipment. Inter-operability shall take precedence over backward compatibility when both goals are not achievable.

Name: California Sub-Meters
Description:
Privately owned and operated since our founding in 1991, we specialize in water sub-metering for multifamily communities.  CSM has been a leader in providing private water sub-metering systems and water management services for California’s homeowners for 30 years!
 
At CSM we have always felt strongly about water conservation and individual accountability, and our solution was simple: water sub-metering.  Sub-metering involves placing individual sub-meters behind the city’s master meter for your community.  Typically, multifamily communities have one master city water meter which services all residents.  Water and sewer costs are divided equally among the residents and included in the monthly homeowner’s dues.  This worked well when water and sewer rates where a fraction of the cost they are today, and when water shortages were not an issue.  
 
In today’s California environment, sub-metering is an effective solution to manage overuse of water and the rising costs associated with it.  Sub-metering allows for an equitable distribution of cost; individual homeowners are paying only for the water they use.  Most importantly, sub-metering promotes water conservation.  When residents are accountable for their own water usage, they will be more likely to conserve.  Overall property water usage will go down and help avoid potential fees for over usage.
 
California Sub-Meters provides the reading and billing services for your community. The CSM team works with the property manager and will provide each community with a billing specialist to be the point of contact for all of the homeowner’s questions and concerns.  We pride ourselves in service excellence!

Name: Vermont Public Utility Commission
Description:
The Public Utility Commission is an independent, three-member, quasi-judicial commission that regulates the siting of electric and natural gas infrastructure and supervises the rates, quality of service, and overall financial management of Vermont's public utilities: electric, gas, energy efficiency, telecommunications, cable television (terms of service only, not rates), water and large wastewater companies. 

OUR MISSION
The Commission's mission is to ensure the provision of high-quality public utility services in Vermont at minimum reasonable costs, consistent with the long-term public good of the state. The Commission strives to achieve its mission by providing independent, fair, and efficient means of resolving public utility disputes, and by guiding the development of state utility policies and rules for public services to best serve the long-term interests of Vermont and its residents.
