Name: Expense Reduction Advisors
Description:
Expense Reduction Advisors began in 2008 with the intent to educate and assist businesses of all sizes in reducing their utility and telecom costs by uncovering billing errors and overcharges that are often found in many utility bills.  Since our beginning ERA has grown to become a recognized leader in the industry.  Today our primary focus is Senior and Assisted Living Communities, Golf and Country Clubs, and Condominium Communities all across the US.  We attribute this to our attention to detail, industry knowledge, listening to our clients, and always doing what’s right for the customer.

HOW CAN ERA HELP YOUR BUSINESS?
Simply put we audit your utility bills, (electric, gas, water/sewer) on a contingency basis whereas if we do not find any errors that create savings we do not get paid!  ERA works nationally in both the regulated and deregulated markets with full knowledge of the tariffs, statutes etc.   Having been a former utility company employee we know what to look for, who to talk to in the industry language that the utility companies understand.  
In the deregulated energy markets we often see clients overpaying for their natural gas or electric.  In these cases we can offer energy procurement recommendations from most of the suppliers for that market by offering a vendor neutral position with the best option for you based upon your usage habits.  This is not something that we charge you for!  
Call 561-779-3177 or email banthes@expensereductionadvisors.com to see how we can help your business.
SPECIALTIES
Utility Bill Audits
Utility Bill Consulting
Utility Contracts
Electric Bill Audit
Gas Bill Audit
Water/Sewer Bill Audit
Energy Procurement
Electric Procurement
Natural Gas Procurement

Name: Community Electric Cooperative
Description:
Founded in 1938, Community Electric Cooperative was created through the efforts of the Holland Ruritan Club and other community leaders to provide electrical service in Southeastern Virginia’s rural areas.

In 1971, the Cooperative passed 1,000,000 man-hours without a lost-time accident. The record represented one of the best in the nation at the time.

By January of 1975, Community Electric Cooperative had installed some 5,875 meters and 1,111 miles of line.

James M. Reynolds was hired in 1977 by the Co-op board of directors to succeed Jean Woodward as manager. Reynolds served until his retirement in April 2013. Only the third CEO in its history, Steven A. Harmon took the helm in June 2013.

In 1979, Community Electric Cooperative executed a wholesale power contract with Old Dominion Electric Cooperative, a generation-and-transmission cooperative. Initially, Old Dominion negotiated rates on behalf of Community Electric Cooperative and its other member systems.

During the 1980s and 1990s, Old Dominion procured ownership of electric-generation facilities to support Community Electric Cooperative and the 11 other cooperatives which own Old Dominion. In 1983, Old Dominion acquired an 11.6 percent interest in the North Anna Nuclear Power Station. Old Dominion also owns a 50 percent interest in the Clover Power Station, which it built, and which went on-line in 1995. In addition to North Anna and Clover, Old Dominion has developed three peaking electric generation facilities to further support Community and the other 11 member cooperatives.

Over the last 15 years, the Co-op has recorded a growth rate of roughly 1.5 percent per year in the number of meters connected. The Cooperative currently serves more than 11,000 accounts over its 1,590 miles of distribution line.

Name: CES Utility Solutions
Description:
CES Utility Solutions (CES) is a national, coast-to-coast, certified MBE business enterprise that specializes in providing critical infrastructure support, drone aerial surveys, asset inspection, and project management (including PM, controls, analysts) consulting services to utilities and green energy developers.

CES Utility Solutions has been working for several years in coordination with the California wildfire prevention plans to inspect power line infrastructure. Over the years our services and drone inspection images have given clients unprecedentedly close views of critical equipment, allowing them to confidently assess systems and make any repairs expediently. We have helped utilities streamline and meet their public utility commission inspection requirements for detailed overhead inspections.

Name: Innovative Combustion Technologies, Inc.
Description:
Boiler, combustion specialists & engineers serving the power industry since 1993. Our specialized services include:

Boiler and burner tuning, performance optimization and improvement of boiler efficiencies and heat rate.

Achieving the lowest NOx, CO and particulate emissions (stack opacity).

Reducing furnace slagging and fouling.

All types of performance testing associated with boilers, air heaters, fans, pulverizers, ESP’s, bag houses and environmental testing.

Optimizing pulverizer performance, control, operation, capacity and maintenance.

Common operational challenges such as steam temperature control, boiler and pulverizer control, flame stability, unit turndown, airflow control problems, plugging burner lines, pulverizer fires/puffs, and other complications associated with the combustion system.

Identifying solutions to common maintenance challenges such as tube failures caused by fireside corrosion, tube exfoliation, and overheating and coal-ash corrosion.

Resolving unit de-rating whether it be caused by fan capacity, the pulverizer or
anything between the pulverizer and stack.

ICT can provide the expertise, training and specialized testing equipment to improve performance by achieving optimum combustion as well as achieving the lowest possible NOx emissions without slagging problems,
high fly ash LOI, high stack opacity and/or reduced unit capacity. Our reputation in the power generation industry has been built on our results.

Name: Grand Haven Board of Light & Power
Description:
www.ghblp.org - As a community-owned, not-for-profit electric utility, we know that our success depends on more than just providing power to our customers. Though this is part of what makes us successful, we know that aligning our strategies and priorities with our community’s values of reliability, affordability, and sustainability allows us to provide a more expansive view of success.
The Grand Haven Board of Light & Power is one of over 2,000 community-owned electric utilities serving homes and businesses across the United States. We are locally controlled by a five-member Board of Directors elected by Grand Haven residents with approximately 15,000 customers in the greater Grand Haven area.
The BLP has approximately 220 miles of electric distribution lines. We employ 40 dedicated people in a variety of skilled utility jobs - each committed to our mission and Core Values:
Our mission is to meet our community’s expectations for reliable electric service that returns value to our customers and ensures the economic and environmental sustainability of the utility.
Our Core Values are to:
• Work Cooperatively as a team
• Continuously improve our performance
• Serve with Integrity
• Provide value to the community
As we plan for the future of Grand Haven’s power supply with our collective values at the forefront, we look forward to continued improvements and excellence. At the same time, we create a more reliable, affordable, and sustainable future for our community.
GRAND HAVEN BOARD OF LIGHT & POWER
Reliable – Affordable – Sustainable since 1896.

Name: Baywork
Description:
In May of 2008, the San Francisco Public Utilities Commission and the Santa Clara Valley Water District co-sponsored a West Coast Water Utilities Workshop on Workforce Development.  Findings from this workshop contributed to a subsequent Water Research Foundation Project on potential benefits of regional collaboration; findings of this project showed that the workforce reliability challenges of Bay Area water and wastewater utilities called for a regional response.

The workforce development task force which contained representatives from the San Francisco Public Utilities Commission, the Santa Clara Valley Water District, East Bay Municipal Utility District, and Union Sanitary District, discovered that the workforce reliability challenges of Bay area water and wastewater utilities called for a regional response.

Therefore BAYWORK was created in June 2009. BAYWORK is open to all Bay Area water and wastewater utilities, and many have contributed to its research, workshops, and product development activities.  For example, 45 water and wastewater utilities contributed to research jointly conducted with the California community college system in 2009 on present and future labor needs in mission-critical job categories.

FOLLOW & LIKE us on ALL the Socials: https://linktr.ee/BAYWORK

Name: SediVision
Description:
SediVision is a predictive maintenance solution that provides complete visibility in full wastewater tanks to determine if they require cleaning or maintenance.
With SediVision, you’ll know precisely how much and where debris material such as sand and grit has accumulated in your tanks, enabling you to make informed decisions about restoring capacity, operations at your treatment facility, and where to direct wastewater tank cleaning resources.
WITH SEDIVISION, YOU CAN:
* Reduce uncertainty in the quantity of sand and grit debris without draining down your wastewater tank.
* Plan capital expense and maintenance activity better.
* Evaluate operational and wastewater treatment efficiencies at your plant or reclamation facility such as aerators, mixers, diffusers, and grit collection systems.

THE SEDIVISION PURPOSE
SediVision, LLC is a professional service that provides complete visibility of sand and grit debris in full wastewater tanks.
Because it's impossible to see below dark water, the condition of wastewater tanks may not be obvious until there is a problem.
SediVision provides wastewater managers, utilities, contractors, and engineers with complete visibility in wastewater tanks with no need to drain down or go off-line.
Data collected over time with SediVision can lead to a predictive maintenance schedule for wastewater tanks and help facilities make informed operational, maintenance, and budgetary decisions.
SediVision leads to better knowledge, a better investment, and a longer-lasting wastewater infrastructure.

nexGEN, LLC is both field service driven and project management based; focused on generators operated by industrial companies, independent power producers, cogeneration plants, and other power producers. nexGEN is committed to providing safety conscious, quality driven, highly responsive generator maintenance services. 

nexGEN offers expert generator service inspections, repairs, and operational/maintenance support throughout the US, Caribbean, and the Americas. A full range of generator operational and outage services are provided including:

Though SMMPA member utilities are located throughout the state, most are in southern Minnesota. SMMPA members serve over 96,000 residential customers and over 12,300 commercial and industrial customers.

The Agency's main source of electricity is its 41% share of the 884 MW Sherco 3 coal-fired generator near Becker, MN. The Agency's energy resource mix also includes various renewable energy sources such as wind, biodiesel and waste-to-energy, and an array of intermediate and peaking units owned by our Member utilities.

OUR MISSION: Help organizations of all sizes train and prepare the world’s finest system operators to ensure the reliability of the bulk power system. IncSys prides itself on delivering innovative solutions to meet the most challenging power system operator needs. 

POWERSIMULATOR 
Based on the joint effort of IncSys and PowerData Corporations.  Simulation used to be a luxury, but now it is a requirement. POWER4VETS

INCSYS ACADEMY- NERC CONTINUED EDUCATION TRAINING
IncSys Academy offers our newest set of online courses for professionals and trainees in the generation and transmission fields. We’ve created the highest quality operator training available, taking our “system of systems” approach to understanding the bulk electric system and relating the core concepts in a logical, practical way. Our online lectures are supported by realistic simulation exercises built in the industry-leading PowerSimulator, jointly developed by IncSys and PowerData, allowing students to directly experience the phenomena taught in the course while they earn simulation CEHs. 
http://www.incsys.com/academy/

SMART GRID MANAGEMENT OPERATOR DECISION TOOLS
The flexibility of the IncSys and PowerData software allows for incremental add-ons to meet real-time operational needs and prepare operators for the future of Smart Grid energy management.

Since the Authority is not a taxing entity, funding for our future water supply and the infrastructure through which to deliver it is being accomplished through the sale of revenue bonds, and paid for by groundwater pumpage fees.

Our team of experts focuses on tailoring solutions in power systems network, analysis, substation primary and secondary engineering, and protection settings calculations and integration. As a part of EPESOL group of companies, our expertise extends to testing and commissioning services for protection & control panels, automation systems, and marine and mechanical systems. With a commitment to excellence, we deliver cutting-edge services that empower your projects to thrive. Discover a range of solutions that redefine industry standards.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Covarrubia Energy (CE)
Description: Covarrubia Energy (CE) is a utility renewable energy developer focusing on pyrolysis to power. Utilizing our core technology of pyrolysis to generate sustainable renewable energy from blended Hydrogen & RNG.

Name: Empower Construction, LLC
Description: At Empower Construction, safety is not just a word, a goal, or a mindful practice – it is a way of life. The safety and wellbeing of our employees is priority number one. Our most valuable asset is our people and we are committed to ensuring that everyone goes home safely. We implement the industry’s safest work practices and regulatory requirements in accordance with OSHA Safety and Health Standards.

Name: Electrical Distribution Design
Description:
Electrical Distribution Design has provided distribution management solutions to electric utilities around the world for over 20 years. DEW/ISM creates a paradigm shift in the industry by allowing customers to use a single model for multiple functions, from planning to operations to control. 

EDD has helped utilities, universities, and municipalities take control of their distribution system with our software and engineering services like DER interconnection studies, conservation voltage reduction, and model maintenance.

Name: Western Turbine Users, Inc.
Description: Organization of Users of LM Series of GE engines that meet annually to learn and find solutions to problems. Vendors are also invited in the exhibit hall and there are about 150+ vendors that participate. For further information please contact info@wtui.com or check out our website at www.wtui.com.

Name: Eau Claire Energy Cooperative
Description: Eau Claire Energy Cooperative (ECEC) provides reliable and affordable electricity and related energy services to residential, business, and farm members in Eau Claire County. We also serve portions of Chippewa, Dunn, Pepin, Buffalo, Trempealeau and Jackson Counties. As a Touchstone Energy Cooperative, we are proud of the personal service we offer to over 10,500 awesome cooperative members.

Name: Triad Mechanical Company, Inc.
Description:
While many heating and air companies have come and gone, we have maintained an impeccable reputation, which we have accomplished through hard work and unparalleled customer service. We pride ourselves on punctuality, courtesy to our customers and their families, and a rock solid guarantee on all the work we perform. We offer heating and air conditioning services in Lawrenceville and beyond — from Dacula to Snellville!

We Are Family Owned and Operated
Triad Mechanical Company was founded in 1991 and has worked its way from small beginnings into your trusted heating and air conditioning company–known and respected in the Greater Atlanta area.

Superior Safety Guarantee
Anyone from our company who enters your home has passed a thorough background check, drug test, and has the highest level of training available. We strive to offer the absolute best ac repair in Lawrenceville, GA. We also have a random drug screening program in place to ensure that we continue to meet your standards.

New Equipment Warranty
Depending on the type of equipment that is purchased, your new heating and air system will come with either a 5 year parts warranty, a 10 year parts warranty, or a lifetime unit replacement warranty. On all new systems, we offer a 1 year labor warranty, but other guarantees are available for TRIAD VALUE CARE CLUB members.

5 Year Repair Guarantee
We are happy to guarantee that as a TRIAD VALUE CARE CLUB member, any repair we make to your existing system is guaranteed for five years. If for any reason, a part fails within five years from the repair date, we will make the necessary repair to that component at no charge to you, as long as you are a TRIAD VALUE CARE CLUB member for the lifetime of that unit.

Name: Missouri Electric Cooperatives
Description: Missouri Electric Cooperatives is a statewide association established to protect, support and serve the interests and business practices of our 47 member electric co-ops and to help ensure the 2 million co-op members in rural Missouri receive reliable and affordable electricity.

Name: Kosciusko REMC
Description: Kosciusko REMC is dedicated to safely providing quality electric energy and services to customers at a competitive cost. We value integrity, accountability, innovation and commitment to community above all else.

Name: WM Electrical Testing Group
Description: We offer Advanced Protection and Control Solutions for Electrical Utilities and Generation Plants. We win by helping clients solve complex, technical problems.

Name: Littleton Electric Light & Water Department
Description: As your local, public utilities, the Littleton Electric Light and Water Departments have been providing reliable power to the towns of Littleton and Boxborough, Massachusetts, and clean drinking water to the town of Littleton, Massachusetts for nearly a century. Beyond our core missions, we are committed to supporting projects and programs that improve our collective quality of life and enrich the communities we serve.

Name: Vermont Public Power Supply Authority
Description:
VPPSA provides wholesale power supply to municipals and cooperatives in and outside of Vermont, as well as a host of other services such as rate studies, central computer services, load forecasting, and tax free financing of certain capital projects.  


Vision: To promote and celebrate Public Power in Vermont and beyond.

Mission: VPPSA's mission is to provide exceptional essential services to its member utilities.

Name: LCWSC
Description: LCWSC is a Special Purpose District that provides water and sewer service to most unincorporated areas of Laurens County and portions of southern Greenville County. A Special Purpose District is a form of government that is governed by a board of elected or appointed officials, and provides service in areas that cannot be provided for by any other agency.

Name: GroundHawk
Description: The GroundHawk staff a utility location firm with offices in Athens, Georgia and Atlanta, Georgia known for delivering accurate analysis and inventory of everything that’s underground so that you can design and build with confidence across the Southeast. Our approach to utility location blends state-of the art technology with more than 20 years of experience which allows us to provide community-minded solutions that deliver our clients with actionable and insightful information because we know what’s underground is essential to life above ground.

Name: Michigan Public Power Agency
Description:
Municipally-owned utilities work collectively through the Michigan Public Power Agency, a not-for-profit joint action agency, to share energy supply and related services. We lower costs for our Members, reduce their risks, and enable them to leverage the expertise of our staff. 

MPPA presently consists of twenty-two Michigan municipality members and six associate members.

Name: MeterNet
Description:
MeterNet is a growing company providing utility sub-metering installations, service and billing for multi-family communities such as HOAs, condos and apartments. We are a leader in the industry with relationships with prominent developers, community managers and service providers. Our experience billing tens of thousands of residents and servicing a variety of metering systems makes us a trusted partner for residential communities of all sizes. 

We are experiencing consistent growth and are looking for talented, dynamic teammates to join us in delivering the highest quality service to our clients. We are backed by a seasoned group of investors who are committed to building our team and supporting our continued growth and expansion.

Name: Utility Management and Construction
Description:
Our Mission:

We are servant leaders and technicians who believe that water is life! 

Our mission is to provide the highest quality drinking water available to the communities we serve while protecting the natural resources and environment in which we operate.


Who We Are:

Utility Management and Construction (UMCCo) was founded in 1962 as the Lucas Construction Company. In 1982, Lucas Construction changed its name to Utility Management and Construction. From that time, UMCCo has increased operations from the original three contracts that provided water-systems management for 1200 customers to nine contracts serving over 5000.

At UMCCo, we’re experts in our field!  We are engineers, accountants, billing clerks, and field technicians that genuinely care about communities we serve.  This is because, like you, we live in these same communities. Your drinking water is also our drinking water.  In fact, the average age of our contracts are over 24 years old.  Our longevity is proof of our quality and commitment to you.


What We Do:

Utility Management & Construction Company (UMCCo) specializes in the management and operations of small utility systems (Rural Waters Systems or Public Trusts or Authority). 

UMCCo is a turnkey provider of services including record keeping, reporting, budgeting, customer correspondence, billing, engineering, system improvements and all field services including 24-hour emergency response. 

UMCCo provides operations, maintenance, and management services tailored to our customers’ specific needs.

UMCCo has fifteen (15) full time employees. All field personnel hold Class "D" or higher water and sewer licenses. 

UMCCo has expertise in water system management including DEQ requirements and regulations, water treatment, utility engineering, utility accounting, and gas distribution including OCC and DOT requirements.

UMCCo is a full-service utility contractor providing engineering, construction, and supervision for every size project.

Name: DIG-IT, INC. (Underground Utilities/Transmission & Substation Foundations)
Description:
DIG-IT, INC. provides directional drilling (boring) and caisson drilling services for a variety of utilities and telecommunication. 

DIG-IT, INC.  partners with businesses, municipalities, utility and energy companies on projects throughout the Midwest.

Name: LITTLE THOMPSON WATER DISTRICT
Description: The Little Thompson Water District is a quasi-municipal corporation and a political subdivision of the State of Colorado. The District was created pursuant to state law for the purpose of providing water facilities and services for the inhabitants of the District.

Name: Clean Energy Alliance
Description: Clean Energy Alliance is serving Carlsbad, Del Mar, Solana Beach, San Marcos, Escondido, Oceanside and Vista.

Name: Oasis Energy
Description:
Oasis Energy is a leading energy supplier, providing electricity and natural gas to residential and business customers in most major markets in New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Massachusetts and Illinois.

Oasis Energy offers a variety of energy products not available directly through your local utility, such as long-term fixed price contracts (up to three years of price protection), as well as 100% renewable electricity and 100% carbon offset natural gas plans.

Since our start in 2008, hundreds of thousands of consumers have chosen Oasis Energy as their energy supplier. We attribute our continued growth to our focus on giving consumers exactly what they really want: low prices, stable fixed rates, reliable service, affordable green energy options, and the ability to pick up the phone and immediately speak with a live person without holding.

Give us a call at 800-324-3046.

Name: J.I. Landis Welding & Mechanical, Inc.
Description: Industrial Construction company specializing in Industrial Refrigeration, All Types of Piping, Misc. Metals, Food processing, etc.

Name: Compare Power
Description:
Choosing the wrong electricity plan is costly and frustrating. We help every Texan win the game of electricity choice.

Since 2009, ComparePower has been on one simple mission:  We help our fellow Texans achieve victory in their energy plan choice. 

With over 70,000 verified-customer reviews and more than 5 million users, ComparePower is the most highly-rated destination for consumers and businesses to shop, compare, and order their best energy plan - all in one place.

Every Texan deserves to win when choosing their electricity plan, and whether it’s online or by phone, we are here for you to make that happen.

Name: Hahn Equipment Co., Inc.
Description:
Hahn Equipment is a leading supplier of pumps, controls and mixers in construction, municipal, industrial and offshore applications throughout Houston, Beaumont, Port Arthur and the entire Southeast Texas region.  Applications include stormwater pump stations, industrial and municipal wastewater pumps, grinder pumps, booster pumps, mud mixers, dewatering pumps and SCADA control systems. 

Hahn Equipment has been serving the greater Southeast Texas area for over 45 years with 24 hour sales, service and rentals.  Our combined staff has over 200 years of expertise in solving and assisting with your pump, mixer and control needs.  

Our mission is to exceed the expectations of our customers and earn their confidence and trust through the integration of people, technology, products and end-user support.

Name: SM Engineering Co.
Description:
SM Engineering helps companies save thousands of dollars by facilitating refunds and obtaining lower rates on their electric, gas and water bills.

Here is what you need to know:

$150,000,000: Total savings we have obtained for our clients.
20,000: Number of clients we have helped.
$0: Amount we charge our clients to review their bills.
50: Number of states in which we have done business.
30+: Number of years we have been in business. 

Here's some companies we've helped save on their utilities. 

Minnesota:

Vallasis:  Saved $14,000+ per year.

Wisconsin:

Kaytee Products:  Saved $8,500+ per year.

Missouri:

Winco Mfg:  Saved $4,730+ per year.

Connecticut:

Microbest:  Saved $14,925+ per year.



Specialties:
Refunds on utility bills (Electric, gas, water).
Identifying and setting optimal utility rates going forward.
Ongoing monitoring services.

Industries:
Manufacturing facilities.
Multi-family housing.
Condo buildings.
Nursing homes.
Grocery Stores.
Printing companies.
Health care centers.
Hotels.

Name: Optimal Energy
Description:
Optimal Energy is now NV5! 

Optimal Energy, Inc. is an energy consultancy concentrating on energy‐efficiency and renewable energy as integrated resources for utilities, state agencies and other energy efficiency program administrators. We specialize in assessing, developing, planning, startup, and management support for energy‐efficiency programs. Founded in 1996, our clientele includes utilities, consumer and environmental advocates, government and regulatory agencies, and energy service providers.

Name: MyPower Corp.
Description:
MyPower Corp. is an 100% affiliate of Japan's conglomerate, Mitsui & Co., Ltd. 
At MyPower, we pursue a unique, multifaceted, and flexible approach to develop and deliver industrial solutions for global climate change, bringing together the knowledge, business foundations, and customer and partner base of Mitsui & Co.’s diverse business fields

Name: GoodCharlie
Description:
We are a purpose-driven brand that is committed to making Texas the best place for a dog to live by supporting local no-kill shelters, rescue groups, and helping our customers care for their dogs.

We are committed to using our energy to advance the well-being of dogs in Texas. We match 100% of all donations through our Puppy Round-Up program to support the heroic efforts of local no-kill shelters and rescue groups and offer our pack members innovative products that help them care for their dogs.

Name: Missouri Public Utility Alliance
Description:
MPUA brings together more than 120 hometown utilities for the collective good. We support community-owned, locally controlled electric, water, wastewater, natural gas, and broadband utilities in Missouri and beyond. MPUA provides utilities with energy supply, training, advocacy, and technical support. We’re proud to collaborate with communities to achieve our mission of strengthening hometown utilities and improving the local quality of life.

VISION: Improving local quality of life through hometown utilities.

MISSION: Delivering industry-leading solutions, robust advocacy, and collaboration to advance local excellence, local control, and local benefit.

Name: GIS Landmark
Description: GIS Landmark,LLC specializes in Automated Mapping / Facilities Management Systems (AM/FM) and Geographic Information Systems (GIS) for utility mapping projects worldwide. We offer AM/FM/GIS services to various utility companies covering the areas of gas distribution/transmission, electric distribution/transmission, telecommunications, cable and water/sewer. Our highly trained professionals have the knowledge to blend the technologies of digital mapping from variety of sources including satellite images, aerial photographs, GPS field data and existing maps leading to the GIS database creation. Today, most utilities that haven't considered AM/FM/GIS in the past are now doing so because of the threat of competition and being able to respond to public, regulatory, and legislative inquiries that are geographic in nature. A GIS utility mapping system can arm utilities with the tools to compete efficiently, identifying where revenue is coming from compared to where facilities are located. GIS Landmark can implement data conversion, spatial data processing, GIS database creation, analysis and modeling for your utility mapping project. Please allow GIS Landmark an opportunity to speak with you about your GIS project.

Name: Evergreen Solar Solutions
Description: Evergreen is an Master dealer for SunPower providing solar energy solutions that educate, inform and inspire.  The company has also developed additional strategic partnerships to provide residential solar services designed to make the transition from traditional power sources to clean energy easy and seamless.

Name: Public Lighting Authority of Detroit
Description: The Public Lighting Authority of Detroit (PLA) is an authority created by the State of Michigan that has replaced over 65,000 streetlights in the City of Detroit with brighter, reliable, energy-efficient lights.  PLA’s mission is to actively maintain, improve, and modernize the street lighting system in Detroit. PLA is a completely separate legal entity from the City of Detroit.

Name: RouteMe Wayfinding
Description:
RouteMe provides an indoor navigation solution powered by AI and video technology, helping users easily navigate spaces like airports, hospitals, retail stores, and entertainment venues. With a focus on accessibility and multilingual support, the platform works without requiring downloads for a seamless experience. 

RouteMe’s API also enables pre-arrival navigation, allowing users to preview their routes ahead of time for added convenience and reduced stress.

Name: D & H Water Systems, Inc.
Description: D&H Water Systems, Inc. is a manufacturers representative firm located in Oceanside, Ca covering the municipal water and waste water markets in southern California and southern Nevada.  The primary focus of DHWS is chemical feed and disinfection with a secondary focus on dewatering.  The vision of DHWS is to provide a customer oriented technically advanced resource to the municipal market with an emphasis on end users, consulting engineers, and contractors.  We will present new technologies and product advancements to the end users and engineers through presentation and demonstrations.  Customer service is second to none in our territory.  Without customers and the relationships that they bring DHWS will not prosper to its potential.  It is our intention to represent manufacturers that stand behind this same philosophy.

Name: STAR Energy Services LLC
Description: STAR Energy Services is a technology-driven consulting company, providing professional services to electrical utilities. We perform electrical engineering studies and assist all aspects of engineering, operations and maintenance of the distribution system.

Name: nFront Consulting LLC
Description: nFront Consulting is an electric power industry consulting firm. We are a dedicated, diverse team of industry experts that thrives by combining our analytical and conceptual strengths and varied backgrounds. We work together to provide in-depth analysis and insightful solutions for consideration by our clients.

Name: Star Energy Partners
Description:
Star Energy Partners is a premier provider of renewable energy and energy-related products and services. We partner with green energy suppliers and your electricity company to help connect you—also our partner—with savings opportunities and an easy way to do something good for the planet. Our mission is to make the process simple and straightforward, empowering you to find the right form of alternative energy at the right electricity rates to meet your needs. We work with industry-leading providers to provide you with reliable, clean energy at fixed rates, giving you financial stability and an easy way to support a better Earth. By partnering with us, you’ll help support the development and expansion of wind energy, hydro energy, biomass energy, and more. 

Currently, we are able to support the green energy needs of residents in Chicago, Aurora, Naperville, and the surrounding areas in Illinois; Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Allentown, and the surrounding areas in Pennsylvania; Columbus, Cleveland, Cincinnati, Toledo, and the surrounding areas in Ohio; and Newark, Jersey City, and the surrounding areas in New Jersey. We look forward to expanding our partnerships and being able to serve more customers throughout the region in the future.

Name: Ultrapro Pest Protection
Description: Technologically advanced pest control programs, coupled with highly trained service professionals who focus on preventive measures that safeguard your home and business through IPM integrated pest management techniques.

Name: NORFIELD
Description: Norfield is a US based software and technology provider that has delivered innovative solutions for the damage prevention industry for more than 40 years. Our deep industry experience, thorough understanding of market dynamics, and commitment to technological advancement continues to keep Norfield at the forefront of the industry. Our customers range from Infrastructure, Government, Construction, Excavation, Utility and One Call Centers. They span across the country and are among the most respected state notification centers within the US. Norfield software processes tens of million excavation notification requests annually. Most importantly, Norfield has the longest industry track record of keeping people safe.

Name: Colorado Rural Water Association
Description: Colorado Rural Water Association’s mission is to provide professional training, technical assistance and political representation to rural and small communities as they endeavour to maintain industry standards, meet regulatory deadlines and attain multi-level certifications of their water and wastewater systems operators.

Name: PX3 Transformer Cooling Fans
Description:
PX3 PowerFlo Transformer Cooling Fans 
PX3 fans are developed and manufactured by Paradoxe Corporation. Their sustainable axial fans with high efficiency and a broad range of benefits are extremely suitable to fit all applications in transformer and industrial markets. 
Questions or comments? Contact us px3sales@pxecorp.com

Name: Elect Energy, Inc.
Description:
We're your advocates. We go to bat for you. We negotiate with providers to straighten out anything in your energy bill that doesn't make sense or doesn't belong there. In addition, we'll come back to check in - not just to renew your contract, but to also evaluate your energy bills to see how our solutions are helping to better manage your energy costs and improve your bottom line.
We're committed to reducing energy costs to improve your profitability. Our solutions are based on combinations of lowest available wholesale rates, energy use management, leveraging our supplier relationships, and consistently managing your energy account.
Our energy account managers supported by our management team, work with you to develop the smartest options for your energy procurement needs.
You need to make the best energy choices for your business. That's why you need to meet with Elect Energy.

Name: ECCV - East Cherry Creek Valley Water & Sanitation District
Description: ECCV provides water and sanitary sewer services to approximately 50,000 customers in the eastern portions of the City of Centennial and unincorporated Arapahoe County. ECCV is a Colorado Special District governed by Colorado Revised Statute Title 32. As such, the Board of Directors is elected by the registered voters of the District.

Name: Saks Metering
Description: Saks Metering is a leading, full-service, highly experienced and technology-driven water meter services company, based in Queens, NY.

Name: FLUID WASTE SERVICES, INC.
Description:
Fluid Waste Services Inc. began operations in response to the increasing demands and pressures upon the Utility Maintenance Industry of the late 1980’s.  

The opportunity to provide an elevated level of professionalism and high quality service is continually augmented with evolving technology, education, and equipment.

Fluid Waste Services has built a strong and dedicated team with tremendous experience, depth, energy and enthusiasm for success.  

Equipment selected by our crew must meet the highest standards of performance, productivity and reliability.  We work tirelessly with vendors and suppliers to have machines that continually raise the bar. The current fleet of Jet/Vac, Vacuum Trucks, and Video Inspection Equipment is unmatched within our service area.   

Safety has never enjoyed a greater role within the industry.  Owners, Operators, and successful service firms will not sacrifice safety for price.  The tremendous advances in safety equipment, awareness, tools and education are at the very core for continued growth.

There is certainly no glory or glamour associated with our chosen industry.  However to have earned and maintained a solid reputation worthy of both client and competitor referrals is extremely rewarding.

Name: Tarrar Utility Consultants
Description:
Tarrar Utility Consultants, Inc., the one company providing turn-key solutions for all your dry utility needs.  We specialize in residential, commercial, and municipal projects which includes Joint Trench Composite Plans, PG&E electric and gas distribution design, Site Lighting, Street Lighting, Landscape Lighting, Fibber Optic design, Traffic Signal Interconnect Conduit design, and PG&E Rule 20 (Overhead to Underground Conversion) design. 

We provide underground utility surveying and mapping, so our clients can save time, reduce cost, and reduce risk during new construction, building renovation or environmental remediation. 

Furthermore, we have an in-house construction firm that closely coordinates projects and designs with our engineers. 

We also coordinate with PG&E and AT&T representatives to examine working drawings and project development, financial analysis, allowances, credits, and refunds for PG&E and AT&T. 

Our staff is comprised of utility design, engineering and management professionals with remarkable experience working for utility companies and private design consulting firms.

Name: Aqua-Metric
Description: We provide smart metering technologies and conservation solutions for automatic meter reading, (AMR), advanced metering infrastructure (AMI), smart grid applications, distribution automation, and communication that enable electric, gas, and water utilities to measure, manage, and control distributed resources. Utilities and consumers know that the smartest solutions start with Sensus. Measure the success of your next project with smart metering from Sensus.

Name: PLM
Description:
PLM is a highly specialized electric power engineering consulting and design firm. PLM is located in Hopkinton MA as it has been since it was founded in 1983. The engineering staff is heavily weighted with experienced, senior level personnel that have diverse utility engineering, operating and consulting backgrounds. PLM has built a solid industry reputation, having completed over 700 design projects and consulting assignments.

PLM has serviced over 200 clients including a majority of the public power systems in New England and New York, as well as power supply agencies, large urban and national rail systems, investor owned utilities, independent power producers and several prestigious colleges and universities. PLM maintains an ongoing business relationship with many of these clients, attesting to both the quality of our work product and the ability of the staff to fully meet client expectations.

Name: FirstPower Group LLC
Description:
FIRSTPOWER GROUP LLC is a manufacturer and research & development company specializing in innovation, products and best practices for the Electric Power sector.  FIRSTPOWER GROUP LLC is also a utility Contractor with field specialties including SF6 Gas Management & Handling, Installation, Testing,  Maintenance, and Replacement of Substation-class High Voltage Transformers, Medium-High Voltage Circuit Breakers, Air Compressors and Pumps.

Featured FIRSTPOWER Products for Electric Power include the Stinger and Hornet Hot Stick Mounted Switch Lubricator.

FIRSTPOWER GROUP LLC began life as J.W. Harley, Inc. in 1979. In the late 90’s J.W. Harley, Inc. was acquired by GE Energy Services and operated as the GE-Harley Service Center. Jack Harley purchased the Circuit Breaker and Compressor Maintenance segments of the business in 2007 and branded the new company as FIRSTPOWER GROUP LLC. Continuing the original Harley vision, FIRSTPOWER continues to supply high quality parts & services and finds ways to use 40+ Years of hands-on Experience to innovate economic solutions to the challenges of Asset Management, Equipment Maintenance & Operation for the Electric Power Industry.

Name: PNODE Inc.
Description:
PNODE Inc. is an electrical engineering firm providing engineering, design and consulting services to Utilities, Industrial, Renewable Energy and EPC customers. We specialize in Substation Design and Engineering. 

PNODE Inc. is a minority owned and NMSDC Certified small business based in the Greater Atlanta area. We are dedicated to delivering safe, effective, and efficient engineering and design services with integrity and accountability using both proven and innovative methods.

Name: OnDemand Energy Solutions
Description:
•Manage electricity requirements for more than 5000 clients. We offer energy service solutions for our customers including energy procurement, energy performance contracting, energy rate analysis, energy management, energy monitoring, energy bill auditing, energy efficient lighting, HVAC demand management, power factor correction systems and O&M services.

•Over 2 Billion kWh’s of electricity purchased. OnDemand has managed billions of kwhs of electricity transactions and multiple BCF’s of natural gas transactions. We have saved our clients millions of dollars in electricity expenses since deregulation started.

•Licensed by the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission to provide electricity and natural gas procurement services. Since 1999 we have been licensed by the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission as an EGS consultant/broker of electricity and natural gas serving our customers throughout Pennsylvania.

•Independent and objective. We are an independent, employee owned company and we have no affiliation with any electric utilities or suppliers. As a consultant, we do not supply, or resale, electricity. 

Our energy professionals simply help our customers determine the best electricity supply option that meets their needs at the lowest possible costs. We work with all of the major electricity providers that serve the Mid-Atlantic region to evaluate all of the supply options and products in order to determine the best supply options for our customers.

Name: Rogers Hydrant Service, Inc.
Description: Rogers Hydrant Service, Inc. / Rogers Utility Solutions

Name: Marquette Energy Analytics
Description:
Marquette Energy Analytics turns data into decisions.

We are the nation's premier energy demand forecasting service, providing demand forecasts for natural gas and electric distribution utilities.

Name: 3Q, Inc.
Description: 3Q, Inc. has built a reputation of integrity and quality in the global fastener and assembly of fastener products. Our approach to premier customer service and ingenuity to problem solving has made us a preferred partner with our customers. Our ability to provide cost effective solutions to demanding applications and supply chain issues makes 3Q, Inc. a leader in the industry.
Primary Industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution

Name: Energy Reps, Inc.
Description:
Energy Reps has a rich history dating back to 1980 when it was formed as GHMR in the New Orleans, LA area by two enterprising agents. In 2000, the company became employee-owned, expanded its reach to cover eleven southern states, and adopted the name “Energy Reps” in Texas and Oklahoma.

Over the years, Energy Reps continued to grow and expand its territories. In 2009, it added Colorado, Wyoming, and New Mexico to its footprint, while GHMR expanded to include the Carolinas in the east.

In 2013, the managing partners, Keith Middlebrook and Tom Wichers, purchased the ESOP and continued to operate under the GHMR name in the southeast and the Energy Reps name in the west.

Today, Energy Reps operates throughout the entire 16-state territory under the leadership of Tom Wichers.

At Energy Reps, we have a proven business philosophy that emphasizes quality personnel, infrastructure investment, communication sensitivity, and a strong work ethic. We’re proud of our success, which has allowed us to aggressively grow our business and differentiate ourselves in the marketplace.

To better serve our customers, we’ve made significant investments in infrastructure, enabling us to effectively support a sales force that covers all utility end users, specifiers, and suppliers in our geographic region. Our management team is structured in a way that reduces the burden of sales management typically placed on manufacturers, giving them more time to focus on developing products and serving their customers.

We maintain regular contact with all utility disciplines, including transmission, substation, distribution, metering, generation, telecom, and marketing. We’ve added personnel and systems and strategically relocated our team members to better serve the evolving marketplace. Our philosophy and infrastructure enable us to bring manufacturers closer to the pulse of the customer.

Name: PERENfra
Description: PERENfra is a US-based, water infrastructure investor - owner - operator.

Name: ESG Clean Energy
Description: ESG Clean Energy, LLC (ESG) develops zero-carbon footprints and clean energy solutions for businesses and electric power providers using natural gas, LNG, or biogas. The ESG power generation system utilizes patented and conventional technology to capture nearly all the carbon dioxide and distilled water in the process and, as a result, produce valuable carbon-based commodities. For more information, visit www.ESGcleanEnergy.com.

Name: Alpha Engineering, Inc
Description: From system planning to line and substation design to the Smart Grid, Alpha Engineering has the capabilities and expertise to meet your every power engineering need. With a focus on customer service and satisfaction, we’re ready to tackle your challenges and navigate tough terrains to provide you with the most innovative, versatile and practical solutions that meet your needs.

Name: Greenlight Energy
Description:
Greenlight Energy is a family-owned Energy Supply Company established in 2009, providing fixed rates on renewable electricity supply, natural gas, LED lighting, and solar options to homes and businesses in New York, New Jersey, Maryland and Pennsylvania.  

Every day we are refining and expanding our products, services, and locations in order to more effectively provide for our customers.

Name: Generator Services Co., Inc.
Description:
Generator Services Co. has been servicing customers and their power solution needs through Sales, Service, and Rentals. With our vast customer network across all of Southern California, we are proud to have become the area’s most reliable full-service generator distributor and service center. Generator Services Co. is also Southern California’s leader in Bi-fuel and Natural gas sales, service, and rentals. 

Generator Services Co. prides itself to be YOUR FULL SERVICE NETWORK! 

When an emergency strikes, Generator Services Co. is there for you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. We accommodate customers by manufacturing custom generators, providing excellent service, & offering rental packages. Whether it’s a natural gas, bi-fuel, or diesel generator that is needed, we do our best to get our customers the most efficient generator to meet their needs…that is our PROMISE and our COMMITMENT to our customers.

Name: Quick Charg
Description:
Quick Charg is your mobile charging solution for electric vehicles (EVs). 

We bring fast and convenient EV charging directly to you, wherever you are. With Quick Charg, there's no need to worry about finding a charging station – we come to you. 

Key features and benefits:

On-Demand Charging: Schedule a Quick Charg unit to come to your location, whether it's at home, work, or on the road.

Fast Charging: Our advanced technology delivers rapid charging speeds, minimizing downtime for your electric vehicle.

Northern Plains Electric Cooperative is a member-owned electric distribution cooperative serving 11,711 on 6,721 miles of line in North Central North Dakota. Specifically, a 50-70 mile wide area from south of Jamestown, ND to the Canadian border.

Northern Plains is one of 16 distribution co-ops in the state; the largest geographically. Formed from the consolidation of Tri-County Electric Cooperative and Baker Electric Cooperative in 1997, Northern Plains is one of 640 electric cooperatives across the nation that are branding themselves as Touchstone Energy Partners. As a Touchstone Energy Partner, Northern Plains must undergo a compliance process every other year to document that it serves its customers with the highest levels of excellence. It must also provide evidence that it truly "has the power" of the Touchstone Energy brand: integrity, innovation, accountability and commitment to community.

Northern Plains distributes electricity supplied by Basin Electric Power Cooperative and Western Area Power Administration. A member of the North Dakota Association of Rural Electric Cooperatives and the National Rural Electric Cooperative Association, Northern Plains is governed by a board of directors that are elected by members in district elections held each year.

In 2007, Hawaii Water acquired the Pukalani Sewerage Treatment Works, a wastewater system serving 800 customers in Pukalani, located approximately 30 miles from the Ka’anapali District on Maui. And in 2008, Hawaii Water purchased the Waikoloa Water Utility, Waikoloa Sewer Utility, and Waikoloa Resort Utilities, also known as West Hawaii Utilities, which provide water and wastewater services to homes, condominiums, hotels, golf courses, and shops at Waikoloa Beach Resort and in Waikoloa Village, both on the Big Island of Hawaii. Name: Kern Delta Water District
Description:
Kern Delta Water District was formed in December of 1965 under Division 13 of the State Water Code for the purposes of protecting the Kern River Water Rights serving certain lands within the District, and to provide a means for contracting water through the State Water Project (SWP).  Although the District was formed in a relatively recent period of time, the canal systems that provide water to customers have existed since the late 1800's.  

Kern Delta currently serves Kern River and State water to approximately 90,000 irrigated acres through five different water rights:  Kern Island, Buena Vista, Stine, Farmers, and Eastside Canals.  The total length of these canals is over 126 miles, and all water is transported via gravity flow.

In 2014 the State of California passed the Sustainable Groundwater Management Act (SGMA). Kern Delta Water District has partnered with the City of Bakersfield and the Kern County Water Agency's "Improvement District No. 4" (ID4) in forming the Kern River Groundwater Sustainability Agency in order to provide a framework for groundwater management. Please click on the "Website" link below for further details.

Name: Western Gas Measurement Shortcourse - WGMSC
Description:
The Western Gas Measurement Short Course Board is a non-profit organization dedicated to education of gas industry personnel in the area of gas measurement and pressure control. WGMSC.

The objectives of the Western Gas Measurement Short Course are to collect and disseminate information available concerning equipment, operating and maintenance procedures and codes pertaining to the gas measurement and control sections for the natural gas industry. The Short Course seeks to improve the quality of service to the mutual benefit of the public and the gas industry, while advancing the knowledge and learning of the gas industry personnel. By allowing gas industry manufacturers to attend, the Short Course stimulates the development of new products, procedures, and research programs for the gas industry. And finally, the Short Course provides a clearing house of the exchange of information concerning the methods of study and instruction and the facilities available for further education in gas measurement and control.

The primary purpose of the Western Gas Measurement Short Course is to further the education of gas industry personnel in the specific areas of gas measurement and gas control. The Short Course is conducted at two (2) year intervals and is held in the month of May, unless changed by a vote of the General Board.

Name: AGM Communication & Control Ltd.
Description:
AGM is offering its knowledge and solutions in communications and control, and 33 years of experience in economical Asset Optimization, retrofit and upgrading projects for SCADA/DCS networks for Water /Wastewater, Energy, Oil & Gas, Industrial applications, Environmental telemetry, Power Sub-stations, Mining and Irrigation. 

To offer better solutions, AGM has developed an add-on element: an original communication management unit to be installed at the remote field stations between the PLC and the communication transceiver (RF and/or cellular or other), empowering the distributed system, making each station smarter and having the dramatic impact the PC revolution had on the "dumb terminals" organizational environment in the 1980s.
This original product, called R-Win, enables smart, gradual and economical SCADA/DCS network optimization and upgrading. 

Client benefits from AGM's asset optimization solutions, the R-Win way, include:
a)      Communication resilience by lateral communication (wireless MESH). Each remote pumping or monitoring station is able to carry out two-way, real-time communication with neighboring stations and the control center.  
Each site (oil/water pumping station, oil rig, piping hub, etc.) can have both cellular and RF communication, dual SIM networks and remote configuration.
b)      All stations can initiate communication; control center polling is not needed; local/regional autonomous control processes are a standard option. 
c)      Implementation of modern, high level data security.
d)      Existing system equipment and applications, at SCADA center and remote stations, stay in place.
e)      Internet access capability is an option for all stations under security limitations. Your server is the network manager; there is no need for third-party service except for your cellular communication provider.
f)       Integration with Preventive Maintenance applications.
g)      Smart Small Wastewater Works automation upgrade

Name: Central Municipal Power Agency/Services - CMPAS
Description:
Municipal Compass to Power

Central Municipal Power Agency/Services (CMPAS – pronounced “compass”) serves as a public power project-based, partial or full-requirements joint action agency. As the agent for Central Minnesota Municipal Power Agency and affiliates in Minnesota and Iowa, CMPAS identifies strategies that minimize wholesale power costs, manage future risks, and maintain stable and competitive rates. Aligned with its mission, CMPAS provides planning, procurement, and consultative services for power supply, transmission, electricity-market scheduling, and electric utility management. 

Value of Collaboration

At CMPAS, a public power utility can belong as either a partial or full-requirements member.  In contrast to a "one size fits all" full-requirements agency, the project-oriented approach of CMPAS allows members to remain autonomous while working together to solve common problems; create economies of scale; leverage purchasing power; and cost-share technical expertise for portfolio development, management, and administration.

Municipal electric utility members include Blue Earth, Delano, Fairfax, Glencoe, Granite Falls, Janesville, Kasson, Kenyon, Lake Crystal, Madelia, Mountain Lake, Sleepy Eye, Springfield, Truman, and Windom. The agency also partners with public power affiliates to lower and share costs of utility projects.

Consultative Role

As a strategic and fiduciary advisor, CMPAS delivers unbiased, independent portfolio system solutions that best serve the customers of municipal utilities. Each utility's portfolio is individually optimized taking into account locally-owned resources, legacy assets, and load factors. Project by project, CMPAS works in the best interest of each member as an extension of their staff. 

CMPAS.org
facebook.com/CMPASgroup
twitter.com/CMPASgroup

With a family atmosphere, we desire to move forward learning from past mistakes, and making changes to improve the future for success.

Name: Burton & Associates
Description:
For over 26 years, Burton & Associates has specialized in the provision of financial management services to local governments throughout the country. We offer extensive experience in financial forecasting, cost allocation, rate structure analysis, rate design, customer impact analyses, miscellaneous fee analyses, financial policy reviews, as well as stakeholder education and public outreach activities.  

Burton & Associates can help you meet your current and future financial goals. We have developed an empowering interactive decision support process which allows our clients to explore alternative financial plans and cost allocation scenarios in order to develop short and long term financial management plans, including appropriate rates and fees that will provide the necessary revenues to satisfy the annual cost of providing service. 

It is our philosophy that each client is unique. Each program that we recommend must be specific to their needs – reflecting their goals, objectives and political realities. 

Utility Economics has long been the cornerstone of our company. We regularly perform water, wastewater, reclaimed water, stormwater, solid waste, natural gas and other utility industry projects using our unique proprietary process. 

Our General Government Economics practice is rapidly expanding and is designed to effectively examine options relative to revenue diversification mechanisms in order to support financial sustainability.

Name: Michigan Solar and Roofing LLC
Description: Michigan Solar and Roofing is a Solar Energy Supplier and we proudly have our roots in Michigan so we understand the uniqueness of Michiganders and their needs. We leverage both our partners and our decades of experience in all aspects of the solar industry to ensure our customers consistently have the most efficient system in terms of both performance and price.  We have come to a point where we cannot be forced to rely on two utility company’s for our electricity and to make matters worse, those two companies aren't available in the same areas so they don't even have to compete with one another to earn our business. Michiganders have been burned when forced to rely on a utility company that has a monopoly on the market and do not need to wait to find out the hard way, the neglect of the national grid has been on full display through events like the blackouts caused by the snowstorm in Texas. Our goal is to provide Michigan residents and small businesses with an alternative to the utility companies that is more affordable, cleaner and more reliable.

Name: Power Generation and Control, Inc.
Description: Power Generation and Control, Inc performs service, repair, and installation of commercial generators.  Our technicians are trained to repair, and service all makes and models of generators and automatic transfer switches.  At PG&C we set the benchmark in customer service when it comes to the power generation field by making customers our #1 priority.

Name: Multifamily Energy Program Hub
Description:
This page serves as an information hub for energy efficiency and electrification programs for multifamily properties across California. Learn about incentives, design assistance, and energy solutions to upgrade equipment and save on energy bills. Our programs help reduce energy use and build a sustainable energy future. 

Featured programs include ESA Multifamily Energy Savings, California Energy-Smart Homes, Clean Energy Homes, Building Initiative for Low-Emissions Development (BUILD), California Electric Homes, California’s Low-Income Weatherization Program, and PG&E Single Point of Contact. 

This page is managed by TRC.

Name: St. Vrain Sanitation District
Description: St. Vrain Sanitation District has grown from serving a few local residents and businesses into a District serving over 15,000 business and residential customer accounts.  We provide service to the City of Dacono, the towns of Firestone and Frederick, portions of Mead, and areas of Weld County that are within our boundaries.  Those businesses and industries along the I-25 corridor, Highway 52 and 119, as well as some along Highway 66, are currently served by the St. Vrain Sanitation District.  Our District stretches from roughly the Boulder/Weld County Line on the west to the Platte River on the east and from Weld County Road 40 on the north to Weld County Road 6 on the south. Thanks to the vision and leadership from the Board of Directors, we continue to meet the needs of sanitary sewer service for many in the region.

Name: BIC Electric, LLC
Description:
BIC is driven by forward-thinking. We believe that a passionate, diverse, and transparent environment allows the best talent in our industry to thrive.

As a minority owned engineering and field services firm, BIC specializes in bridging the gap between substation design and construction for the electric utility industry. 

Some of the substation engineering services that we offer include:

Complete physical and protection & control (P&C) design
Grounding, lightning, and illumination studies
Project scoping and development

In addition to engineering, our field services team offers:
Substation construction
P&C construction
Relay testing and commissioning
Relay maintenance
Project management (Commissioning management)
Substation telecommunications

Name: Seagull PME
Description:
Seagull PME is a minority owned small business providing a wide range of engineering, planning, project management and consulting services. With offices in southern California and Texas, Seagull PME is positioned to provide a wide range of services to clients with a focus on developing innovative and sustainable solutions that ensure client success while meeting strategic goals.
 
Seagull PME’s diverse staff brings extensive experience both in the United States and abroad to three key business sectors serving large utilities, local and state municipalities, and the private sector.
 
Engineering
Providing a wide range of engineering services to include electric instrumentation and controls design, water engineering and design, industrial power engineering and design, gas transmission and distribution engineering and design, inspections, construction management and Owner’s Engineer services.
 
Planning
Extensive experience providing comprehensive design and planning for watershed quality and management, pipeline planning and design, grid resiliency, systems modeling (e.g., hydraulics, regulation, pumping and facility requirements) and watershed modeling.
 
Project / Program Management
Proven track record providing experienced project and program managers working directly for large utilities and respected engineering and design firms, leading teams of engineers, designers and planners.

Name: Signal Service, Inc
Description:
Signal Service has roots dating back to 1955. Today, Signal Service is a leading supplier of traffic control products and innovative traffic solutions. We create positive impact through our high-end engineering expertise and years of effective collaboration with the private and public sector.

In addition, our IMSA certified personnel provide 24 hour emergency and response maintenance on traffic management systems.

Name: Powerhouse Mechanical Repair, Inc.
Description:
Powerhouse Mechanical Repair, Inc. is an experienced group of technicians and engineers who specialize in eliminating the frustrations and worries that our customers and prospects experience with mechanical issues during planned and unplanned plant outages. Specifically, we work tirelessly to exceed expectations and provide around-the-clock emergency rush service when necessary to get our customers' facilities up and running better than ever.

We can perform this work on-site or in our 21,000 square feet facility, located in Charlotte, NC.From one-off prototype parts to larger production runs. Babbitted bearing repair to full steam turbine overhaul. From reverse engineering/manufacture of a new pump shaft to performing turnkey removal / overhaul / install / commission a multi-stage vertical turbine pump. We perform virtually all types of field machining from the most simple to complex projects involving custom-designed machinery.

In short, we are overachievers in eliminating your likely many frustrations in mechanical repair.

Name: Delta Energy & Communications, Inc.
Description:
We are a network, smart grid and big data company with a novel approach to bringing connective technology wherever there is electricity. Through a pioneering wireless wide area network (WWAN), we reduce the need for infrastructure build-out and work to deliver the Internet to underserved populations via Wi-Fi. Our advanced smart grid and analytics software solution is more accurate and faster than competing systems—and it pays for itself via efficiency gains and real-time energy theft detection. Finally, through unparalleled data collection and delivery opportunities, we can deliver and receive user data wherever there is electricity.

Essentially, we provide what no one else can in a singular, standardized and scalable solution: 
• Detection of energy theft to the utility
• Efficiencies and associated soft savings
• Industry leading latency and smart meter infrastructure
• Customer-centric approach to data transparency
• Unique IoT deployment opportunities for customers and partners
• Internet access wherever there is electricity

Delivering the above through our core values of dignity, emPOWERment, transparency and innovation, we work with our partners to improve the communities we serve.

Name: Association of Illinois Electric Cooperatives (AIEC)
Description:
The Association of Illinois Electric Cooperatives (AIEC) is the service organization for member electric and telephone cooperatives for the state of Illinois and their associate organizations. 

The AIEC provides its members with the advantages of a large utility operation without sacrificing the local control and local ownership essential to the spirit of these tax-paying Illinois businesses. To achieve this objective, the association provides a variety of services for its member-systems. These include engineering services, coordination of safety programs, training of line personnel, legislative research and information, member communication programs, printing and publications, public relations, and group purchasing of materials and supplies. The AIEC also publishes Illinois Country Living, which is distributed monthly to member-owners of subscribing electric cooperatives throughout the state. The magazine provides feature articles on rural lifestyles, as well as regular columns on energy efficiency, household safety, lawn and gardening, and country recipes.

Mission: To provide leadership, expertise and unity of purpose in support of the cooperative utilities of Illinois and their efforts to improve the quality of life for their members.

Name: Ross Valley Sanitary District
Description:
Established on May 27, 1899, Ross Valley Sanitary District is California's oldest district. The District serves Fairfax, San Anselmo, Ross, Larkspur, Bon Air, Sleepy Hollow, Kentfield, Kent Woodlands, Oak Manor, and Greenbrae.

The District operates and maintains approximately 200 miles of collection sewer lines and 19 pump stations, collecting, pumping, and transporting approximately four million gallons of wastewater per day to Central Marin Sanitation Agency for treatment. Approximately 60% of the District's collection system was installed before 1955.

The District's mission is to provide our customers with high-quality wastewater collection service through a system with no avoidable sanitary sewer overflows at the lowest sustainable cost to protect public health and the environment.

Description:
Dynamic Directional Boring LLC is a horizontal drilling company uniquely positioned to service its array of clientele throughout the United States.

Through experience in vertical drilling, directional horizontal drilling, cathodic drilling, and more, the extension of directional drilling within the United States was obvious business development. As opportunities to work with clients providing more and more underground and burial capabilities for electrical service, cable and fiber, camera systems, control systems, irrigation, plumbing, gas, sensors, and more, Dynamic Directional Boring has continued expanding. Currently operating multiple rigs, with the capacity to secure and lease specialty rigs as may be required by a project.

In addition to its own trencher, Dynamic Directional Boring utilizes subsidiary partners for specific trenching and plow-install projects. Dynamic also operates a bucket truck and oversees additional bucket trucks as well as derrick diggers, crane trucks and pot-holing crews. Dynamic is partner providing turn-key projects as well as specific scope of work engagements.

With projects ranging from service and extensions to new or existing cell towers, small cell and 5G project, pole setting and cable installation, DOT projects, private projects to government funded, Dynamic Directional Boring prides itself in being an agile leader in the industry.

In a world of constant change, devising the solution is only part of the battle – realizing the vision is what is fundamental to a truly transformational initiative. At R.P. Delio & Company you will find a committed partner, able to help you deliver on your need for change.
 
As a boutique consultancy, steeped in the pragmatic ethos of engineering business transformation, R.P. Delio & Company brings three decades of full-service consultancy –  encompassing engineering, procurement, construction and operations – to bear on the challenges of the new industrial age.
 
Our skill-set spans the intertwined fields of renewable energy, energy policy, leading-edge equipment procurement, process engineering and construction management. But it is our bold mind-set that makes R.P. Delio & Company an ideal and adept partner for a diverse array of challenging programs.
 
With both a global reach, and a local understanding, R.P. Delio & Company are experts at building success into program management, taking a holistic approach. Our bespoke project consulting services focus on the balanced integration of all facets of program management, including:

R. P. Delio & Company: Engineering Program Success since 1989.

Name: GST Power Service Group, Inc.
Description:
GST offers a vast range of maintenance and technical services including plant and substation startup, protective relay systems review, transformer testing, and more.

Our technicians have participated in training that includes AVO International’s Substation Maintenance Certification Program, Doble Engineering’s Power Factor Testing program, and SD Meyers Transformer Maintenance Institute.

Our professional engineering staff has extensive experience in the refinement of site-specific power distribution, protection, control, and instrumentation systems. They have designed, constructed, and placed in service a wide range of electrical systems.

GST uses the latest in electrical testing equipment manufactured by vendors such as AVO/MultiAmp/Megger, Biddle, Hipotronics, Fluke, Dranetz, Siemens, Schweitzer Engineering, Doble Engineering, Signalcrafters and others. All test equipment is calibrated per the manufactures' recommendations. Included in our equipment resources are a trailer mounted 480V Vacuum Oil Pump and Cryoquip’s SF6 Gas Reclaimer. (We are able to acquire additional equipment from a third-party supplier when necessary.) Software capabilities include SKM Power* Tools, AutoCAD and Doble/MPRT Modules necessary to conduct a wide variety of relay testing. All testing is performed in accordance with IEEE, ANSI, NETA, manufacturers and client's standards.

Wide-ranging employee knowledge, expansive equipment resources and the ability to deploy on a moments notice have provided GST with the benefits of a confident clientele. We have sustained substation maintenance contracts with major providers for over 10 years – and we are continually seeking new partnerships.

Description:
HR Co-op has 22 employees who provide electric service to approximately 3,900 meters and fixed wireless and fiber internet service to approximately 2,900 subscribers in the Hood River Valley in Oregon.  We have a team-oriented work environment and are focused on serving members reliably, affordably, and efficiently.

HR Co-op's service territory encompasses the middle and upper portions of the Hood River Valley in the Columbia River Gorge, including the unincorporated communities of Odell, Parkdale, and Mount Hood. The valley is bordered by the Columbia River to the north and by the Mt. Hood National Forest to the west, south, and east. The area is known for its tree fruit agriculture industry. Nearby outdoor recreation opportunities are abundant, including hiking, windsurfing, kiteboarding, skiing, mountain biking, whitewater sports, camping, and fishing.

Name: Bay City Electric Light & Power
Description:
Bay City Electric, Light & Power (BCELP) is a municipal utility, owned by the City of Bay City, Michigan.
We strive to offer value to our customers by providing reliable service at a competitive price.

BCELP has served the Bay City area since 1868 when it was known as the Bay City Gas Light Company.  Today we serve over 20,000 customers in our service area which includes Bay City and the surrounding townships of Bangor, Frankenlust, Hampton, Monitor, and Portsmouth. The utility is one of 2,000 community owned electric utilities that serves more than 42 million Americans.

Delivering service to our customers requires more than 500 miles of overhead and underground distribution lines, fed from 10 distribution substations.  Power is provided to these facilities from wholesale purchases, ownership of coal-fired generators Belle River and Campbell through the Michigan Public Power Agency,
and local peak-shaving generating capacity at our Water Street and Henry Street plants.

Name: Brevian Energy
Description: A Micro Grid is merely a smaller scale version of the larger electrical grid that powers our country. The electrical grid exists to supply our electricity demand, connecting electrical supply to electrical demand with the transmission and distribution system. Microgrids work in the same way, just for a smaller geographic area, like a couple of buildings or a local community. To meet the electricity demands of its users, a Micro Grid must have a generation source. Traditionally, the electricity supplied to Micro Grids has historically been from “behind the meter” fossil fuel generators – gas-powered generators, for example. However, with the rapid advancement in renewable energy technologies, today’s Microgrids are being designed to supply electricity with a combination of various renewable generation sources. When paired with versatile energy storage solutions, the combined generation sources can form an islanded system that detaches from the electrical grid. At Brevian Energy, we are committed to fighting the effects of climate change. Our mission is to bring affordable, reliable, renewable power to homes, businesses, and communities in every possible location.
